Surah 23 Al-Muminoon, Ayah 118: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “My Lord! Forgive and have mercy, for You are the best of those who show mercy.” | وقل رب اغفر وارحم وانت خير الراحمين

Surah 24 An-Noor, Ayah 1: ˹This is˺ a sûrah which We have revealed and made ˹its rulings˺ obligatory, and revealed in it clear commandments so that you may be mindful. | سورة انزلناها وفرضناها وانزلنا فيها ايات بينات لعلكم تذكرون

Surah 24 An-Noor, Ayah 2: As for female and male fornicators, give each of them one hundred lashes, and do not let pity for them make you lenient in ˹enforcing˺ the law of Allah, if you ˹truly˺ believe in Allah and the Last Day. And let a number of believers witness their punishment. | الزانية والزاني فاجلدوا كل واحد منهما مائة جلدة ولا تاخذكم بهما رافة في دين الله ان كنتم تؤمنون بالله واليوم الاخر وليشهد عذابهما طائفة من المؤمنين

Surah 24 An-Noor, Ayah 3: A male fornicator would only marry a female fornicator or idolatress. And a female fornicator would only be married to a fornicator or idolater. This is ˹all˺ forbidden to the believers. | الزاني لا ينكح الا زانية او مشركة والزانية لا ينكحها الا زان او مشرك وحرم ذلك على المؤمنين

Surah 24 An-Noor, Ayah 4: Those who accuse chaste women ˹of adultery˺ and fail to produce four witnesses, give them eighty lashes ˹each˺. And do not ever accept any testimony from them—for they are indeed the rebellious— | والذين يرمون المحصنات ثم لم ياتوا باربعة شهداء فاجلدوهم ثمانين جلدة ولا تقبلوا لهم شهادة ابدا واولئك هم الفاسقون
Surah 24 An-Noor, Ayah 5: except those who repent afterwards and mend their ways, then surely Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful. | الا الذين تابوا من بعد ذلك واصلحوا فان الله غفور رحيم

Surah 24 An-Noor, Ayah 6: And those who accuse their wives ˹of adultery˺ but have no witness except themselves, the accuser must testify, swearing four times by Allah that he is telling the truth | والذين يرمون ازواجهم ولم يكن لهم شهداء الا انفسهم فشهادة احدهم اربع شهادات بالله انه لمن الصادقين
Surah 24 An-Noor, Ayah 7: and a fifth oath that Allah may condemn him if he is lying. | والخامسة ان لعنت الله عليه ان كان من الكاذبين
Surah 24 An-Noor, Ayah 8: For her to be spared the punishment, she must swear four times by Allah that he is telling a lie | ويدرا عنها العذاب ان تشهد اربع شهادات بالله انه لمن الكاذبين
Surah 24 An-Noor, Ayah 9: and a fifth oath that Allah may be displeased with her if he is telling the truth. | والخامسة ان غضب الله عليها ان كان من الصادقين

Surah 24 An-Noor, Ayah 10: ˹You would have suffered,˺ had it not been for Allah’s grace and mercy upon you, and had Allah not been Accepting of Repentance, All-Wise. | ولولا فضل الله عليكم ورحمته وان الله تواب حكيم

Surah 24 An-Noor, Ayah 11: Indeed, those who came up with that ˹outrageous˺ slander are a group of you. Do not think this is bad for you. Rather, it is good for you. They will be punished, each according to their share of the sin. As for their mastermind, he will suffer a tremendous punishment. | ان الذين جاءوا بالافك عصبة منكم لا تحسبوه شرا لكم بل هو خير لكم لكل امرئ منهم ما اكتسب من الاثم والذي تولى كبره منهم له عذاب عظيم

Surah 24 An-Noor, Ayah 12: If only the believing men and women had thought well of one another, when you heard this ˹rumour˺, and said, “This is clearly ˹an outrageous˺ slander!” | لولا اذ سمعتموه ظن المؤمنون والمؤمنات بانفسهم خيرا وقالوا هذا افك مبين

Surah 24 An-Noor, Ayah 13: Why did they not produce four witnesses? Now, since they have failed to produce witnesses, they are ˹truly˺ liars in the sight of Allah. | لولا جاءوا عليه باربعة شهداء فاذ لم ياتوا بالشهداء فاولئك عند الله هم الكاذبون

Surah 24 An-Noor, Ayah 14: Had it not been for Allah’s grace and mercy upon you in this world and the Hereafter, you would have certainly been touched with a tremendous punishment for what you plunged into— | ولولا فضل الله عليكم ورحمته في الدنيا والاخرة لمسكم في ما افضتم فيه عذاب عظيم

Surah 24 An-Noor, Ayah 15: when you passed it from one tongue to the other, and said with your mouths what you had no knowledge of, taking it lightly while it is ˹extremely˺ serious in the sight of Allah. | اذ تلقونه بالسنتكم وتقولون بافواهكم ما ليس لكم به علم وتحسبونه هينا وهو عند الله عظيم

Surah 24 An-Noor, Ayah 16: If only you had said upon hearing it, “How can we speak about such a thing! Glory be to You ˹O Lord˺! This is a heinous slander!” | ولولا اذ سمعتموه قلتم ما يكون لنا ان نتكلم بهذا سبحانك هذا بهتان عظيم
Surah 24 An-Noor, Ayah 17: Allah forbids you from ever doing something like this again, if you are ˹true˺ believers. | يعظكم الله ان تعودوا لمثله ابدا ان كنتم مؤمنين
Surah 24 An-Noor, Ayah 18: And Allah makes ˹His˺ commandments clear to you, for Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise. | ويبين الله لكم الايات والله عليم حكيم

Surah 24 An-Noor, Ayah 19: Indeed, those who love to see indecency spread among the believers will suffer a painful punishment in this life and the Hereafter. Allah knows and you do not know. | ان الذين يحبون ان تشيع الفاحشة في الذين امنوا لهم عذاب اليم في الدنيا والاخرة والله يعلم وانتم لا تعلمون

Surah 24 An-Noor, Ayah 20: ˹You would have suffered,˺ had it not been for Allah’s grace and mercy upon you, and had Allah not been Ever Gracious, Most Merciful. | ولولا فضل الله عليكم ورحمته وان الله رءوف رحيم

Surah 24 An-Noor, Ayah 21: O believers! Do not follow the footsteps of Satan. Whoever follows Satan’s footsteps, then ˹let them know that˺ he surely bids ˹all to˺ immorality and wickedness. Had it not been for Allah’s grace and mercy upon you, none of you would have ever been purified. But Allah purifies whoever He wills. And Allah is All-Hearing, All-Knowing. | يا ايها الذين امنوا لا تتبعوا خطوات الشيطان ومن يتبع خطوات الشيطان فانه يامر بالفحشاء والمنكر ولولا فضل الله عليكم ورحمته ما زكى منكم من احد ابدا ولكن الله يزكي من يشاء والله سميع عليم

Surah 24 An-Noor, Ayah 22: Do not let the people of virtue and affluence among you swear to suspend donations to their relatives, the needy, and the emigrants in the cause of Allah. Let them pardon and forgive. Do you not love to be forgiven by Allah? And Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful. | ولا ياتل اولو الفضل منكم والسعة ان يؤتوا اولي القربى والمساكين والمهاجرين في سبيل الله وليعفوا وليصفحوا الا تحبون ان يغفر الله لكم والله غفور رحيم

Surah 24 An-Noor, Ayah 23: Surely those who accuse chaste, unsuspecting, believing women are cursed in this life and the Hereafter. And they will suffer a tremendous punishment | ان الذين يرمون المحصنات الغافلات المؤمنات لعنوا في الدنيا والاخرة ولهم عذاب عظيم
Surah 24 An-Noor, Ayah 24: on the Day their tongues, hands, and feet will testify against them for what they used to do. | يوم تشهد عليهم السنتهم وايديهم وارجلهم بما كانوا يعملون

Surah 24 An-Noor, Ayah 25: On that Day, Allah will give them their just penalty in full, and they will ˹come to˺ know that Allah ˹alone˺ is the Ultimate Truth. | يومئذ يوفيهم الله دينهم الحق ويعلمون ان الله هو الحق المبين

Surah 24 An-Noor, Ayah 26: Wicked women are for wicked men, and wicked men are for wicked women. And virtuous women are for virtuous men, and virtuous men are for virtuous women. The virtuous are innocent of what the wicked say. They will have forgiveness and an honourable provision. | الخبيثات للخبيثين والخبيثون للخبيثات والطيبات للطيبين والطيبون للطيبات اولئك مبرءون مما يقولون لهم مغفرة ورزق كريم

Surah 24 An-Noor, Ayah 27: O believers! Do not enter any house other than your own until you have asked for permission and greeted its occupants. This is best for you, so perhaps you will be mindful. | يا ايها الذين امنوا لا تدخلوا بيوتا غير بيوتكم حتى تستانسوا وتسلموا على اهلها ذلكم خير لكم لعلكم تذكرون

Surah 24 An-Noor, Ayah 28: If you find no one at home, do not enter it until you have been given permission. And if you are asked to leave, then leave. That is purer for you. And Allah has ˹perfect˺ knowledge of what you do. | فان لم تجدوا فيها احدا فلا تدخلوها حتى يؤذن لكم وان قيل لكم ارجعوا فارجعوا هو ازكى لكم والله بما تعملون عليم

Surah 24 An-Noor, Ayah 29: There is no blame on you if you enter public places where there is something of benefit for you. And Allah knows what you reveal and what you conceal. | ليس عليكم جناح ان تدخلوا بيوتا غير مسكونة فيها متاع لكم والله يعلم ما تبدون وما تكتمون

Surah 24 An-Noor, Ayah 30: ˹O Prophet!˺ Tell the believing men to lower their gaze and guard their chastity. That is purer for them. Surely Allah is All-Aware of what they do. | قل للمؤمنين يغضوا من ابصارهم ويحفظوا فروجهم ذلك ازكى لهم ان الله خبير بما يصنعون

Surah 24 An-Noor, Ayah 31: And tell the believing women to lower their gaze and guard their chastity, and not to reveal their adornments except what normally appears. Let them draw their veils over their chests, and not reveal their ˹hidden˺ adornments except to their husbands, their fathers, their fathers-in-law, their sons, their stepsons, their brothers, their brothers’ sons or sisters’ sons, their fellow women, those ˹bondwomen˺ in their possession, male attendants with no desire, or children who are still unaware of women’s nakedness. Let them not stomp their feet, drawing attention to their hidden adornments. Turn to Allah in repentance all together, O  believers, so that you may be successful. | وقل للمؤمنات يغضضن من ابصارهن ويحفظن فروجهن ولا يبدين زينتهن الا ما ظهر منها وليضربن بخمرهن على جيوبهن ولا يبدين زينتهن الا لبعولتهن او ابائهن او اباء بعولتهن او ابنائهن او ابناء بعولتهن او اخوانهن او بني اخوانهن او بني اخواتهن او نسائهن او ما ملكت ايمانهن او التابعين غير اولي الاربة من الرجال او الطفل الذين لم يظهروا على عورات النساء ولا يضربن بارجلهن ليعلم ما يخفين من زينتهن وتوبوا الى الله جميعا ايه المؤمنون لعلكم تفلحون

Surah 24 An-Noor, Ayah 32: Marry off the ˹free˺ singles among you, as well as the righteous of your bondmen and bondwomen. If they are poor, Allah will enrich them out of His bounty. For Allah is All-Bountiful, All-Knowing. | وانكحوا الايامى منكم والصالحين من عبادكم وامائكم ان يكونوا فقراء يغنهم الله من فضله والله واسع عليم

Surah 24 An-Noor, Ayah 33: And let those who do not have the means to marry keep themselves chaste until Allah enriches them out of His bounty. And if any of those ˹bondspeople˺ in your possession desires a deed of emancipation, make it possible for them, if you find goodness in them. And give them some of Allah’s wealth which He has granted you. Do not force your ˹slave˺ girls into prostitution for your own worldly gains while they wish to remain chaste. And if someone coerces them, then after such a coercion Allah is certainly All-Forgiving, Most Merciful ˹to them˺. | وليستعفف الذين لا يجدون نكاحا حتى يغنيهم الله من فضله والذين يبتغون الكتاب مما ملكت ايمانكم فكاتبوهم ان علمتم فيهم خيرا واتوهم من مال الله الذي اتاكم ولا تكرهوا فتياتكم على البغاء ان اردن تحصنا لتبتغوا عرض الحياة الدنيا ومن يكرههن فان الله من بعد اكراههن غفور رحيم

Surah 24 An-Noor, Ayah 34: Indeed, We have sent down to you clear revelations, along with examples of those who had gone before you, and a lesson to the God-fearing. | ولقد انزلنا اليكم ايات مبينات ومثلا من الذين خلوا من قبلكم وموعظة للمتقين

Surah 24 An-Noor, Ayah 35: Allah is the Light of the heavens and the earth. His light is like a niche in which there is a lamp, the lamp is in a crystal, the crystal is like a shining star, lit from ˹the oil of˺ a blessed olive tree, ˹located˺ neither to the east nor the west, whose oil would almost glow, even without being touched by fire. Light upon light! Allah guides whoever He wills to His light. And Allah sets forth parables for humanity. For Allah has ˹perfect˺ knowledge of all things. | الله نور السماوات والارض مثل نوره كمشكاة فيها مصباح المصباح في زجاجة الزجاجة كانها كوكب دري يوقد من شجرة مباركة زيتونة لا شرقية ولا غربية يكاد زيتها يضيء ولو لم تمسسه نار نور على نور يهدي الله لنوره من يشاء ويضرب الله الامثال للناس والله بكل شيء عليم

Surah 24 An-Noor, Ayah 36: ˹That light shines˺ through houses ˹of worship˺ which Allah has ordered to be raised, and where His Name is mentioned. He is glorified there morning and evening | في بيوت اذن الله ان ترفع ويذكر فيها اسمه يسبح له فيها بالغدو والاصال

Surah 24 An-Noor, Ayah 37: by men who are not distracted—either by buying or selling—from Allah’s remembrance, or performing prayer, or paying alms-tax. They fear a Day when hearts and eyes will tremble | رجال لا تلهيهم تجارة ولا بيع عن ذكر الله واقام الصلاة وايتاء الزكاة يخافون يوما تتقلب فيه القلوب والابصار

Surah 24 An-Noor, Ayah 38: ˹hoping˺ that Allah may reward them according to the best of their deeds, and increase them out of His grace. And Allah provides for whoever He wills without limit. | ليجزيهم الله احسن ما عملوا ويزيدهم من فضله والله يرزق من يشاء بغير حساب

Surah 24 An-Noor, Ayah 39: As for the disbelievers, their deeds are like a mirage in a desert, which the thirsty perceive as water, but when they approach it, they find it to be nothing. Instead, they find Allah there ˹in the Hereafter, ready˺ to settle their account. And Allah is swift in reckoning. | والذين كفروا اعمالهم كسراب بقيعة يحسبه الظمان ماء حتى اذا جاءه لم يجده شيئا ووجد الله عنده فوفاه حسابه والله سريع الحساب

Surah 24 An-Noor, Ayah 40: Or ˹their deeds are˺ like the darkness in a deep sea, covered by waves upon waves, topped by ˹dark˺ clouds. Darkness upon darkness! If one stretches out their hand, they can hardly see it. And whoever Allah does not bless with light will have no light! | او كظلمات في بحر لجي يغشاه موج من فوقه موج من فوقه سحاب ظلمات بعضها فوق بعض اذا اخرج يده لم يكد يراها ومن لم يجعل الله له نورا فما له من نور

Surah 24 An-Noor, Ayah 41: Do you not see that Allah is glorified by all those in the heavens and the earth, even the birds as they soar? Each ˹instinctively˺ knows their manner of prayer and glorification. And Allah has ˹perfect˺ knowledge of all they do. | الم تر ان الله يسبح له من في السماوات والارض والطير صافات كل قد علم صلاته وتسبيحه والله عليم بما يفعلون
Surah 24 An-Noor, Ayah 42: To Allah ˹alone˺ belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth. And to Allah is the final return. | ولله ملك السماوات والارض والى الله المصير

Surah 24 An-Noor, Ayah 43: Do you not see that Allah gently drives the clouds, then joins them together, piling them up into masses, from which you see raindrops come forth? And He sends down from the sky mountains ˹of clouds˺ loaded with hail, pouring it on whoever He wills and averting it from whoever He wills. The flash of the clouds’ lightning nearly takes away eyesight. | الم تر ان الله يزجي سحابا ثم يؤلف بينه ثم يجعله ركاما فترى الودق يخرج من خلاله وينزل من السماء من جبال فيها من برد فيصيب به من يشاء ويصرفه عن من يشاء يكاد سنا برقه يذهب بالابصار
Surah 24 An-Noor, Ayah 44: Allah alternates the day and night. Surely in this is a lesson for people of insight. | يقلب الله الليل والنهار ان في ذلك لعبرة لاولي الابصار

Surah 24 An-Noor, Ayah 45: And Allah has created from water every living creature. Some of them crawl on their bellies, some walk on two legs, and some walk on four. Allah creates whatever He wills. Surely Allah is Most Capable of everything. | والله خلق كل دابة من ماء فمنهم من يمشي على بطنه ومنهم من يمشي على رجلين ومنهم من يمشي على اربع يخلق الله ما يشاء ان الله على كل شيء قدير

Surah 24 An-Noor, Ayah 46: We have indeed sent down revelations clarifying ˹the truth˺. But Allah ˹only˺ guides whoever He wills to the Straight Path. | لقد انزلنا ايات مبينات والله يهدي من يشاء الى صراط مستقيم

Surah 24 An-Noor, Ayah 47: And the hypocrites say, “We believe in Allah and the Messenger, and we obey.” Then a group of them turns away soon after that. These are not ˹true˺ believers. | ويقولون امنا بالله وبالرسول واطعنا ثم يتولى فريق منهم من بعد ذلك وما اولئك بالمؤمنين

Surah 24 An-Noor, Ayah 48: And as soon as they are called to Allah and His Messenger so he may judge between them, a group of them turns away. | واذا دعوا الى الله ورسوله ليحكم بينهم اذا فريق منهم معرضون
Surah 24 An-Noor, Ayah 49: But if the truth is in their favour, they come to him, fully submitting. | وان يكن لهم الحق ياتوا اليه مذعنين

Surah 24 An-Noor, Ayah 50: Is there a sickness in their hearts? Or are they in doubt? Or do they fear that Allah and His Messenger will be unjust to them? In fact, it is they who are the ˹true˺ wrongdoers. | افي قلوبهم مرض ام ارتابوا ام يخافون ان يحيف الله عليهم ورسوله بل اولئك هم الظالمون

Surah 24 An-Noor, Ayah 51: The only response of the ˹true˺ believers, when they are called to Allah and His Messenger so he may judge between them, is to say, “We hear and obey.” It is they who will ˹truly˺ succeed. | انما كان قول المؤمنين اذا دعوا الى الله ورسوله ليحكم بينهم ان يقولوا سمعنا واطعنا واولئك هم المفلحون

Surah 24 An-Noor, Ayah 52: For whoever obeys Allah and His Messenger, and fears Allah and is mindful of Him, then it is they who will ˹truly˺ triumph. | ومن يطع الله ورسوله ويخش الله ويتقه فاولئك هم الفائزون

Surah 24 An-Noor, Ayah 53: They swear by Allah their most solemn oaths that if you ˹O Prophet˺ were to command them, they would certainly march forth ˹in Allah’s cause˺. Say, “˹You˺ do not ˹have to˺ swear; your obedience is well known!” Surely Allah is All-Aware of what you do.” | واقسموا بالله جهد ايمانهم لئن امرتهم ليخرجن قل لا تقسموا طاعة معروفة ان الله خبير بما تعملون

Surah 24 An-Noor, Ayah 54: Say, “Obey Allah and obey the Messenger. But if you turn away, then he is only responsible for his duty and you are responsible for yours. And if you obey him, you will be ˹rightly˺ guided. The Messenger’s duty is only to deliver ˹the message˺ clearly.” | قل اطيعوا الله واطيعوا الرسول فان تولوا فانما عليه ما حمل وعليكم ما حملتم وان تطيعوه تهتدوا وما على الرسول الا البلاغ المبين

Surah 24 An-Noor, Ayah 55: Allah has promised those of you who believe and do good that He will certainly make them successors in the land, as He did with those before them; and will surely establish for them their faith which He has chosen for them; and will indeed change their fear into security—˹provided that˺ they worship Me, associating nothing with Me. But whoever disbelieves after this ˹promise˺, it is they who will be the rebellious. | وعد الله الذين امنوا منكم وعملوا الصالحات ليستخلفنهم في الارض كما استخلف الذين من قبلهم وليمكنن لهم دينهم الذي ارتضى لهم وليبدلنهم من بعد خوفهم امنا يعبدونني لا يشركون بي شيئا ومن كفر بعد ذلك فاولئك هم الفاسقون
Surah 24 An-Noor, Ayah 56: Moreover, establish prayer, pay alms-tax, and obey the Messenger, so you may be shown mercy. | واقيموا الصلاة واتوا الزكاة واطيعوا الرسول لعلكم ترحمون

Surah 24 An-Noor, Ayah 57: Do not think ˹O Prophet˺ that the disbelievers can escape in the land. The Fire will be their home. Indeed, what an evil destination! | لا تحسبن الذين كفروا معجزين في الارض وماواهم النار ولبئس المصير

Surah 24 An-Noor, Ayah 58: O believers! Let those ˹bondspeople˺ in your possession and those of you who are still under age ask for your permission ˹to come in˺ at three times: before dawn prayer, when you take off your ˹outer˺ clothes at noon, and after the late evening prayer. ˹These are˺ three times of privacy for you. Other than these times, there is no blame on you or them to move freely, attending to one another. This is how Allah makes the revelations clear to you, for Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise. | يا ايها الذين امنوا ليستاذنكم الذين ملكت ايمانكم والذين لم يبلغوا الحلم منكم ثلاث مرات من قبل صلاة الفجر وحين تضعون ثيابكم من الظهيرة ومن بعد صلاة العشاء ثلاث عورات لكم ليس عليكم ولا عليهم جناح بعدهن طوافون عليكم بعضكم على بعض كذلك يبين الله لكم الايات والله عليم حكيم

Surah 24 An-Noor, Ayah 59: And when your children reach the age of puberty, let them seek permission ˹to come in˺, as their seniors do. This is how Allah makes His revelations clear to you, for Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise. | واذا بلغ الاطفال منكم الحلم فليستاذنوا كما استاذن الذين من قبلهم كذلك يبين الله لكم اياته والله عليم حكيم

Surah 24 An-Noor, Ayah 60: As for elderly women past the age of marriage, there is no blame on them if they take off their ˹outer˺ garments, without revealing their adornments. But it is better for them if they avoid this ˹altogether˺. And Allah is All-Hearing, All-Knowing. | والقواعد من النساء اللاتي لا يرجون نكاحا فليس عليهن جناح ان يضعن ثيابهن غير متبرجات بزينة وان يستعففن خير لهن والله سميع عليم

Surah 24 An-Noor, Ayah 61: There is no restriction on the blind, or the disabled, or the sick. Nor on yourselves if you eat from your homes, or the homes of your fathers, or your mothers, or your brothers, or your sisters, or your paternal uncles, or your paternal aunts, or your maternal uncles, or your maternal aunts, or from the homes in your trust, or ˹the homes of˺ your friends. There is no blame on you eating together or separately. However, when you enter houses, greet one another with a greeting ˹of peace˺ from Allah, blessed and good. This is how Allah makes His revelations clear to you, so perhaps you will understand. | ليس على الاعمى حرج ولا على الاعرج حرج ولا على المريض حرج ولا على انفسكم ان تاكلوا من بيوتكم او بيوت ابائكم او بيوت امهاتكم او بيوت اخوانكم او بيوت اخواتكم او بيوت اعمامكم او بيوت عماتكم او بيوت اخوالكم او بيوت خالاتكم او ما ملكتم مفاتحه او صديقكم ليس عليكم جناح ان تاكلوا جميعا او اشتاتا فاذا دخلتم بيوتا فسلموا على انفسكم تحية من عند الله مباركة طيبة كذلك يبين الله لكم الايات لعلكم تعقلون

Surah 24 An-Noor, Ayah 62: The ˹true˺ believers are only those who believe in Allah and His Messenger, and when they are with him on a public matter, they do not leave without his permission. Indeed, those who ask your permission ˹O Prophet˺ are the ones who ˹truly˺ believe in Allah and His Messenger. So when they ask your permission for a private matter, grant permission to whoever you wish and ask Allah’s forgiveness for them. Surely Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful. | انما المؤمنون الذين امنوا بالله ورسوله واذا كانوا معه على امر جامع لم يذهبوا حتى يستاذنوه ان الذين يستاذنونك اولئك الذين يؤمنون بالله ورسوله فاذا استاذنوك لبعض شانهم فاذن لمن شئت منهم واستغفر لهم الله ان الله غفور رحيم

Surah 24 An-Noor, Ayah 63: Do not treat the Messenger’s summons to you ˹as lightly˺ as your summons to one another. Allah certainly knows those of you who slip away, hiding behind others. So let those who disobey his orders beware, for an affliction may befall them, or a painful torment may overtake them. | لا تجعلوا دعاء الرسول بينكم كدعاء بعضكم بعضا قد يعلم الله الذين يتسللون منكم لواذا فليحذر الذين يخالفون عن امره ان تصيبهم فتنة او يصيبهم عذاب اليم

Surah 24 An-Noor, Ayah 64: Surely to Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth. He knows well what you stand for. And ˹on˺ the Day all will be returned to Him, He will inform them of what they did. For Allah has ˹perfect˺ knowledge of all things. | الا ان لله ما في السماوات والارض قد يعلم ما انتم عليه ويوم يرجعون اليه فينبئهم بما عملوا والله بكل شيء عليم
Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 1: Blessed is the One Who sent down the Standard to His servant, so that he may be a warner to the whole world. | تبارك الذي نزل الفرقان على عبده ليكون للعالمين نذيرا

Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 2: ˹Allah is˺ the One to Whom belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth, Who has never had ˹any˺ offspring, nor does He have a partner in ˹governing˺ the kingdom. He has created everything, ordaining it precisely. | الذي له ملك السماوات والارض ولم يتخذ ولدا ولم يكن له شريك في الملك وخلق كل شيء فقدره تقديرا

Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 3: Yet they have taken besides Him gods who cannot create anything but are themselves created. Nor can they protect or benefit themselves. Nor can they control life, death, or resurrection. | واتخذوا من دونه الهة لا يخلقون شيئا وهم يخلقون ولا يملكون لانفسهم ضرا ولا نفعا ولا يملكون موتا ولا حياة ولا نشورا

Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 4: The disbelievers say, “This ˹Quran˺ is nothing but a fabrication which he made up with the help of others.” Their claim is totally unjustified and untrue! | وقال الذين كفروا ان هذا الا افك افتراه واعانه عليه قوم اخرون فقد جاءوا ظلما وزورا

Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 5: And they say, “˹These revelations are only˺ ancient fables which he has had written down, and they are rehearsed to him morning and evening.” | وقالوا اساطير الاولين اكتتبها فهي تملى عليه بكرة واصيلا

Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 6: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “This ˹Quran˺ has been revealed by the One Who knows the secrets of the heavens and the earth. Surely He is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.” | قل انزله الذي يعلم السر في السماوات والارض انه كان غفورا رحيما

Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 7: And they say ˹mockingly˺, “What kind of messenger is this who eats food and goes about in market-places ˹for a living˺? If only an angel had been sent down with him to be his co-warner | وقالوا مال هذا الرسول ياكل الطعام ويمشي في الاسواق لولا انزل اليه ملك فيكون معه نذيرا

Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 8: or a treasure had been cast down to him, or he had had a garden from which he may eat!” And the wrongdoers say ˹to the believers˺, “You are only following a bewitched man.” | او يلقى اليه كنز او تكون له جنة ياكل منها وقال الظالمون ان تتبعون الا رجلا مسحورا
Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 9: See ˹O Prophet˺ how they call you names! So they have gone so ˹far˺ astray that they cannot find the ˹Right˺ Way. | انظر كيف ضربوا لك الامثال فضلوا فلا يستطيعون سبيلا

Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 10: Blessed is the One Who—if He wills—can give you far better than ˹all˺ that: gardens under which rivers flow, and palaces as well. | تبارك الذي ان شاء جعل لك خيرا من ذلك جنات تجري من تحتها الانهار ويجعل لك قصورا
Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 11: In fact, they deny the Hour. And for the deniers of the Hour, We have prepared a blazing Fire. | بل كذبوا بالساعة واعتدنا لمن كذب بالساعة سعيرا
Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 12: Once it sees them from a distance, they will hear it fuming and growling. | اذا راتهم من مكان بعيد سمعوا لها تغيظا وزفيرا

Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 13: And when they are tossed into a narrow place inside ˹Hell˺, chained together, then and there they will cry out for ˹instant˺ destruction. | واذا القوا منها مكانا ضيقا مقرنين دعوا هنالك ثبورا
Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 14: ˹They will be told,˺ “Do not cry only once for destruction, but cry many times over!” | لا تدعوا اليوم ثبورا واحدا وادعوا ثبورا كثيرا

Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 15: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Is this better or the Garden of Eternity which the righteous have been promised, as a reward and ˹an ultimate˺ destination? | قل اذلك خير ام جنة الخلد التي وعد المتقون كانت لهم جزاء ومصيرا
Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 16: There they will have whatever they wish for, forever. That is a promise ˹to be sought after˺, binding on your Lord.” | لهم فيها ما يشاءون خالدين كان على ربك وعدا مسئولا

Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 17: ˹Watch for˺ the Day He will gather them along with what they used to worship besides Allah, and ask ˹the objects of worship˺, “Was it you who misled these servants of Mine, or did they stray from the Way ˹on their own˺?” | ويوم يحشرهم وما يعبدون من دون الله فيقول اانتم اضللتم عبادي هؤلاء ام هم ضلوا السبيل

Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 18: They will say, “Glory be to You! It was not right for ˹others like˺ us to take any lords besides You, but You allowed enjoyment for them and their forefathers ˹for so long˺ that they forgot ˹Your˺ remembrance and became a doomed people.” | قالوا سبحانك ما كان ينبغي لنا ان نتخذ من دونك من اولياء ولكن متعتهم واباءهم حتى نسوا الذكر وكانوا قوما بورا

Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 19: ˹The doomed will be told˺, “Your gods have clearly denied your claims. So now you can neither ward off ˹the punishment˺ nor get any help.” And whoever of you does wrong, We will make them taste a horrible punishment. | فقد كذبوكم بما تقولون فما تستطيعون صرفا ولا نصرا ومن يظلم منكم نذقه عذابا كبيرا

Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 20: We never sent any messenger before you ˹O Prophet˺, who did not eat food and go about in market-places. We have made some of you a trial for others. Will you ˹not then˺ be patient? And your Lord is All-Seeing. | وما ارسلنا قبلك من المرسلين الا انهم لياكلون الطعام ويمشون في الاسواق وجعلنا بعضكم لبعض فتنة اتصبرون وكان ربك بصيرا

Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 21: Those who do not expect to meet Us say, “If only the angels were sent down to us, or we could see our Lord!” They have certainly been carried away by their arrogance and have entirely exceeded all limits. | وقال الذين لا يرجون لقاءنا لولا انزل علينا الملائكة او نرى ربنا لقد استكبروا في انفسهم وعتوا عتوا كبيرا

Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 22: ˹But˺ on the Day they will see the angels, there will be no good news for the wicked, who will cry, “Keep away! Away ˹from us˺!” | يوم يرون الملائكة لا بشرى يومئذ للمجرمين ويقولون حجرا محجورا
Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 23: Then We will turn to whatever ˹good˺ deeds they did, reducing them to scattered dust. | وقدمنا الى ما عملوا من عمل فجعلناه هباء منثورا
Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 24: ˹But˺ on that Day the residents of Paradise will have the best settlement and the finest place to rest. | اصحاب الجنة يومئذ خير مستقرا واحسن مقيلا
Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 25: ˹Watch for˺ the Day the heavens will burst with clouds, and the angels will be sent down in successive ranks. | ويوم تشقق السماء بالغمام ونزل الملائكة تنزيلا

Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 26: True authority on that Day will belong ˹only˺ to the Most Compassionate. And it will be a hard day for the disbelievers. | الملك يومئذ الحق للرحمن وكان يوما على الكافرين عسيرا

Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 27: And ˹beware of˺ the Day the wrongdoer will bite his nails ˹in regret˺ and say, “Oh! I wish I had followed the Way along with the Messenger! | ويوم يعض الظالم على يديه يقول يا ليتني اتخذت مع الرسول سبيلا
Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 28: Woe to me! I wish I had never taken so-and-so as a close friend. | يا ويلتى ليتني لم اتخذ فلانا خليلا

Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 29: It was he who truly made me stray from the Reminder after it had reached me.” And Satan has always betrayed humanity. | لقد اضلني عن الذكر بعد اذ جاءني وكان الشيطان للانسان خذولا
Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 30: The Messenger has cried, “O my Lord! My people have indeed received this Quran with neglect.” | وقال الرسول يا رب ان قومي اتخذوا هذا القران مهجورا

Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 31: Similarly, We made enemies for every prophet from among the wicked, but sufficient is your Lord as a Guide and Helper. | وكذلك جعلنا لكل نبي عدوا من المجرمين وكفى بربك هاديا ونصيرا

Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 32: The disbelievers say, “If only the Quran had been sent down to him all at once!” ˹We have sent it˺ as such ˹in stages˺ so We may reassure your heart with it. And We have revealed it at a deliberate pace. | وقال الذين كفروا لولا نزل عليه القران جملة واحدة كذلك لنثبت به فؤادك ورتلناه ترتيلا
Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 33: Whenever they bring you an argument, We come to you with the right refutation and the best explanation. | ولا ياتونك بمثل الا جئناك بالحق واحسن تفسيرا

Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 34: Those who will be dragged into Hell on their faces will be in the worst place, and are ˹now˺ farthest from the ˹Right˺ Way. | الذين يحشرون على وجوههم الى جهنم اولئك شر مكانا واضل سبيلا
Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 35: We certainly gave Moses the Book and appointed his brother Aaron as his helper. | ولقد اتينا موسى الكتاب وجعلنا معه اخاه هارون وزيرا
Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 36: We had ordered ˹them˺, “Go to the people who would deny Our signs.” Then We annihilated the deniers entirely. | فقلنا اذهبا الى القوم الذين كذبوا باياتنا فدمرناهم تدميرا

Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 37: And when the people of Noah rejected the messengers, We drowned them, making them an example to humanity. And We have prepared a painful punishment for the wrongdoers. | وقوم نوح لما كذبوا الرسل اغرقناهم وجعلناهم للناس اية واعتدنا للظالمين عذابا اليما
Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 38: Also ˹We destroyed˺ ’Ȃd, Thamûd, and the people of the Water-pit, as well as many peoples in between. | وعادا وثمود واصحاب الرس وقرونا بين ذلك كثيرا
Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 39: For each We set forth ˹various˺ lessons, and We ultimately destroyed each. | وكلا ضربنا له الامثال وكلا تبرنا تتبيرا

Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 40: They have certainly passed by the city ˹of Sodom˺, which had been showered with a dreadful rain ˹of stones˺. Have they not seen its ruins? But they do not expect to be resurrected. | ولقد اتوا على القرية التي امطرت مطر السوء افلم يكونوا يرونها بل كانوا لا يرجون نشورا

Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 41: When they see you ˹O Prophet˺, they only make fun of you, ˹saying,˺ “Is this the one that Allah has sent as a messenger? | واذا راوك ان يتخذونك الا هزوا اهذا الذي بعث الله رسولا

Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 42: He would have almost tricked us away from our gods, had we not been so devoted to them.” ˹But˺ soon they will know, when they face the punishment, who is far astray from the ˹Right˺ Way. | ان كاد ليضلنا عن الهتنا لولا ان صبرنا عليها وسوف يعلمون حين يرون العذاب من اضل سبيلا
Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 43: Have you seen ˹O Prophet˺ the one who has taken their own desires as their god? Will you then be a keeper over them? | ارايت من اتخذ الهه هواه افانت تكون عليه وكيلا

Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 44: Or do you think that most of them listen or understand? They are only like cattle—no, more than that, they are astray from the ˹Right˺ Way! | ام تحسب ان اكثرهم يسمعون او يعقلون ان هم الا كالانعام بل هم اضل سبيلا

Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 45: Have you not seen how your Lord extends the shade—He could have simply made it ˹remain˺ still if He so willed—then We make the sun its guide | الم تر الى ربك كيف مد الظل ولو شاء لجعله ساكنا ثم جعلنا الشمس عليه دليلا
Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 46: causing the shade to retreat gradually? | ثم قبضناه الينا قبضا يسيرا

Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 47: He is the One Who has made the night for you as a cover, and ˹made˺ sleep for resting, and the day for rising. | وهو الذي جعل لكم الليل لباسا والنوم سباتا وجعل النهار نشورا

Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 48: And He is the One Who sends the winds ushering in His mercy, and We send down pure rain from the sky | وهو الذي ارسل الرياح بشرا بين يدي رحمته وانزلنا من السماء ماء طهورا
Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 49: giving life to a lifeless land, and providing water for countless animals and humans of Our Own creation. | لنحيي به بلدة ميتا ونسقيه مما خلقنا انعاما واناسي كثيرا
Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 50: We certainly disperse it among them so they may be mindful, but most people persist in ungratefulness. | ولقد صرفناه بينهم ليذكروا فابى اكثر الناس الا كفورا
Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 51: Had We willed, We could have easily sent a warner to every society. | ولو شئنا لبعثنا في كل قرية نذيرا
Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 52: So do not yield to the disbelievers, but strive diligently against them with this ˹Quran˺. | فلا تطع الكافرين وجاهدهم به جهادا كبيرا

Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 53: And He is the One Who merges the two bodies of water: one fresh and palatable and the other salty and bitter, placing between them a barrier they cannot cross. | وهو الذي مرج البحرين هذا عذب فرات وهذا ملح اجاج وجعل بينهما برزخا وحجرا محجورا

Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 54: And He is the One Who creates human beings from a ˹humble˺ liquid, then establishes for them bonds of kinship and marriage. For your Lord is Most Capable. | وهو الذي خلق من الماء بشرا فجعله نسبا وصهرا وكان ربك قديرا

Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 55: Yet they worship besides Allah what can neither benefit nor harm them. And the disbeliever always collaborates against their Lord. | ويعبدون من دون الله ما لا ينفعهم ولا يضرهم وكان الكافر على ربه ظهيرا
Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 56: And We have sent you ˹O Prophet˺ only as a deliverer of good news and a warner. | وما ارسلناك الا مبشرا ونذيرا

Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 57: Say, “I do not ask you for any reward for this ˹message˺, but whoever wishes, let them pursue the Way to their Lord.” | قل ما اسالكم عليه من اجر الا من شاء ان يتخذ الى ربه سبيلا

Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 58: Put your trust in the Ever-Living, Who never dies, and glorify His praises. Sufficient is He as All-Aware of the sins of His servants. | وتوكل على الحي الذي لا يموت وسبح بحمده وكفى به بذنوب عباده خبيرا

Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 59: ˹He is˺ the One Who created the heavens and the earth and everything in between in six Days, then established Himself on the Throne. ˹He is˺ the Most Compassionate! Ask ˹none other than˺ the All-Knowledgeable about Himself. | الذي خلق السماوات والارض وما بينهما في ستة ايام ثم استوى على العرش الرحمن فاسال به خبيرا

Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 60: When it is said to them, “Prostrate to the Most Compassionate,” they ask ˹in disgust˺, “What is ‘the Most Compassionate’? Will we prostrate to whatever you order us to?” And it only drives them farther away. | واذا قيل لهم اسجدوا للرحمن قالوا وما الرحمن انسجد لما تامرنا وزادهم نفورا

Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 61: Blessed is the One Who has placed constellations in the sky, as well as a ˹radiant˺ lamp and a luminous moon. | تبارك الذي جعل في السماء بروجا وجعل فيها سراجا وقمرا منيرا

Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 62: And He is the One Who causes the day and the night to alternate, ˹as a sign˺ for whoever desires to be mindful or to be grateful. | وهو الذي جعل الليل والنهار خلفة لمن اراد ان يذكر او اراد شكورا

Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 63: The ˹true˺ servants of the Most Compassionate are those who walk on the earth humbly, and when the foolish address them ˹improperly˺, they only respond with peace. | وعباد الرحمن الذين يمشون على الارض هونا واذا خاطبهم الجاهلون قالوا سلاما
Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 64: ˹They are˺ those who spend ˹a good portion of˺ the night, prostrating themselves and standing before their Lord. | والذين يبيتون لربهم سجدا وقياما

Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 65: ˹They are˺ those who pray, “Our Lord! Keep the punishment of Hell away from us, for its punishment is indeed unrelenting. | والذين يقولون ربنا اصرف عنا عذاب جهنم ان عذابها كان غراما
Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 66: It is certainly an evil place to settle and reside.” | انها ساءت مستقرا ومقاما
Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 67: ˹They are˺ those who spend neither wastefully nor stingily, but moderately in between. | والذين اذا انفقوا لم يسرفوا ولم يقتروا وكان بين ذلك قواما

Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 68: ˹They are˺ those who do not invoke any other god besides Allah, nor take a ˹human˺ life—made sacred by Allah—except with ˹legal˺ right, nor commit fornication. And whoever does ˹any of˺ this will face the penalty. | والذين لا يدعون مع الله الها اخر ولا يقتلون النفس التي حرم الله الا بالحق ولا يزنون ومن يفعل ذلك يلق اثاما
Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 69: Their punishment will be multiplied on the Day of Judgment, and they will remain in it forever, in disgrace. | يضاعف له العذاب يوم القيامة ويخلد فيه مهانا

Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 70: As for those who repent, believe, and do good deeds, they are the ones whose evil deeds Allah will change into good deeds. For Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful. | الا من تاب وامن وعمل عملا صالحا فاولئك يبدل الله سيئاتهم حسنات وكان الله غفورا رحيما
Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 71: And whoever repents and does good has truly turned to Allah properly. | ومن تاب وعمل صالحا فانه يتوب الى الله متابا
Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 72: ˹They are˺ those who do not bear false witness, and when they come across falsehood, they pass ˹it˺ by with dignity. | والذين لا يشهدون الزور واذا مروا باللغو مروا كراما

Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 73: ˹They are˺ those who, when reminded of the revelation of their Lord, do not turn a blind eye or a deaf ear to it. | والذين اذا ذكروا بايات ربهم لم يخروا عليها صما وعميانا

Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 74: ˹They are˺ those who pray, “Our Lord! Bless us with ˹pious˺ spouses and offspring who will be the joy of our hearts, and make us models for the righteous.” | والذين يقولون ربنا هب لنا من ازواجنا وذرياتنا قرة اعين واجعلنا للمتقين اماما

Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 75: It is they who will be rewarded with ˹elevated˺ mansions ˹in Paradise˺ for their perseverance, and will be received with salutations and ˹greetings of˺ peace | اولئك يجزون الغرفة بما صبروا ويلقون فيها تحية وسلاما
Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 76: staying there forever. What an excellent place to settle and reside! | خالدين فيها حسنت مستقرا ومقاما

Surah 25 Al-Furqaan, Ayah 77: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “You ˹all˺ would not ˹even˺ matter to my Lord were it not for your faith ˹in Him˺. But now you ˹disbelievers˺ have denied ˹the truth˺, so the torment is bound to come.” | قل ما يعبا بكم ربي لولا دعاؤكم فقد كذبتم فسوف يكون لزاما
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 1: Ṭâ-Sĩn-Mĩm. | طسم
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 2: These are the verses of the clear Book. | تلك ايات الكتاب المبين
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 3: Perhaps you ˹O Prophet˺ will grieve yourself to death over their disbelief. | لعلك باخع نفسك الا يكونوا مؤمنين

Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 4: If We willed, We could send down upon them a ˹compelling˺ sign from the heavens, leaving their necks bent in ˹utter˺ submission to it. | ان نشا ننزل عليهم من السماء اية فظلت اعناقهم لها خاضعين
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 5: Whatever new reminder comes to them from the Most Compassionate, they always turn away from it. | وما ياتيهم من ذكر من الرحمن محدث الا كانوا عنه معرضين
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 6: They have certainly denied ˹the truth˺, so they will soon face the consequences of their ridicule. | فقد كذبوا فسياتيهم انباء ما كانوا به يستهزئون
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 7: Have they failed to look at the earth, ˹to see˺ how many types of fine plants We have caused to grow in it? | اولم يروا الى الارض كم انبتنا فيها من كل زوج كريم
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 8: Surely in this is a sign. Yet most of them would not believe. | ان في ذلك لاية وما كان اكثرهم مؤمنين
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 9: And your Lord is certainly the Almighty, Most Merciful. | وان ربك لهو العزيز الرحيم
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 10: ˹Remember˺ when your Lord called out to Moses, “Go to the wrongdoing people— | واذ نادى ربك موسى ان ائت القوم الظالمين
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 11: the people of Pharaoh. Will they not fear ˹Allah˺?” | قوم فرعون الا يتقون
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 12: He replied, “My Lord! I fear that they will reject me. | قال رب اني اخاف ان يكذبون
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 13: And ˹so˺ my heart will be broken and my tongue will be tied. So send Aaron along ˹as a messenger˺. | ويضيق صدري ولا ينطلق لساني فارسل الى هارون
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 14: Also, they have a charge against me, so I fear they may kill me.” | ولهم علي ذنب فاخاف ان يقتلون
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 15: Allah responded, “Certainly not! So go, both of you, with Our signs. We will be with you, listening. | قال كلا فاذهبا باياتنا انا معكم مستمعون
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 16: Go to Pharaoh and say, ‘We are messengers from the Lord of all worlds | فاتيا فرعون فقولا انا رسول رب العالمين
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 17: ˹commanded to say:˺ ‘Let the Children of Israel go with us.’’” | ان ارسل معنا بني اسرائيل
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 18: Pharaoh protested, “Did we not raise you among us as a child, and you stayed several years of your life in our care? | قال الم نربك فينا وليدا ولبثت فينا من عمرك سنين
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 19: Then you did what you did, being ˹utterly˺ ungrateful!” | وفعلت فعلتك التي فعلت وانت من الكافرين
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 20: Moses replied, “I did it then, lacking guidance. | قال فعلتها اذا وانا من الضالين
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 21: So I fled from you when I feared you. Then my Lord granted me wisdom and made me one of the messengers. | ففررت منكم لما خفتكم فوهب لي ربي حكما وجعلني من المرسلين
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 22: How can that be a ‘favour,’ of which you remind me, when ˹it was only because˺ you ˹have˺ enslaved the Children of Israel?” | وتلك نعمة تمنها علي ان عبدت بني اسرائيل
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 23: Pharaoh asked, “And what is ‘the Lord of all worlds’?” | قال فرعون وما رب العالمين

Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 24: Moses replied, “˹He is˺ the Lord of the heavens and the earth and everything in between, if only you had sure faith.” | قال رب السماوات والارض وما بينهما ان كنتم موقنين
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 25: Pharaoh said to those around him, “Did you hear ˹what he said˺?” | قال لمن حوله الا تستمعون
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 26: Moses added, “˹He is˺ your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers.” | قال ربكم ورب ابائكم الاولين
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 27: Pharaoh said ˹mockingly˺, “Your messenger, who has been sent to you, must be insane.” | قال ان رسولكم الذي ارسل اليكم لمجنون
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 28: Moses responded: “˹He is˺ the Lord of the east and west, and everything in between, if only you had any sense.” | قال رب المشرق والمغرب وما بينهما ان كنتم تعقلون
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 29: Pharaoh threatened, “If you take any other god besides me, I will certainly have you imprisoned.” | قال لئن اتخذت الها غيري لاجعلنك من المسجونين
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 30: Moses responded, “Even if I bring you a clear proof?” | قال اولو جئتك بشيء مبين
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 31: Pharaoh demanded, “Bring it then, if what you say is true.” | قال فات به ان كنت من الصادقين
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 32: So he threw down his staff and—behold!—it became a real snake. | فالقى عصاه فاذا هي ثعبان مبين
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 33: Then he drew his hand ˹out of his collar˺ and it was ˹shining˺ white for all to see. | ونزع يده فاذا هي بيضاء للناظرين
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 34: Pharaoh said to the chiefs around him, “He is indeed a skilled magician | قال للملا حوله ان هذا لساحر عليم
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 35: who seeks to drive you from your land by his magic. So what do you propose?” | يريد ان يخرجكم من ارضكم بسحره فماذا تامرون
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 36: They replied, “Let him and his brother wait and dispatch mobilizers to all cities | قالوا ارجه واخاه وابعث في المدائن حاشرين
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 37: to bring you every skilled magician.” | ياتوك بكل سحار عليم
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 38: So the magicians were assembled at the set time on the appointed day. | فجمع السحرة لميقات يوم معلوم
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 39: And the people were asked, “Will you join the gathering | وقيل للناس هل انتم مجتمعون
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 40: so that we may follow the magicians if they prevail?” | لعلنا نتبع السحرة ان كانوا هم الغالبين
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 41: When the magicians came, they asked Pharaoh, “Shall we have a ˹suitable˺ reward if we prevail?” | فلما جاء السحرة قالوا لفرعون ائن لنا لاجرا ان كنا نحن الغالبين
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 42: He replied, “Yes, and you will then certainly be among those closest to me.” | قال نعم وانكم اذا لمن المقربين
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 43: Moses said to them, “Cast whatever you wish to cast.” | قال لهم موسى القوا ما انتم ملقون
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 44: So they cast down their ropes and staffs, saying, “By Pharaoh’s might, it is we who will surely prevail.” | فالقوا حبالهم وعصيهم وقالوا بعزة فرعون انا لنحن الغالبون
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 45: Then Moses threw down his staff, and—behold!—it devoured the objects of their illusion! | فالقى موسى عصاه فاذا هي تلقف ما يافكون
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 46: So the magicians fell down, prostrating. | فالقي السحرة ساجدين
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 47: They declared, “We ˹now˺ believe in the Lord of all worlds— | قالوا امنا برب العالمين
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 48: the Lord of Moses and Aaron.” | رب موسى وهارون

Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 49: Pharaoh threatened, “How dare you believe in him before I give you permission? He must be your master who taught you magic, but soon you will see. I will certainly cut off your hands and feet on opposite sides, then crucify you all.” | قال امنتم له قبل ان اذن لكم انه لكبيركم الذي علمكم السحر فلسوف تعلمون لاقطعن ايديكم وارجلكم من خلاف ولاصلبنكم اجمعين
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 50: They responded, “˹That would be˺ no harm! Surely to our Lord we will ˹all˺ return. | قالوا لا ضير انا الى ربنا منقلبون
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 51: We really hope that our Lord will forgive our sins, as we are the first to believe.” | انا نطمع ان يغفر لنا ربنا خطايانا ان كنا اول المؤمنين
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 52: And We inspired Moses, ˹saying,˺ “Leave with My servants at night, for you will surely be pursued.” | واوحينا الى موسى ان اسر بعبادي انكم متبعون
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 53: Then Pharaoh sent mobilizers to all cities | فارسل فرعون في المدائن حاشرين
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 54: ˹and said,˺ “These ˹outcasts˺ are just a handful of people | ان هؤلاء لشرذمة قليلون
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 55: who have really enraged us | وانهم لنا لغائظون
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 56: but we are all on the alert.” | وانا لجميع حاذرون
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 57: So We lured the tyrants out of ˹their˺ gardens, springs | فاخرجناهم من جنات وعيون
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 58: treasures, and splendid residences. | وكنوز ومقام كريم
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 59: So it was. And We awarded it ˹all˺ to the Children of Israel. | كذلك واورثناها بني اسرائيل
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 60: And so they pursued them at sunrise. | فاتبعوهم مشرقين
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 61: When the two groups came face to face, the companions of Moses cried out, “We are overtaken for sure.” | فلما تراءى الجمعان قال اصحاب موسى انا لمدركون
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 62: Moses reassured ˹them˺, “Absolutely not! My Lord is certainly with me—He will guide me.” | قال كلا ان معي ربي سيهدين

Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 63: So We inspired Moses: “Strike the sea with your staff,” and the sea was split, each part was like a huge mountain. | فاوحينا الى موسى ان اضرب بعصاك البحر فانفلق فكان كل فرق كالطود العظيم
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 64: We drew the pursuers to that place | وازلفنا ثم الاخرين
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 65: and delivered Moses and those with him all together. | وانجينا موسى ومن معه اجمعين
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 66: Then We drowned the others. | ثم اغرقنا الاخرين
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 67: Surely in this is a sign. Yet most of them would not believe. | ان في ذلك لاية وما كان اكثرهم مؤمنين
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 68: And your Lord is certainly the Almighty, Most Merciful. | وان ربك لهو العزيز الرحيم
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 69: Relate to them ˹O Prophet˺ the story of Abraham | واتل عليهم نبا ابراهيم
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 70: when he questioned his father and his people, “What is that you worship ˹besides Allah˺?” | اذ قال لابيه وقومه ما تعبدون
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 71: They replied, “We worship idols, to which we are fully devoted.” | قالوا نعبد اصناما فنظل لها عاكفين
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 72: Abraham asked, “Can they hear you when you call upon them? | قال هل يسمعونكم اذ تدعون
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 73: Or can they benefit or harm you?” | او ينفعونكم او يضرون
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 74: They replied, “No! But we found our forefathers doing the same.” | قالوا بل وجدنا اباءنا كذلك يفعلون
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 75: Abraham responded, “Have you ˹really˺ considered what you have been worshipping— | قال افرايتم ما كنتم تعبدون
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 76: you and your ancestors? | انتم واباؤكم الاقدمون
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 77: They are ˹all˺ enemies to me, except the Lord of all worlds. | فانهم عدو لي الا رب العالمين
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 78: ˹He is˺ the One Who created me, and He ˹alone˺ guides me. | الذي خلقني فهو يهدين
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 79: ˹He is˺ the One Who provides me with food and drink. | والذي هو يطعمني ويسقين
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 80: And He ˹alone˺ heals me when I am sick. | واذا مرضت فهو يشفين
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 81: And He ˹is the One Who˺ will cause me to die, and then bring me back to life. | والذي يميتني ثم يحيين
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 82: And He is ˹the One˺ Who, I hope, will forgive my flaws on Judgment Day.” | والذي اطمع ان يغفر لي خطيئتي يوم الدين
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 83: “My Lord! Grant me wisdom, and join me with the righteous. | رب هب لي حكما والحقني بالصالحين
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 84: Bless me with honourable mention among later generations. | واجعل لي لسان صدق في الاخرين
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 85: Make me one of those awarded the Garden of Bliss. | واجعلني من ورثة جنة النعيم
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 86: Forgive my father, for he is certainly one of the misguided. | واغفر لابي انه كان من الضالين
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 87: And do not disgrace me on the Day all will be resurrected— | ولا تخزني يوم يبعثون
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 88: the Day when neither wealth nor children will be of any benefit. | يوم لا ينفع مال ولا بنون
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 89: Only those who come before Allah with a pure heart ˹will be saved˺.” | الا من اتى الله بقلب سليم
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 90: ˹On that Day˺ Paradise will be brought near to the God-fearing | وازلفت الجنة للمتقين
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 91: and the Hellfire will be displayed to the deviant. | وبرزت الجحيم للغاوين
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 92: And it will be said to them, “Where are those you used to worship | وقيل لهم اين ما كنتم تعبدون
Surah 26 Ash-Shu'araa, Ayah 93: besides Allah? Can they help you or even help themselves?” | من دون الله هل ينصرونكم او ينتصرون

Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 9: O  Moses! It is truly I. I am Allah—the Almighty, All-Wise. | يا موسى انه انا الله العزيز الحكيم

Messengers should have no fear in My presence. | والق عصاك فلما راها تهتز كانها جان ولى مدبرا ولم يعقب يا موسى لا تخف اني لا يخاف لدي المرسلون

Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 11: ˹Fear is˺ only for those who do wrong. But if they later mend ˹their˺ evil ˹ways˺ with good, then I am certainly All-Forgiving, Most Merciful. | الا من ظلم ثم بدل حسنا بعد سوء فاني غفور رحيم

Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 12: Now put your hand through ˹the opening of˺ your collar, it will come out ˹shining˺ white, unblemished. ˹These are two˺ of nine signs for Pharaoh and his people. They have truly been a rebellious people.” | وادخل يدك في جيبك تخرج بيضاء من غير سوء في تسع ايات الى فرعون وقومه انهم كانوا قوما فاسقين
Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 13: But when Our enlightening signs came to them, they said, “This is pure magic.” | فلما جاءتهم اياتنا مبصرة قالوا هذا سحر مبين

Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 14: And, although their hearts were convinced the signs were true, they still denied them wrongfully and arrogantly. See then what was the end of the corruptors! | وجحدوا بها واستيقنتها انفسهم ظلما وعلوا فانظر كيف كان عاقبة المفسدين

Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 15: Indeed, We granted knowledge to David and Solomon. And they said ˹in acknowledgment˺, “All praise is for Allah Who has privileged us over many of His faithful servants.” | ولقد اتينا داوود وسليمان علما وقالا الحمد لله الذي فضلنا على كثير من عباده المؤمنين

Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 16: And David was succeeded by Solomon, who said, “O people! We have been taught the language of birds, and been given everything ˹we need˺. This is indeed a great privilege.” | وورث سليمان داوود وقال يا ايها الناس علمنا منطق الطير واوتينا من كل شيء ان هذا لهو الفضل المبين
Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 17: Solomon’s forces of jinn, humans, and birds were rallied for him, perfectly organized. | وحشر لسليمان جنوده من الجن والانس والطير فهم يوزعون

Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 18: And when they came across a valley of ants, an ant warned, “O ants! Go quickly into your homes so Solomon and his armies do not crush you, unknowingly.” | حتى اذا اتوا على واد النمل قالت نملة يا ايها النمل ادخلوا مساكنكم لا يحطمنكم سليمان وجنوده وهم لا يشعرون

Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 19: So Solomon smiled in amusement at her words, and prayed, “My Lord! Inspire me to ˹always˺ be thankful for Your favours which You have blessed me and my parents with, and to do good deeds that please you. Admit me, by Your mercy, into ˹the company of˺ Your righteous servants.” | فتبسم ضاحكا من قولها وقال رب اوزعني ان اشكر نعمتك التي انعمت علي وعلى والدي وان اعمل صالحا ترضاه وادخلني برحمتك في عبادك الصالحين
Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 20: ˹One day˺ he inspected the birds, and wondered, “Why is it that I cannot see the hoopoe? Or could he be absent? | وتفقد الطير فقال ما لي لا ارى الهدهد ام كان من الغائبين
Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 21: I will surely subject him to a severe punishment, or ˹even˺ slaughter him, unless he brings me a compelling excuse.” | لاعذبنه عذابا شديدا او لاذبحنه او لياتيني بسلطان مبين

Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 22: It was not long before the bird came and said, “I have found out something you do not know. I have just come to you from Sheba with sure news. | فمكث غير بعيد فقال احطت بما لم تحط به وجئتك من سبا بنبا يقين

Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 23: Indeed, I found a woman ruling over them, who has been given everything ˹she needs˺, and who has a magnificent throne. | اني وجدت امراة تملكهم واوتيت من كل شيء ولها عرش عظيم

Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 24: I found her and her people prostrating to the sun instead of Allah. For Satan has made their deeds appealing to them—hindering them from the ˹Right˺ Way and leaving them unguided— | وجدتها وقومها يسجدون للشمس من دون الله وزين لهم الشيطان اعمالهم فصدهم عن السبيل فهم لا يهتدون

Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 25: so they do not prostrate to Allah, Who brings forth what is hidden in the heavens and the earth, and knows what you ˹all˺ conceal and what you reveal. | الا يسجدوا لله الذي يخرج الخبء في السماوات والارض ويعلم ما تخفون وما تعلنون
Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 26: ˹He is˺ Allah! There is no god ˹worthy of worship˺ except Him, the Lord of the Mighty Throne.” | الله لا اله الا هو رب العرش العظيم
Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 27: Solomon said, “We will see whether you are telling the truth or lying. | قال سننظر اصدقت ام كنت من الكاذبين
Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 28: Go with this letter of mine and deliver it to them, then stand aside and see how they will respond.” | اذهب بكتابي هذا فالقه اليهم ثم تول عنهم فانظر ماذا يرجعون
Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 29: The Queen ˹later˺ announced, “O chiefs! Indeed, a noble letter has been delivered to me. | قالت يا ايها الملا اني القي الي كتاب كريم
Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 30: It is from Solomon, and it reads: ‘In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful. | انه من سليمان وانه بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم
Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 31: Do not be arrogant with me, but come to me, fully submitting ˹to Allah˺.’” | الا تعلوا علي واتوني مسلمين
Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 32: She said, “O chiefs! Advise me in this matter of mine, for I would never make any decision without you.” | قالت يا ايها الملا افتوني في امري ما كنت قاطعة امرا حتى تشهدون

Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 33: They responded, “We are a people of strength and great ˹military˺ might, but the decision is yours, so decide what you will command.” | قالوا نحن اولو قوة واولو باس شديد والامر اليك فانظري ماذا تامرين

Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 34: She reasoned, “Indeed, when kings invade a land, they ruin it and debase its nobles. They really do so! | قالت ان الملوك اذا دخلوا قرية افسدوها وجعلوا اعزة اهلها اذلة وكذلك يفعلون
Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 35: But I will certainly send him a gift, and see what ˹response˺ my envoys will return with.” | واني مرسلة اليهم بهدية فناظرة بم يرجع المرسلون

Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 36: When the chief-envoy came to him, Solomon said, “Do you offer me wealth? What Allah has granted me is far greater than what He has granted you. No! It is you who rejoice in ˹receiving˺ gifts. | فلما جاء سليمان قال اتمدونن بمال فما اتاني الله خير مما اتاكم بل انتم بهديتكم تفرحون

Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 37: Go back to them, for we will certainly mobilize against them forces which they can never resist, and we will drive them out from there in disgrace, fully humbled.” | ارجع اليهم فلناتينهم بجنود لا قبل لهم بها ولنخرجنهم منها اذلة وهم صاغرون
Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 38: Solomon asked, “O chiefs! Which of you can bring me her throne before they come to me in ˹full˺ submission?” | قال يا ايها الملا ايكم ياتيني بعرشها قبل ان ياتوني مسلمين

Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 39: One mighty jinn responded, “I can bring it to you before you rise from this council of yours. And I am quite strong and trustworthy for this ˹task˺.” | قال عفريت من الجن انا اتيك به قبل ان تقوم من مقامك واني عليه لقوي امين

Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 40: But the one who had knowledge of the Scripture said, “I can bring it to you in the blink of an eye.” So when Solomon saw it placed before him, he exclaimed, “This is by the grace of my Lord to test me whether I am grateful or ungrateful. And whoever is grateful, it is only for their own good. But whoever is ungrateful, surely my Lord is Self-Sufficient, Most Generous.” | قال الذي عنده علم من الكتاب انا اتيك به قبل ان يرتد اليك طرفك فلما راه مستقرا عنده قال هذا من فضل ربي ليبلوني ااشكر ام اكفر ومن شكر فانما يشكر لنفسه ومن كفر فان ربي غني كريم

Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 41: ˹Then˺ Solomon said, “Disguise her throne for her so we may see whether she will recognize ˹it˺ or she will not be able to.” | قال نكروا لها عرشها ننظر اتهتدي ام تكون من الذين لا يهتدون

Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 42: So when she arrived, it was said ˹to her˺, “Is your throne like this?” She replied, “It looks to be the same. We have ˹already˺ received knowledge ˹of Solomon’s prophethood˺ before this ˹miracle˺, and have submitted ˹to Allah˺.” | فلما جاءت قيل اهكذا عرشك قالت كانه هو واوتينا العلم من قبلها وكنا مسلمين

Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 43: But she had been hindered by what she used to worship instead of Allah, for she was indeed from a disbelieving people. | وصدها ما كانت تعبد من دون الله انها كانت من قوم كافرين

Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 44: Then she was told, “Enter the palace.” But when she saw the hall, she thought it was a body of water, so she bared her legs. Solomon said. “It is just a palace paved with crystal.” ˹At last˺ she declared, “My Lord! I have certainly wronged my soul. Now I ˹fully˺ submit myself along with Solomon to Allah, the Lord of all worlds.” | قيل لها ادخلي الصرح فلما راته حسبته لجة وكشفت عن ساقيها قال انه صرح ممرد من قوارير قالت رب اني ظلمت نفسي واسلمت مع سليمان لله رب العالمين

Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 45: And We certainly sent to the people of Thamûd their brother Ṣâliḥ, proclaiming, “Worship Allah,” but they suddenly split into two opposing groups. | ولقد ارسلنا الى ثمود اخاهم صالحا ان اعبدوا الله فاذا هم فريقان يختصمون

Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 46: He urged ˹the disbelieving group˺, “O my people! Why do you ˹seek to˺ hasten the torment rather than grace? If only you sought Allah’s forgiveness so you may be shown mercy!” | قال يا قوم لم تستعجلون بالسيئة قبل الحسنة لولا تستغفرون الله لعلكم ترحمون

Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 47: They replied, “You and your followers are a bad omen for us.” He responded, “Your omens are destined by Allah. In fact, you are ˹only˺ a people being tested.” | قالوا اطيرنا بك وبمن معك قال طائركم عند الله بل انتم قوم تفتنون
Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 48: And there were in the city nine ˹elite˺ men who spread corruption in the land, never doing what is right. | وكان في المدينة تسعة رهط يفسدون في الارض ولا يصلحون

Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 49: They vowed, “Let us swear by Allah that we will take him and his family down by night. Then we will certainly say to his ˹closest˺ heirs, ‘We did not witness the murder of his family. We are definitely telling the truth.’” | قالوا تقاسموا بالله لنبيتنه واهله ثم لنقولن لوليه ما شهدنا مهلك اهله وانا لصادقون
Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 50: And ˹so˺ they made a plan, but We too made a plan, while they were unaware. | ومكروا مكرا ومكرنا مكرا وهم لا يشعرون
Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 51: See then what the consequences of their plan were: We ˹utterly˺ destroyed them and their people all together. | فانظر كيف كان عاقبة مكرهم انا دمرناهم وقومهم اجمعين

Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 52: So their homes are there, ˹but completely˺ ruined because of their wrongdoing. Surely in this is a lesson for people of knowledge. | فتلك بيوتهم خاوية بما ظلموا ان في ذلك لاية لقوم يعلمون
Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 53: And We delivered those who were faithful and were mindful ˹of Allah˺. | وانجينا الذين امنوا وكانوا يتقون

Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 54: And ˹remember˺ Lot, when he rebuked ˹the men of˺ his people, “Do you commit that shameful deed while you can see ˹one another˺? | ولوطا اذ قال لقومه اتاتون الفاحشة وانتم تبصرون
Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 55: Do you really lust after men instead of women? In fact, you are ˹only˺ a people acting ignorantly.” | ائنكم لتاتون الرجال شهوة من دون النساء بل انتم قوم تجهلون

Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 56: But his people’s only response was to say, “Expel Lot’s followers from your land! They are a people who wish to remain chaste!” | فما كان جواب قومه الا ان قالوا اخرجوا ال لوط من قريتكم انهم اناس يتطهرون
Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 57: So We delivered him and his family, except his wife. We had destined her to be one of the doomed. | فانجيناه واهله الا امراته قدرناها من الغابرين
Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 58: And We poured upon them a rain ˹of brimstone˺. How evil was the rain of those who had been warned! | وامطرنا عليهم مطرا فساء مطر المنذرين

Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 59: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Praise be to Allah, and peace be upon the servants He has chosen.” ˹Ask the disbelievers,˺ “Which is better: Allah or whatever ˹gods˺ they associate ˹with Him˺?” | قل الحمد لله وسلام على عباده الذين اصطفى الله خير اما يشركون

Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 60: Or ˹ask them,˺ “Who created the heavens and the earth, and sends down rain for you from the sky, by which We cause delightful gardens to grow? You could never cause their trees to grow. Was it another god besides Allah?” Absolutely not! But they are a people who set up equals ˹to Allah˺! | امن خلق السماوات والارض وانزل لكم من السماء ماء فانبتنا به حدائق ذات بهجة ما كان لكم ان تنبتوا شجرها االه مع الله بل هم قوم يعدلون

Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 61: Or ˹ask them,˺ “Who made the earth a place of settlement, caused rivers to flow through it, placed firm mountains upon it, and set a barrier between ˹fresh and salt˺ bodies of water? Was it another god besides Allah?” Absolutely not! But most of them do not know. | امن جعل الارض قرارا وجعل خلالها انهارا وجعل لها رواسي وجعل بين البحرين حاجزا االه مع الله بل اكثرهم لا يعلمون

Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 62: Or ˹ask them,˺ “Who responds to the distressed when they cry to Him, relieving ˹their˺ affliction, and ˹Who˺ makes you successors in the earth? Is it another god besides Allah? Yet you are hardly mindful!” | امن يجيب المضطر اذا دعاه ويكشف السوء ويجعلكم خلفاء الارض االه مع الله قليلا ما تذكرون

Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 63: Or ˹ask them,˺ “Who guides you in the darkness of the land and sea, and sends the winds ushering in His mercy? Is it another god besides Allah? Exalted is Allah above what they associate ˹with Him˺! | امن يهديكم في ظلمات البر والبحر ومن يرسل الرياح بشرا بين يدي رحمته االه مع الله تعالى الله عما يشركون

Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 64: Or ˹ask them,˺ “Who originates the creation then resurrects it, and gives you provisions from the heavens and the earth? Is it another god besides Allah?” Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Show ˹me˺ your proof, if what you say is true.” | امن يبدا الخلق ثم يعيده ومن يرزقكم من السماء والارض االه مع الله قل هاتوا برهانكم ان كنتم صادقين

Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 65: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “None in the heavens and the earth has knowledge of the unseen except Allah. Nor do they know when they will be resurrected. | قل لا يعلم من في السماوات والارض الغيب الا الله وما يشعرون ايان يبعثون

Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 66: No! Their knowledge of the Hereafter amounts to ignorance. In fact, they are in doubt about it. In truth, they are ˹totally˺ blind to it. | بل ادارك علمهم في الاخرة بل هم في شك منها بل هم منها عمون
Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 67: The disbelievers ask, “When we and our fathers are reduced to dust, will we really be brought forth ˹alive˺? | وقال الذين كفروا ااذا كنا ترابا واباؤنا ائنا لمخرجون
Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 68: We have already been promised this, as well as our forefathers earlier. This is nothing but ancient fables!” | لقد وعدنا هذا نحن واباؤنا من قبل ان هذا الا اساطير الاولين
Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 69: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Travel throughout the land and see the fate of the wicked.” | قل سيروا في الارض فانظروا كيف كان عاقبة المجرمين
Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 70: Do not grieve for them, nor be distressed by their schemes. | ولا تحزن عليهم ولا تكن في ضيق مما يمكرون
Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 71: They ask ˹the believers˺, “When will this threat come to pass, if what you say is true?” | ويقولون متى هذا الوعد ان كنتم صادقين
Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 72: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Perhaps some of what you seek to hasten is close at hand.” | قل عسى ان يكون ردف لكم بعض الذي تستعجلون
Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 73: Surely your Lord is ever Bountiful to humanity, but most of them are ungrateful. | وان ربك لذو فضل على الناس ولكن اكثرهم لا يشكرون
Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 74: And surely your Lord knows what their hearts conceal and what they reveal. | وان ربك ليعلم ما تكن صدورهم وما يعلنون
Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 75: For there is nothing hidden in the heavens or the earth without being ˹written˺ in a perfect Record. | وما من غائبة في السماء والارض الا في كتاب مبين
Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 76: Indeed, this Quran clarifies for the Children of Israel most of what they differ over. | ان هذا القران يقص على بني اسرائيل اكثر الذي هم فيه يختلفون
Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 77: And it is truly a guide and mercy for the believers. | وانه لهدى ورحمة للمؤمنين
Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 78: Your Lord will certainly judge between them by His justice, for He is the Almighty, All-Knowing. | ان ربك يقضي بينهم بحكمه وهو العزيز العليم
Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 79: So put your trust in Allah, for you are surely upon the ˹Path of˺ clear truth. | فتوكل على الله انك على الحق المبين

Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 80: You certainly cannot make the dead hear ˹the truth˺. Nor can you make the deaf hear the call when they turn their backs and walk away. | انك لا تسمع الموتى ولا تسمع الصم الدعاء اذا ولوا مدبرين

Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 81: Nor can you lead the blind out of their misguidance. You can make none hear ˹the truth˺ except those who believe in Our revelations, ˹fully˺ submitting ˹to Allah˺. | وما انت بهادي العمي عن ضلالتهم ان تسمع الا من يؤمن باياتنا فهم مسلمون

Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 82: And when the decree ˹of the Hour˺ comes to pass against them, We will bring forth for them a beast from the earth, telling them that the people had no sure faith in Our revelations. | واذا وقع القول عليهم اخرجنا لهم دابة من الارض تكلمهم ان الناس كانوا باياتنا لا يوقنون

Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 83: ˹Watch for˺ the Day We will gather from every faith-community a group of those who denied Our revelations, and they will be driven in ranks. | ويوم نحشر من كل امة فوجا ممن يكذب باياتنا فهم يوزعون

Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 84: When they ˹finally˺ come before their Lord, He will ask ˹them˺, “Did you deny My revelations without ˹even˺ comprehending them? Or what ˹exactly˺ did you do?” | حتى اذا جاءوا قال اكذبتم باياتي ولم تحيطوا بها علما اماذا كنتم تعملون
Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 85: And the decree ˹of torment˺ will be justified against them for their wrongdoing, leaving them speechless. | ووقع القول عليهم بما ظلموا فهم لا ينطقون

Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 86: Do they not see that We made the night for them to rest in and the day bright? Surely in this are signs for those who believe. | الم يروا انا جعلنا الليل ليسكنوا فيه والنهار مبصرا ان في ذلك لايات لقوم يؤمنون

Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 87: And ˹beware of˺ the Day the Trumpet will be blown, and all those in the heavens and all those on the earth will be horrified ˹to the point of death˺, except those Allah wills ˹to spare˺. And all will come before Him, fully humbled. | ويوم ينفخ في الصور ففزع من في السماوات ومن في الارض الا من شاء الله وكل اتوه داخرين

Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 88: Now you see the mountains, thinking they are firmly fixed, but they are travelling ˹just˺ like clouds. ˹That is˺ the design of Allah, Who has perfected everything. Surely He is All-Aware of what you do. | وترى الجبال تحسبها جامدة وهي تمر مر السحاب صنع الله الذي اتقن كل شيء انه خبير بما تفعلون

Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 89: Whoever comes with a good deed will be rewarded with what is better, and they will be secure from the horror on that Day. | من جاء بالحسنة فله خير منها وهم من فزع يومئذ امنون

Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 90: And whoever comes with an evil deed will be hurled face-first into the Fire. Are you rewarded except for what you used to do? | ومن جاء بالسيئة فكبت وجوههم في النار هل تجزون الا ما كنتم تعملون

Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 91: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “I have only been commanded to worship the Lord of this city ˹of Mecca˺, Who has made it sacred, and to Him belongs everything. And I am commanded to be one of those who ˹fully˺ submit ˹to Him˺ | انما امرت ان اعبد رب هذه البلدة الذي حرمها وله كل شيء وامرت ان اكون من المسلمين

Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 92: and to recite the Quran.” Then whoever chooses to be guided, it is only for their own good. But whoever chooses to stray, say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “I am only a warner.” | وان اتلو القران فمن اهتدى فانما يهتدي لنفسه ومن ضل فقل انما انا من المنذرين

Surah 27 An-Naml, Ayah 93: And say, “All praise is for Allah! He will show you His signs, and you will recognize them. And your Lord is never unaware of what you do.” | وقل الحمد لله سيريكم اياته فتعرفونها وما ربك بغافل عما تعملون
Surah 28 Al-Qasas, Ayah 1: Ṭâ-Sĩn-Mĩm. | طسم
Surah 28 Al-Qasas, Ayah 2: These are the verses of the clear Book. | تلك ايات الكتاب المبين
Surah 28 Al-Qasas, Ayah 3: We narrate to you ˹O Prophet˺ part of the story of Moses and Pharaoh in truth for people who believe. | نتلو عليك من نبا موسى وفرعون بالحق لقوم يؤمنون

Surah 28 Al-Qasas, Ayah 4: Indeed, Pharaoh ˹arrogantly˺ elevated himself in the land and divided its people into ˹subservient˺ groups, one of which he persecuted, slaughtering their sons and keeping their women. He was truly one of the corruptors. | ان فرعون علا في الارض وجعل اهلها شيعا يستضعف طائفة منهم يذبح ابناءهم ويستحيي نساءهم انه كان من المفسدين

Surah 28 Al-Qasas, Ayah 5: But it was Our Will to favour those who were oppressed in the land, making them models ˹of faith˺ as well as successors; | ونريد ان نمن على الذين استضعفوا في الارض ونجعلهم ائمة ونجعلهم الوارثين

Surah 28 Al-Qasas, Ayah 6: and to establish them in the land; and through them show Pharaoh, Hamân, and their soldiers ˹the fulfilment of˺ what they feared. | ونمكن لهم في الارض ونري فرعون وهامان وجنودهما منهم ما كانوا يحذرون

Surah 28 Al-Qasas, Ayah 7: We inspired the mother of Moses: “Nurse him, but when you fear for him, put him then into the river, and do not fear or grieve. We will certainly return him to you, and make him one of the messengers.” | واوحينا الى ام موسى ان ارضعيه فاذا خفت عليه فالقيه في اليم ولا تخافي ولا تحزني انا رادوه اليك وجاعلوه من المرسلين

Surah 28 Al-Qasas, Ayah 8: And ˹it so happened that˺ Pharaoh’s people picked him up, only to become their enemy and source of grief. Surely Pharaoh, Hamân, and their soldiers were sinful. | فالتقطه ال فرعون ليكون لهم عدوا وحزنا ان فرعون وهامان وجنودهما كانوا خاطئين

Surah 28 Al-Qasas, Ayah 9: Pharaoh’s wife said ˹to him˺, “˹This baby is˺ a source of joy for me and you. Do not kill him. Perhaps he may be useful to us or we may adopt him as a son.” They were unaware ˹of what was to come˺. | وقالت امرات فرعون قرت عين لي ولك لا تقتلوه عسى ان ينفعنا او نتخذه ولدا وهم لا يشعرون

Surah 28 Al-Qasas, Ayah 10: And the heart of Moses’ mother ached so much that she almost gave away his identity, had We not reassured her heart in order for her to have faith ˹in Allah’s promise˺. | واصبح فؤاد ام موسى فارغا ان كادت لتبدي به لولا ان ربطنا على قلبها لتكون من المؤمنين
Surah 28 Al-Qasas, Ayah 11: And she said to his sister, “Keep track of him!” So she watched him from a distance, while they were unaware. | وقالت لاخته قصيه فبصرت به عن جنب وهم لا يشعرون

Surah 28 Al-Qasas, Ayah 12: And We had caused him to refuse all wet-nurses at first, so his sister suggested, “Shall I direct you to a family who will bring him up for you and take good care of him?” | وحرمنا عليه المراضع من قبل فقالت هل ادلكم على اهل بيت يكفلونه لكم وهم له ناصحون

Surah 28 Al-Qasas, Ayah 13: This is how We returned him to his mother so that her heart would be put at ease, and not grieve, and that she would know that Allah’s promise is ˹always˺ true. But most people do not know. | فرددناه الى امه كي تقر عينها ولا تحزن ولتعلم ان وعد الله حق ولكن اكثرهم لا يعلمون

Surah 28 Al-Qasas, Ayah 14: And when he reached full strength and maturity, We gave him wisdom and knowledge. This is how We reward the good-doers. | ولما بلغ اشده واستوى اتيناه حكما وعلما وكذلك نجزي المحسنين

Surah 28 Al-Qasas, Ayah 15: ˹One day˺ he entered the city unnoticed by its people. There he found two men fighting: one of his own people, and the other of his enemies. The man from his people called to him for help against his foe. So Moses punched him, causing his death. Moses cried, “This is from Satan’s handiwork. He is certainly a sworn, misleading enemy.” | ودخل المدينة على حين غفلة من اهلها فوجد فيها رجلين يقتتلان هذا من شيعته وهذا من عدوه فاستغاثه الذي من شيعته على الذي من عدوه فوكزه موسى فقضى عليه قال هذا من عمل الشيطان انه عدو مضل مبين

Surah 28 Al-Qasas, Ayah 16: He pleaded, “My Lord! I have definitely wronged my soul, so forgive me.” So He forgave him, ˹for˺ He is indeed the All-Forgiving, Most Merciful. | قال رب اني ظلمت نفسي فاغفر لي فغفر له انه هو الغفور الرحيم
Surah 28 Al-Qasas, Ayah 17: Moses pledged, “My Lord! For all Your favours upon me, I will never side with the wicked.” | قال رب بما انعمت علي فلن اكون ظهيرا للمجرمين

Surah 28 Al-Qasas, Ayah 18: And so Moses became fearful, watching out in the city, when suddenly the one who sought his help the day before cried out to him again for help. Moses rebuked him, “Indeed, you are clearly a trouble-maker.” | فاصبح في المدينة خائفا يترقب فاذا الذي استنصره بالامس يستصرخه قال له موسى انك لغوي مبين

Surah 28 Al-Qasas, Ayah 19: Then when Moses was about to lay his hands on their foe, the enemy said, “O Moses! Do you intend to kill me as you killed a man yesterday? You only want to be a tyrant in the land. You do not intend to make peace!” | فلما ان اراد ان يبطش بالذي هو عدو لهما قال يا موسى اتريد ان تقتلني كما قتلت نفسا بالامس ان تريد الا ان تكون جبارا في الارض وما تريد ان تكون من المصلحين

Surah 28 Al-Qasas, Ayah 20: And there came a man, rushing from the farthest end of the city. He said, “O Moses! The chiefs are actually conspiring against you to put you to death, so leave ˹the city˺. I really advise you ˹to do so˺.” | وجاء رجل من اقصى المدينة يسعى قال يا موسى ان الملا ياتمرون بك ليقتلوك فاخرج اني لك من الناصحين
Surah 28 Al-Qasas, Ayah 21: So Moses left the city in a state of fear and caution, praying, “My Lord! Deliver me from the wrongdoing people.” | فخرج منها خائفا يترقب قال رب نجني من القوم الظالمين
Surah 28 Al-Qasas, Ayah 22: And as he made his way towards Midian, he said, “I trust my Lord will guide me to the right way.” | ولما توجه تلقاء مدين قال عسى ربي ان يهديني سواء السبيل

Surah 28 Al-Qasas, Ayah 23: When he arrived at the well of Midian, he found a group of people watering ˹their herds˺. Apart from them, he noticed two women holding back ˹their herd˺. He asked ˹them˺, “What is the problem?” They replied, “We cannot water ˹our animals˺ until the ˹other˺ shepherds are done, for our father is a very old man.” | ولما ورد ماء مدين وجد عليه امة من الناس يسقون ووجد من دونهم امراتين تذودان قال ما خطبكما قالتا لا نسقي حتى يصدر الرعاء وابونا شيخ كبير

Surah 28 Al-Qasas, Ayah 24: So he watered ˹their herd˺ for them, then withdrew to the shade and prayed, “My Lord! I am truly in ˹desperate˺ need of whatever provision You may have in store for me.” | فسقى لهما ثم تولى الى الظل فقال رب اني لما انزلت الي من خير فقير

Surah 28 Al-Qasas, Ayah 25: Then one of the two women came to him, walking bashfully. She said, “My father is inviting you so he may reward you for watering ˹our animals˺ for us.” When Moses came to him and told him his whole story, the old man said, “Have no fear! You are ˹now˺ safe from the wrongdoing people.” | فجاءته احداهما تمشي على استحياء قالت ان ابي يدعوك ليجزيك اجر ما سقيت لنا فلما جاءه وقص عليه القصص قال لا تخف نجوت من القوم الظالمين

Surah 28 Al-Qasas, Ayah 26: One of the two daughters suggested, “O my dear father! Hire him. The best man for employment is definitely the strong and trustworthy ˹one˺.” | قالت احداهما يا ابت استاجره ان خير من استاجرت القوي الامين
