Surah 33 Al-Ahzaab, Ayah 36: It is not for a believing man or woman—when Allah and His Messenger decree a matter—to have any other choice in that matter. Indeed, whoever disobeys Allah and His Messenger has clearly gone ˹far˺ astray. | وما كان لمؤمن ولا مؤمنة اذا قضى الله ورسوله امرا ان يكون لهم الخيرة من امرهم ومن يعص الله ورسوله فقد ضل ضلالا مبينا

Surah 33 Al-Ahzaab, Ayah 37: And ˹remember, O  Prophet,˺ when you said to the one for whom Allah has done a favour and you ˹too˺ have done a favour, “Keep your wife and fear Allah,” while concealing within yourself what Allah was going to reveal. And ˹so˺ you were considering the people, whereas Allah was more worthy of your consideration. So when Zaid totally lost interest in ˹keeping˺ his wife, We gave her to you in marriage, so that there would be no blame on the believers for marrying the ex-wives of their adopted sons after their divorce. And Allah’s command is totally binding. | واذ تقول للذي انعم الله عليه وانعمت عليه امسك عليك زوجك واتق الله وتخفي في نفسك ما الله مبديه وتخشى الناس والله احق ان تخشاه فلما قضى زيد منها وطرا زوجناكها لكي لا يكون على المؤمنين حرج في ازواج ادعيائهم اذا قضوا منهن وطرا وكان امر الله مفعولا

Surah 33 Al-Ahzaab, Ayah 38: There is no blame on the Prophet for doing what Allah has ordained for him. That has been the way of Allah with those ˹prophets˺ who had gone before. And Allah’s command has been firmly decreed. | ما كان على النبي من حرج فيما فرض الله له سنة الله في الذين خلوا من قبل وكان امر الله قدرا مقدورا

Surah 33 Al-Ahzaab, Ayah 39: ˹That is His way with˺ those ˹prophets˺ who deliver the messages of Allah, and consider Him, and none but Allah. And sufficient is Allah as a ˹vigilant˺ Reckoner. | الذين يبلغون رسالات الله ويخشونه ولا يخشون احدا الا الله وكفى بالله حسيبا

Surah 33 Al-Ahzaab, Ayah 40: Muḥammad is not the father of any of your men, but is the Messenger of Allah and the seal of the prophets. And Allah has ˹perfect˺ knowledge of all things. | ما كان محمد ابا احد من رجالكم ولكن رسول الله وخاتم النبيين وكان الله بكل شيء عليما
Surah 33 Al-Ahzaab, Ayah 41: O believers! Always remember Allah often | يا ايها الذين امنوا اذكروا الله ذكرا كثيرا
Surah 33 Al-Ahzaab, Ayah 42: and glorify Him morning and evening. | وسبحوه بكرة واصيلا

Surah 33 Al-Ahzaab, Ayah 43: He is the One Who showers His blessings upon you—and His angels pray for you—so that He may bring you out of darkness and into light. For He is ever Merciful to the believers. | هو الذي يصلي عليكم وملائكته ليخرجكم من الظلمات الى النور وكان بالمؤمنين رحيما
Surah 33 Al-Ahzaab, Ayah 44: Their greeting on the Day they meet Him will be, “Peace!” And He has prepared for them an honourable reward. | تحيتهم يوم يلقونه سلام واعد لهم اجرا كريما
Surah 33 Al-Ahzaab, Ayah 45: O Prophet! We have sent you as a witness, and a deliverer of good news, and a warner | يا ايها النبي انا ارسلناك شاهدا ومبشرا ونذيرا
Surah 33 Al-Ahzaab, Ayah 46: and a caller to ˹the Way of˺ Allah by His command, and a beacon of light. | وداعيا الى الله باذنه وسراجا منيرا
Surah 33 Al-Ahzaab, Ayah 47: Give good news to the believers that they will have a great bounty from Allah. | وبشر المؤمنين بان لهم من الله فضلا كبيرا

Surah 33 Al-Ahzaab, Ayah 48: Do not yield to the disbelievers and the hypocrites. Overlook their annoyances, and put your trust in Allah. For Allah is sufficient as a Trustee of Affairs. | ولا تطع الكافرين والمنافقين ودع اذاهم وتوكل على الله وكفى بالله وكيلا

Surah 33 Al-Ahzaab, Ayah 49: O believers! If you marry believing women and then divorce them before you touch them, they will have no waiting period for you to count, so give them a ˹suitable˺ compensation, and let them go graciously. | يا ايها الذين امنوا اذا نكحتم المؤمنات ثم طلقتموهن من قبل ان تمسوهن فما لكم عليهن من عدة تعتدونها فمتعوهن وسرحوهن سراحا جميلا

Surah 33 Al-Ahzaab, Ayah 50: O Prophet! We have made lawful for you your wives to whom you have paid their ˹full˺ dowries as well as those ˹bondwomen˺ in your possession, whom Allah has granted you. And ˹you are allowed to marry˺ the daughters of your paternal uncles and aunts, and the daughters of your maternal uncles and aunts, who have emigrated like you. Also ˹allowed for marriage is˺ a believing woman who offers herself to the Prophet ˹without dowry˺ if he is interested in marrying her—˹this is˺ exclusively for you, not for the rest of the believers. We know well what ˹rulings˺ We have ordained for the believers in relation to their wives and those ˹bondwomen˺ in their possession. As such, there would be no blame on you. And Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful. | يا ايها النبي انا احللنا لك ازواجك اللاتي اتيت اجورهن وما ملكت يمينك مما افاء الله عليك وبنات عمك وبنات عماتك وبنات خالك وبنات خالاتك اللاتي هاجرن معك وامراة مؤمنة ان وهبت نفسها للنبي ان اراد النبي ان يستنكحها خالصة لك من دون المؤمنين قد علمنا ما فرضنا عليهم في ازواجهم وما ملكت ايمانهم لكيلا يكون عليك حرج وكان الله غفورا رحيما

Surah 33 Al-Ahzaab, Ayah 51: It is up to you ˹O Prophet˺ to delay or receive whoever you please of your wives. There is no blame on you if you call back any of those you have set aside. That is more likely that they will be content, not grieved, and satisfied with what you offer them all. Allah ˹fully˺ knows what is in your hearts. And Allah is All-Knowing, Most Forbearing. | ترجي من تشاء منهن وتؤوي اليك من تشاء ومن ابتغيت ممن عزلت فلا جناح عليك ذلك ادنى ان تقر اعينهن ولا يحزن ويرضين بما اتيتهن كلهن والله يعلم ما في قلوبكم وكان الله عليما حليما

Surah 33 Al-Ahzaab, Ayah 52: It is not lawful for you ˹O Prophet˺ to marry more women after this, nor can you replace any of your present wives with another, even if her beauty may attract you—except those ˹bondwomen˺ in your possession. And Allah is ever Watchful over all things. | لا يحل لك النساء من بعد ولا ان تبدل بهن من ازواج ولو اعجبك حسنهن الا ما ملكت يمينك وكان الله على كل شيء رقيبا

Surah 33 Al-Ahzaab, Ayah 53: O believers! Do not enter the homes of the Prophet without permission ˹and if invited˺ for a meal, do not ˹come too early and˺ linger until the meal is ready. But if you are invited, then enter ˹on time˺. Once you have eaten, then go on your way, and do not stay for casual talk. Such behaviour is truly annoying to the Prophet, yet he is too shy to ask you to leave. But Allah is never shy of the truth. And when you ˹believers˺ ask his wives for something, ask them from behind a barrier. This is purer for your hearts and theirs. And it is not right for you to annoy the Messenger of Allah, nor ever marry his wives after him. This would certainly be a major offence in the sight of Allah. | يا ايها الذين امنوا لا تدخلوا بيوت النبي الا ان يؤذن لكم الى طعام غير ناظرين اناه ولكن اذا دعيتم فادخلوا فاذا طعمتم فانتشروا ولا مستانسين لحديث ان ذلكم كان يؤذي النبي فيستحيي منكم والله لا يستحيي من الحق واذا سالتموهن متاعا فاسالوهن من وراء حجاب ذلكم اطهر لقلوبكم وقلوبهن وما كان لكم ان تؤذوا رسول الله ولا ان تنكحوا ازواجه من بعده ابدا ان ذلكم كان عند الله عظيما
Surah 33 Al-Ahzaab, Ayah 54: Whether you reveal something or conceal it, surely Allah has ˹perfect˺ knowledge of all things. | ان تبدوا شيئا او تخفوه فان الله كان بكل شيء عليما

Surah 33 Al-Ahzaab, Ayah 55: There is no blame on the Prophet’s wives ˹if they appear unveiled˺ before their fathers, their sons, their brothers, their brothers’ sons, their sisters’ sons, their fellow ˹Muslim˺ women, and those ˹bondspeople˺ in their possession. And be mindful of Allah ˹O wives of the Prophet!˺ Surely Allah is a Witness over all things. | لا جناح عليهن في ابائهن ولا ابنائهن ولا اخوانهن ولا ابناء اخوانهن ولا ابناء اخواتهن ولا نسائهن ولا ما ملكت ايمانهن واتقين الله ان الله كان على كل شيء شهيدا

Surah 33 Al-Ahzaab, Ayah 56: Indeed, Allah showers His blessings upon the Prophet, and His angels pray for him. O  believers! Invoke Allah’s blessings upon him, and salute him with worthy greetings of peace. | ان الله وملائكته يصلون على النبي يا ايها الذين امنوا صلوا عليه وسلموا تسليما

Surah 33 Al-Ahzaab, Ayah 57: Surely those who offend Allah and His Messenger are condemned by Allah in this world and the Hereafter. And He has prepared for them a humiliating punishment. | ان الذين يؤذون الله ورسوله لعنهم الله في الدنيا والاخرة واعد لهم عذابا مهينا

Surah 33 Al-Ahzaab, Ayah 58: As for those who abuse believing men and women unjustifiably, they will definitely bear the guilt of slander and blatant sin. | والذين يؤذون المؤمنين والمؤمنات بغير ما اكتسبوا فقد احتملوا بهتانا واثما مبينا

Surah 33 Al-Ahzaab, Ayah 59: O Prophet! Ask your wives, daughters, and believing women to draw their cloaks over their bodies. In this way it is more likely that they will be recognized ˹as virtuous˺ and not be harassed. And Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful. | يا ايها النبي قل لازواجك وبناتك ونساء المؤمنين يدنين عليهن من جلابيبهن ذلك ادنى ان يعرفن فلا يؤذين وكان الله غفورا رحيما

Surah 33 Al-Ahzaab, Ayah 60: If the hypocrites, and those with sickness in their hearts, and rumour-mongers in Medina do not desist, We will certainly incite you ˹O Prophet˺ against them, and then they will not be your neighbours there any longer. | لئن لم ينته المنافقون والذين في قلوبهم مرض والمرجفون في المدينة لنغرينك بهم ثم لا يجاورونك فيها الا قليلا

Surah 33 Al-Ahzaab, Ayah 61: ˹They deserve to be˺ condemned. ˹If they were to persist,˺ they would get themselves seized and killed relentlessly wherever they are found! | ملعونين اينما ثقفوا اخذوا وقتلوا تقتيلا
Surah 33 Al-Ahzaab, Ayah 62: That was Allah’s way with those ˹hypocrites˺ who have gone before. And you will find no change in Allah’s way. | سنة الله في الذين خلوا من قبل ولن تجد لسنة الله تبديلا

Surah 33 Al-Ahzaab, Ayah 63: People ask you ˹O Prophet˺ about the Hour. Say, “That knowledge is only with Allah. You never know, perhaps the Hour is near.” | يسالك الناس عن الساعة قل انما علمها عند الله وما يدريك لعل الساعة تكون قريبا
Surah 33 Al-Ahzaab, Ayah 64: Surely Allah condemns the disbelievers, and has prepared for them a blazing Fire | ان الله لعن الكافرين واعد لهم سعيرا
Surah 33 Al-Ahzaab, Ayah 65: to stay there for ever and ever—never will they find any protector or helper. | خالدين فيها ابدا لا يجدون وليا ولا نصيرا

Surah 33 Al-Ahzaab, Ayah 66: On the Day their faces are ˹constantly˺ flipped in the Fire, they will cry, “Oh! If only we had obeyed Allah and obeyed the Messenger!” | يوم تقلب وجوههم في النار يقولون يا ليتنا اطعنا الله واطعنا الرسولا
Surah 33 Al-Ahzaab, Ayah 67: And they will say, “Our Lord! We obeyed our leaders and elite, but they led us astray from the ˹Right˺ Way. | وقالوا ربنا انا اطعنا سادتنا وكبراءنا فاضلونا السبيلا
Surah 33 Al-Ahzaab, Ayah 68: Our Lord! Give them double ˹our˺ punishment, and condemn them tremendously.” | ربنا اتهم ضعفين من العذاب والعنهم لعنا كبيرا

Surah 33 Al-Ahzaab, Ayah 69: O believers! Do not be like those who slandered Moses, but Allah cleared him of what they said. And he was honourable in the sight of Allah. | يا ايها الذين امنوا لا تكونوا كالذين اذوا موسى فبراه الله مما قالوا وكان عند الله وجيها
Surah 33 Al-Ahzaab, Ayah 70: O  believers! Be mindful of Allah, and say what is right. | يا ايها الذين امنوا اتقوا الله وقولوا قولا سديدا

Surah 33 Al-Ahzaab, Ayah 71: He will bless your deeds for you, and forgive your sins. And whoever obeys Allah and His Messenger, has truly achieved a great triumph. | يصلح لكم اعمالكم ويغفر لكم ذنوبكم ومن يطع الله ورسوله فقد فاز فوزا عظيما

Surah 33 Al-Ahzaab, Ayah 72: Indeed, We offered the trust to the heavens and the earth and the mountains, but they ˹all˺ declined to bear it, being fearful of it. But humanity assumed it, ˹for˺ they are truly wrongful ˹to themselves˺ and ignorant ˹of the consequences˺ | انا عرضنا الامانة على السماوات والارض والجبال فابين ان يحملنها واشفقن منها وحملها الانسان انه كان ظلوما جهولا

Surah 33 Al-Ahzaab, Ayah 73: so that Allah will punish hypocrite men and women and polytheistic men and women, and Allah will turn in mercy to believing men and women. For Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful. | ليعذب الله المنافقين والمنافقات والمشركين والمشركات ويتوب الله على المؤمنين والمؤمنات وكان الله غفورا رحيما

Surah 34 Saba, Ayah 1: All praise is for Allah, to Whom belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. And praise be to Him in the Hereafter. He is the All-Wise, All-Aware. | الحمد لله الذي له ما في السماوات وما في الارض وله الحمد في الاخرة وهو الحكيم الخبير

Surah 34 Saba, Ayah 2: He knows whatever goes into the earth and whatever comes out of it, and whatever descends from the sky and whatever ascends into it. And He is the Most Merciful, All-Forgiving. | يعلم ما يلج في الارض وما يخرج منها وما ينزل من السماء وما يعرج فيها وهو الرحيم الغفور

Surah 34 Saba, Ayah 3: The disbelievers say, “The Hour will never come to us.” Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Yes—by my Lord, the Knower of the unseen—it will certainly come to you!” Not ˹even˺ an atom’s weight is hidden from Him in the heavens or the earth; nor anything smaller or larger than that, but is ˹written˺ in a perfect Record. | وقال الذين كفروا لا تاتينا الساعة قل بلى وربي لتاتينكم عالم الغيب لا يعزب عنه مثقال ذرة في السماوات ولا في الارض ولا اصغر من ذلك ولا اكبر الا في كتاب مبين
Surah 34 Saba, Ayah 4: So He may reward those who believe and do good. It is they who will have forgiveness and an honourable provision. | ليجزي الذين امنوا وعملوا الصالحات اولئك لهم مغفرة ورزق كريم

Surah 34 Saba, Ayah 5: As for those who strive to discredit Our revelations, it is they who will suffer the ˹worst˺ torment of agonizing pain. | والذين سعوا في اياتنا معاجزين اولئك لهم عذاب من رجز اليم

Surah 34 Saba, Ayah 6: Those gifted with knowledge ˹clearly˺ see that what has been revealed to you from your Lord ˹O Prophet˺ is the truth, and that it guides to the Path of the Almighty, the Praiseworthy. | ويرى الذين اوتوا العلم الذي انزل اليك من ربك هو الحق ويهدي الى صراط العزيز الحميد

Surah 34 Saba, Ayah 7: The disbelievers say ˹mockingly to one another˺, “Shall we show you a man who claims that when you have been utterly disintegrated you will be raised as a new creation? | وقال الذين كفروا هل ندلكم على رجل ينبئكم اذا مزقتم كل ممزق انكم لفي خلق جديد

Surah 34 Saba, Ayah 8: Has he fabricated a lie against Allah or is he insane?” In fact, those who do not believe in the Hereafter are bound for torment and have strayed farthest ˹from the truth˺. | افترى على الله كذبا ام به جنة بل الذين لا يؤمنون بالاخرة في العذاب والضلال البعيد

Surah 34 Saba, Ayah 9: Have they not then seen all that surrounds them of the heavens and the earth? If We willed, We could cause the earth to swallow them up, or cause ˹deadly˺ pieces of the sky to fall upon them. Surely in this is a sign for every servant who turns ˹to Allah˺. | افلم يروا الى ما بين ايديهم وما خلفهم من السماء والارض ان نشا نخسف بهم الارض او نسقط عليهم كسفا من السماء ان في ذلك لاية لكل عبد منيب

Surah 34 Saba, Ayah 10: Indeed, We granted David a ˹great˺ privilege from Us, ˹commanding:˺ “O mountains! Echo his hymns! And the birds as well.” We made iron mouldable for him | ولقد اتينا داوود منا فضلا يا جبال اوبي معه والطير والنا له الحديد

Surah 34 Saba, Ayah 11: instructing: “Make full-length armour, ˹perfectly˺ balancing the links. And work righteousness ˹O family of David!˺. Indeed, I am All-Seeing of what you do.” | ان اعمل سابغات وقدر في السرد واعملوا صالحا اني بما تعملون بصير

Surah 34 Saba, Ayah 12: And to Solomon ˹We subjected˺ the wind: its morning stride was a month’s journey and so was its evening stride. And We caused a stream of molten copper to flow for him, and ˹We subjected˺ some of the jinn to work under him by his Lord’s Will. And whoever of them deviated from Our command, We made them taste the torment of the blaze. | ولسليمان الريح غدوها شهر ورواحها شهر واسلنا له عين القطر ومن الجن من يعمل بين يديه باذن ربه ومن يزغ منهم عن امرنا نذقه من عذاب السعير

Surah 34 Saba, Ayah 13: They made for him whatever he desired of sanctuaries, statues, basins as large as reservoirs, and cooking pots fixed ˹into the ground˺. ˹We ordered:˺ “Work gratefully, O  family of David!” ˹Only˺ a few of My servants are ˹truly˺ grateful. | يعملون له ما يشاء من محاريب وتماثيل وجفان كالجواب وقدور راسيات اعملوا ال داوود شكرا وقليل من عبادي الشكور

Surah 34 Saba, Ayah 14: When We decreed Solomon’s death, nothing indicated to the ˹subjected˺ jinn that he was dead except the termites eating away his staff. So when he collapsed, the jinn realized that if they had ˹really˺ known the unseen, they would not have remained in ˹such˺ humiliating servitude. | فلما قضينا عليه الموت ما دلهم على موته الا دابة الارض تاكل منساته فلما خر تبينت الجن ان لو كانوا يعلمون الغيب ما لبثوا في العذاب المهين

Surah 34 Saba, Ayah 15: Indeed, there was a sign for ˹the tribe of˺ Sheba in their homeland: two orchards—one to the right and the other to the left. ˹They were told:˺ “Eat from the provision of your Lord, and be grateful to Him. ˹Yours is˺ a good land and a forgiving Lord.” | لقد كان لسبا في مسكنهم اية جنتان عن يمين وشمال كلوا من رزق ربكم واشكروا له بلدة طيبة ورب غفور

Surah 34 Saba, Ayah 16: But they turned away. So We sent against them a devastating flood, and replaced their orchards with two others producing bitter fruit, fruitless bushes, and a few ˹sparse˺ thorny trees. | فاعرضوا فارسلنا عليهم سيل العرم وبدلناهم بجنتيهم جنتين ذواتي اكل خمط واثل وشيء من سدر قليل
Surah 34 Saba, Ayah 17: This is how We rewarded them for their ingratitude. Would We ever punish ˹anyone in such a way˺ except the ungrateful? | ذلك جزيناهم بما كفروا وهل نجازي الا الكفور

Surah 34 Saba, Ayah 18: We had also placed between them and the cities We showered with blessings ˹many small˺ towns within sight of one another. And We set moderate travel distances in between, ˹saying,˺ “Travel between them by day and night safely.” | وجعلنا بينهم وبين القرى التي باركنا فيها قرى ظاهرة وقدرنا فيها السير سيروا فيها ليالي واياما امنين

Surah 34 Saba, Ayah 19: But they said, “Our Lord! Make ˹the distances of˺ our journeys longer,” wronging themselves. So We reduced them to ˹cautionary˺ tales, and scattered them utterly. Surely in this are lessons for whoever is steadfast, grateful. | فقالوا ربنا باعد بين اسفارنا وظلموا انفسهم فجعلناهم احاديث ومزقناهم كل ممزق ان في ذلك لايات لكل صبار شكور
Surah 34 Saba, Ayah 20: Indeed, Iblîs’ assumption about them has come true, so they ˹all˺ follow him, except a group of ˹true˺ believers. | ولقد صدق عليهم ابليس ظنه فاتبعوه الا فريقا من المؤمنين

Surah 34 Saba, Ayah 21: He does not have any authority over them, but ˹Our Will is˺ only to distinguish those who believe in the Hereafter from those who are in doubt about it. And your Lord is a ˹vigilant˺ Keeper over all things.” | وما كان له عليهم من سلطان الا لنعلم من يؤمن بالاخرة ممن هو منها في شك وربك على كل شيء حفيظ

Surah 34 Saba, Ayah 22: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Call upon those you claim ˹to be divine˺ besides Allah. They do not possess ˹even˺ an atom’s weight either in the heavens or the earth, nor do they have any share in ˹governing˺ them. Nor is any of them a helper to Him.” | قل ادعوا الذين زعمتم من دون الله لا يملكون مثقال ذرة في السماوات ولا في الارض وما لهم فيهما من شرك وما له منهم من ظهير

Surah 34 Saba, Ayah 23: No intercession will be of any benefit with Him, except by those granted permission by Him. ˹At last,˺ when the dread ˹of Judgment Day˺ is relieved from their hearts ˹because they are permitted to intercede˺, they will ˹excitedly˺ ask ˹the angels˺, “What has your Lord ˹just˺ said?” The angels will reply, “The truth! And He is the Most High, All-Great.” | ولا تنفع الشفاعة عنده الا لمن اذن له حتى اذا فزع عن قلوبهم قالوا ماذا قال ربكم قالوا الحق وهو العلي الكبير

Surah 34 Saba, Ayah 24: Ask ˹them, O  Prophet˺, “Who provides for you from the heavens and the earth?” Say, “Allah! Now, certainly one of our two groups is ˹rightly˺ guided; the other is clearly astray.” | قل من يرزقكم من السماوات والارض قل الله وانا او اياكم لعلى هدى او في ضلال مبين
Surah 34 Saba, Ayah 25: Say, “You will not be accountable for our misdeeds, nor will we be accountable for your deeds.” | قل لا تسالون عما اجرمنا ولا نسال عما تعملون

Surah 34 Saba, Ayah 26: Say, “Our Lord will gather us together, then He will judge between us with the truth. For He is the All-Knowing Judge.” | قل يجمع بيننا ربنا ثم يفتح بيننا بالحق وهو الفتاح العليم

Surah 34 Saba, Ayah 27: Say, “Show me those ˹idols˺ you have joined with Him as partners. No! In fact, He ˹alone˺ is Allah—the Almighty, All-Wise.” | قل اروني الذين الحقتم به شركاء كلا بل هو الله العزيز الحكيم

Surah 34 Saba, Ayah 28: We have sent you ˹O Prophet˺ only as a deliverer of good news and a warner to all of humanity, but most people do not know. | وما ارسلناك الا كافة للناس بشيرا ونذيرا ولكن اكثر الناس لا يعلمون
Surah 34 Saba, Ayah 29: And they ask ˹the believers˺, “When will this threat come to pass, if what you say is true?” | ويقولون متى هذا الوعد ان كنتم صادقين

Surah 34 Saba, Ayah 30: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “A Day has ˹already˺ been appointed for you, which you can neither delay nor advance by a ˹single˺ moment.” | قل لكم ميعاد يوم لا تستاخرون عنه ساعة ولا تستقدمون

Surah 34 Saba, Ayah 31: The disbelievers vow, “We will never believe in this Quran, nor in those ˹Scriptures˺ before it.” If only you could see when the wrongdoers will be detained before their Lord, throwing blame at each other! The lowly ˹followers˺ will say to the arrogant ˹leaders˺, “Had it not been for you, we would certainly have been believers.” | وقال الذين كفروا لن نؤمن بهذا القران ولا بالذي بين يديه ولو ترى اذ الظالمون موقوفون عند ربهم يرجع بعضهم الى بعض القول يقول الذين استضعفوا للذين استكبروا لولا انتم لكنا مؤمنين

Surah 34 Saba, Ayah 32: The arrogant will respond to the lowly, “Did we ever hinder you from guidance after it came to you? In fact, you were wicked ˹on your own˺.” | قال الذين استكبروا للذين استضعفوا انحن صددناكم عن الهدى بعد اذ جاءكم بل كنتم مجرمين

Surah 34 Saba, Ayah 33: The lowly will say to the arrogant, “No! It was your plotting by day and night—when you ordered us to disbelieve in Allah and to set up equals with Him.” They will ˹all˺ hide ˹their˺ remorse when they see the torment. And We will put shackles around the necks of the disbelievers. Will they be rewarded except for what they used to do? | وقال الذين استضعفوا للذين استكبروا بل مكر الليل والنهار اذ تامروننا ان نكفر بالله ونجعل له اندادا واسروا الندامة لما راوا العذاب وجعلنا الاغلال في اعناق الذين كفروا هل يجزون الا ما كانوا يعملون

Surah 34 Saba, Ayah 34: Whenever We sent a warner to a society, its elite would say, “We truly reject what you have been sent with.” | وما ارسلنا في قرية من نذير الا قال مترفوها انا بما ارسلتم به كافرون
Surah 34 Saba, Ayah 35: Adding, “We are far superior ˹to the believers˺ in wealth and children, and we will never be punished.” | وقالوا نحن اكثر اموالا واولادا وما نحن بمعذبين

Surah 34 Saba, Ayah 36: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Surely ˹it is˺ my Lord ˹Who˺ gives abundant or limited provisions to whoever He wills. But most people do not know.” | قل ان ربي يبسط الرزق لمن يشاء ويقدر ولكن اكثر الناس لا يعلمون

Surah 34 Saba, Ayah 37: It is not your wealth or children that bring you closer to Us. But those who believe and do good—it is they who will have a multiplied reward for what they did, and they will be secure in ˹elevated˺ mansions. | وما اموالكم ولا اولادكم بالتي تقربكم عندنا زلفى الا من امن وعمل صالحا فاولئك لهم جزاء الضعف بما عملوا وهم في الغرفات امنون
Surah 34 Saba, Ayah 38: As for those who strive to discredit Our revelations, it is they who will be confined in punishment. | والذين يسعون في اياتنا معاجزين اولئك في العذاب محضرون

Surah 34 Saba, Ayah 39: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Surely ˹it is˺ my Lord ˹Who˺ gives abundant or limited provisions to whoever He wills of His servants. And whatever you spend in charity, He will compensate ˹you˺ for it. For He is the Best Provider.” | قل ان ربي يبسط الرزق لمن يشاء من عباده ويقدر له وما انفقتم من شيء فهو يخلفه وهو خير الرازقين

Surah 34 Saba, Ayah 40: And ˹consider˺ the Day He will gather them all together, and then ask the angels, “Was it you that these ˹polytheists˺ used to worship?” | ويوم يحشرهم جميعا ثم يقول للملائكة اهؤلاء اياكم كانوا يعبدون

Surah 34 Saba, Ayah 41: They will say, “Glory be to You! Our loyalty is to You, not them. In fact, they ˹only˺ followed the ˹temptations of evil˺ jinn, in whom most of them had faith.” | قالوا سبحانك انت ولينا من دونهم بل كانوا يعبدون الجن اكثرهم بهم مؤمنون

Surah 34 Saba, Ayah 42: So Today neither of you can benefit or protect each other. And We will say to the wrongdoers, “Taste the torment of the Fire, which you used to deny.” | فاليوم لا يملك بعضكم لبعض نفعا ولا ضرا ونقول للذين ظلموا ذوقوا عذاب النار التي كنتم بها تكذبون

Surah 34 Saba, Ayah 43: When Our clear revelations are recited to them, they say, “This is only a man who wishes to hinder you from what your forefathers used to worship.” They also say, “This ˹Quran˺ is no more than a fabricated lie.” And the disbelievers say of the truth when it has come to them, “This is nothing but pure magic.” | واذا تتلى عليهم اياتنا بينات قالوا ما هذا الا رجل يريد ان يصدكم عما كان يعبد اباؤكم وقالوا ما هذا الا افك مفترى وقال الذين كفروا للحق لما جاءهم ان هذا الا سحر مبين

Surah 34 Saba, Ayah 44: ˹They say so even though˺ We had never given them any scriptures to study, nor did We ever send them a warner before you ˹O Prophet˺. | وما اتيناهم من كتب يدرسونها وما ارسلنا اليهم قبلك من نذير

Surah 34 Saba, Ayah 45: Those ˹destroyed˺ before them denied as well—and these ˹Meccans˺ have not attained even one-tenth of what We had given their predecessors. Yet ˹when˺ they denied My messengers, how severe was My response! | وكذب الذين من قبلهم وما بلغوا معشار ما اتيناهم فكذبوا رسلي فكيف كان نكير

Surah 34 Saba, Ayah 46: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “I advise you to do ˹only˺ one thing: stand up for ˹the sake of˺ Allah—individually or in pairs—then reflect. Your fellow man is not insane. He is only a warner to you before ˹the coming of˺ a severe punishment.” | قل انما اعظكم بواحدة ان تقوموا لله مثنى وفرادى ثم تتفكروا ما بصاحبكم من جنة ان هو الا نذير لكم بين يدي عذاب شديد

Surah 34 Saba, Ayah 47: Say, “If I had ever asked you for a reward, you could keep it. My reward is only from Allah. And He is a Witness over all things.” | قل ما سالتكم من اجر فهو لكم ان اجري الا على الله وهو على كل شيء شهيد
Surah 34 Saba, Ayah 48: Say, “Surely my Lord hurls the truth ˹against falsehood˺. ˹He is˺ the Knower of all unseen.” | قل ان ربي يقذف بالحق علام الغيوب
Surah 34 Saba, Ayah 49: Say, “The truth has come, and falsehood will vanish, never to return.” | قل جاء الحق وما يبدئ الباطل وما يعيد

Surah 34 Saba, Ayah 50: Say, “If I am astray, the loss is only mine. And if I am guided, it is ˹only˺ because of what my Lord reveals to me. He is indeed All-Hearing, Ever Near.” | قل ان ضللت فانما اضل على نفسي وان اهتديت فبما يوحي الي ربي انه سميع قريب
Surah 34 Saba, Ayah 51: If only you could see when they will be horrified with no escape ˹on Judgment Day˺! And they will be seized from a nearby place. | ولو ترى اذ فزعوا فلا فوت واخذوا من مكان قريب

Surah 34 Saba, Ayah 52: They will ˹then˺ cry, “We do ˹now˺ believe in it ˹all˺.” But how could they ˹possibly˺ attain faith from a place so far-off ˹from the world˺ | وقالوا امنا به وانى لهم التناوش من مكان بعيد
Surah 34 Saba, Ayah 53: while they had already rejected it before, guessing blindly from a place ˹equally˺ far-away ˹from the Hereafter˺? | وقد كفروا به من قبل ويقذفون بالغيب من مكان بعيد

Surah 34 Saba, Ayah 54: They will be sealed off from whatever they desire, as was done to their counterparts before. Indeed, they were ˹all˺ in alarming doubt. | وحيل بينهم وبين ما يشتهون كما فعل باشياعهم من قبل انهم كانوا في شك مريب

Surah 35 Faatir, Ayah 1: All praise is for Allah, the Originator of the heavens and the earth, Who made angels ˹as His˺ messengers with wings—two, three, or four. He increases in creation whatever He wills. Surely Allah is Most Capable of everything. | الحمد لله فاطر السماوات والارض جاعل الملائكة رسلا اولي اجنحة مثنى وثلاث ورباع يزيد في الخلق ما يشاء ان الله على كل شيء قدير

Surah 35 Faatir, Ayah 2: Whatever mercy Allah opens up for people, none can withhold it. And whatever He withholds, none but Him can release it. For He is the Almighty, All-Wise. | ما يفتح الله للناس من رحمة فلا ممسك لها وما يمسك فلا مرسل له من بعده وهو العزيز الحكيم

Surah 35 Faatir, Ayah 3: O humanity! Remember Allah’s favours upon you. Is there any creator other than Allah who provides for you from the heavens and the earth? There is no god ˹worthy of worship˺ except Him. How can you then be deluded ˹from the truth˺? | يا ايها الناس اذكروا نعمت الله عليكم هل من خالق غير الله يرزقكم من السماء والارض لا اله الا هو فانى تؤفكون

Surah 35 Faatir, Ayah 4: If you are rejected by them, so too were messengers before you. And to Allah ˹all˺ matters will be returned ˹for judgment˺. | وان يكذبوك فقد كذبت رسل من قبلك والى الله ترجع الامور

Surah 35 Faatir, Ayah 5: O humanity! Indeed, Allah’s promise is true. So do not let the life of this world deceive you, nor let the Chief Deceiver deceive you about Allah. | يا ايها الناس ان وعد الله حق فلا تغرنكم الحياة الدنيا ولا يغرنكم بالله الغرور

Surah 35 Faatir, Ayah 6: Surely Satan is an enemy to you, so take him as an enemy. He only invites his followers to become inmates of the Blaze. | ان الشيطان لكم عدو فاتخذوه عدوا انما يدعو حزبه ليكونوا من اصحاب السعير

Surah 35 Faatir, Ayah 7: Those who disbelieve will have a severe punishment. But those who believe and do good will have forgiveness and a great reward. | الذين كفروا لهم عذاب شديد والذين امنوا وعملوا الصالحات لهم مغفرة واجر كبير

Surah 35 Faatir, Ayah 8: Are those whose evil-doing is made so appealing to them that they deem it good ˹like those who are rightly guided˺? ˹It is˺ certainly Allah ˹Who˺ leaves to stray whoever He wills, and guides whoever He wills. So do not grieve yourself to death over them ˹O Prophet˺. Surely Allah is All-Knowing of what they do. | افمن زين له سوء عمله فراه حسنا فان الله يضل من يشاء ويهدي من يشاء فلا تذهب نفسك عليهم حسرات ان الله عليم بما يصنعون

Surah 35 Faatir, Ayah 9: And it is Allah Who sends the winds, which then stir up ˹vapour, forming˺ clouds, and then We drive them to a lifeless land, giving life to the earth after its death. Similar is the Resurrection. | والله الذي ارسل الرياح فتثير سحابا فسقناه الى بلد ميت فاحيينا به الارض بعد موتها كذلك النشور

Surah 35 Faatir, Ayah 10: Whoever seeks honour and power, then ˹let them know that˺ all honour and power belongs to Allah. To Him ˹alone˺ good words ascend, and righteous deeds are raised up by Him. As for those who plot evil, they will suffer a severe punishment. And the plotting of such ˹people˺ is doomed ˹to fail˺. | من كان يريد العزة فلله العزة جميعا اليه يصعد الكلم الطيب والعمل الصالح يرفعه والذين يمكرون السيئات لهم عذاب شديد ومكر اولئك هو يبور

Surah 35 Faatir, Ayah 11: And ˹it is˺ Allah ˹Who˺ created you from dust, then ˹developed you˺ from a sperm-drop, then made you into pairs. No female ever conceives or delivers without His knowledge. And no one’s life is made long or cut short but is ˹written˺ in a Record. That is certainly easy for Allah. | والله خلقكم من تراب ثم من نطفة ثم جعلكم ازواجا وما تحمل من انثى ولا تضع الا بعلمه وما يعمر من معمر ولا ينقص من عمره الا في كتاب ان ذلك على الله يسير

Surah 35 Faatir, Ayah 12: The two bodies of water are not alike: one is fresh, palatable, and pleasant to drink and the other is salty and bitter. Yet from them both you eat tender seafood and extract ornaments to wear. And you see the ships ploughing their way through both, so you may seek His bounty and give thanks ˹to Him˺. | وما يستوي البحران هذا عذب فرات سائغ شرابه وهذا ملح اجاج ومن كل تاكلون لحما طريا وتستخرجون حلية تلبسونها وترى الفلك فيه مواخر لتبتغوا من فضله ولعلكم تشكرون

Surah 35 Faatir, Ayah 13: He merges the night into the day and the day into the night, and has subjected the sun and the moon, each orbiting for an appointed term. That is Allah—your Lord! All authority belongs to Him. But those ˹idols˺ you invoke besides Him do not possess even the skin of a date stone. | يولج الليل في النهار ويولج النهار في الليل وسخر الشمس والقمر كل يجري لاجل مسمى ذلكم الله ربكم له الملك والذين تدعون من دونه ما يملكون من قطمير

Surah 35 Faatir, Ayah 14: If you call upon them, they cannot hear your calls. And if they were to hear, they could not respond to you. On the Day of Judgment they will disown your worship ˹of them˺. And no one can inform you ˹O Prophet˺ like the All-Knowledgeable. | ان تدعوهم لا يسمعوا دعاءكم ولو سمعوا ما استجابوا لكم ويوم القيامة يكفرون بشرككم ولا ينبئك مثل خبير
Surah 35 Faatir, Ayah 15: O humanity! It is you who stand in need of Allah, but Allah ˹alone˺ is the Self-Sufficient, Praiseworthy. | يا ايها الناس انتم الفقراء الى الله والله هو الغني الحميد
Surah 35 Faatir, Ayah 16: If He willed, He could eliminate you and produce a new creation. | ان يشا يذهبكم ويات بخلق جديد
Surah 35 Faatir, Ayah 17: And that is not difficult for Allah ˹at all˺. | وما ذلك على الله بعزيز

Surah 35 Faatir, Ayah 18: No soul burdened with sin will bear the burden of another. And if a sin-burdened soul cries for help with its burden, none of it will be carried—even by a close relative. You ˹O Prophet˺ can only warn those who stand in awe of their Lord without seeing Him and establish prayer. Whoever purifies themselves, they only do so for their own good. And to Allah is the final return. | ولا تزر وازرة وزر اخرى وان تدع مثقلة الى حملها لا يحمل منه شيء ولو كان ذا قربى انما تنذر الذين يخشون ربهم بالغيب واقاموا الصلاة ومن تزكى فانما يتزكى لنفسه والى الله المصير
Surah 35 Faatir, Ayah 19: Those blind ˹to the truth˺ and those who can see are not equal | وما يستوي الاعمى والبصير
Surah 35 Faatir, Ayah 20: nor are the darkness and the light | ولا الظلمات ولا النور
Surah 35 Faatir, Ayah 21: nor the ˹scorching˺ heat and the ˹cool˺ shade. | ولا الظل ولا الحرور

Surah 35 Faatir, Ayah 22: Nor are the dead and the living equal. Indeed, Allah ˹alone˺ makes whoever He wills hear, but you ˹O Prophet˺ can never make those in the graves hear ˹your call˺. | وما يستوي الاحياء ولا الاموات ان الله يسمع من يشاء وما انت بمسمع من في القبور
Surah 35 Faatir, Ayah 23: You are only a warner. | ان انت الا نذير

Surah 35 Faatir, Ayah 24: We have surely sent you with the truth as a deliverer of good news and a warner. There is no community that has not had a warner. | انا ارسلناك بالحق بشيرا ونذيرا وان من امة الا خلا فيها نذير

Surah 35 Faatir, Ayah 25: If they deny you, so did those before them. Their messengers came to them with clear proofs, divine Books, and enlightening Scriptures. | وان يكذبوك فقد كذب الذين من قبلهم جاءتهم رسلهم بالبينات وبالزبر وبالكتاب المنير
Surah 35 Faatir, Ayah 26: Then I seized those who persisted in disbelief. How severe was My response! | ثم اخذت الذين كفروا فكيف كان نكير

Surah 35 Faatir, Ayah 27: Do you not see that Allah sends down rain from the sky with which We bring forth fruits of different colours? And in the mountains are streaks of varying shades of white, red, and raven black; | الم تر ان الله انزل من السماء ماء فاخرجنا به ثمرات مختلفا الوانها ومن الجبال جدد بيض وحمر مختلف الوانها وغرابيب سود

Surah 35 Faatir, Ayah 28: just as people, living beings, and cattle are of various colours as well. Of all of Allah’s servants, only the knowledgeable ˹of His might˺ are ˹truly˺ in awe of Him. Allah is indeed Almighty, All-Forgiving. | ومن الناس والدواب والانعام مختلف الوانه كذلك انما يخشى الله من عباده العلماء ان الله عزيز غفور

Surah 35 Faatir, Ayah 29: Surely those who recite the Book of Allah, establish prayer, and donate from what We have provided for them—secretly and openly—˹can˺ hope for an exchange that will never fail | ان الذين يتلون كتاب الله واقاموا الصلاة وانفقوا مما رزقناهم سرا وعلانية يرجون تجارة لن تبور
Surah 35 Faatir, Ayah 30: so that He will reward them in full and increase them out of His grace. He is truly All-Forgiving, Most Appreciative. | ليوفيهم اجورهم ويزيدهم من فضله انه غفور شكور

Surah 35 Faatir, Ayah 31: The Book We have revealed to you ˹O Prophet˺ is the truth, confirming what came before it. Surely Allah is All-Aware, All-Seeing of His servants. | والذي اوحينا اليك من الكتاب هو الحق مصدقا لما بين يديه ان الله بعباده لخبير بصير

Surah 35 Faatir, Ayah 32: Then We granted the Book to those We have chosen from Our servants. Some of them wrong themselves, some follow a middle course, and some are foremost in good deeds by Allah’s Will. That is ˹truly˺ the greatest bounty. | ثم اورثنا الكتاب الذين اصطفينا من عبادنا فمنهم ظالم لنفسه ومنهم مقتصد ومنهم سابق بالخيرات باذن الله ذلك هو الفضل الكبير

Surah 35 Faatir, Ayah 33: They will enter the Gardens of Eternity, where they will be adorned with bracelets of gold and pearls, and their clothing will be silk. | جنات عدن يدخلونها يحلون فيها من اساور من ذهب ولؤلؤا ولباسهم فيها حرير

Surah 35 Faatir, Ayah 34: And they will say, “Praise be to Allah, Who has kept away from us all ˹causes of˺ sorrow. Our Lord is indeed All-Forgiving, Most Appreciative. | وقالوا الحمد لله الذي اذهب عنا الحزن ان ربنا لغفور شكور

Surah 35 Faatir, Ayah 35: ˹He is the One˺ Who—out of His grace—has settled us in the Home of Everlasting Stay, where we will be touched by neither fatigue nor weariness.” | الذي احلنا دار المقامة من فضله لا يمسنا فيها نصب ولا يمسنا فيها لغوب

Surah 35 Faatir, Ayah 36: As for the disbelievers, they will have the Fire of Hell, where they will not be ˹allowed to be˺ finished by death, nor will its torment be lightened for them. This is how We reward every ˹stubborn˺ disbeliever. | والذين كفروا لهم نار جهنم لا يقضى عليهم فيموتوا ولا يخفف عنهم من عذابها كذلك نجزي كل كفور

Surah 35 Faatir, Ayah 37: There they will be ˹fervently˺ screaming, “Our Lord! Take us out ˹and send us back˺. We will do good, unlike what we used to do.” ˹They will be told,˺ “Did We not give you lives long enough so that whoever wanted to be mindful could have done so? And the warner came to you. So taste ˹the punishment˺, for the wrongdoers have no helper.” | وهم يصطرخون فيها ربنا اخرجنا نعمل صالحا غير الذي كنا نعمل اولم نعمركم ما يتذكر فيه من تذكر وجاءكم النذير فذوقوا فما للظالمين من نصير

Surah 35 Faatir, Ayah 38: Indeed, Allah is the Knower of the unseen of the heavens and the earth. He surely knows best what is ˹hidden˺ in the heart. | ان الله عالم غيب السماوات والارض انه عليم بذات الصدور

Surah 35 Faatir, Ayah 39: He is the One Who has placed you as successors on earth. So whoever disbelieves will bear ˹the burden of˺ their own disbelief. The disbelievers’ denial only increases them in contempt in the sight of their Lord, and it will only contribute to their loss. | هو الذي جعلكم خلائف في الارض فمن كفر فعليه كفره ولا يزيد الكافرين كفرهم عند ربهم الا مقتا ولا يزيد الكافرين كفرهم الا خسارا

Surah 35 Faatir, Ayah 40: Ask ˹them, O  Prophet˺, “Have you considered your associate-gods which you invoke besides Allah? Show me what they have created on earth! Or do they have a share in ˹the creation of˺ the heavens? Or have We given the polytheists a Book, which serves as a clear proof for them? In fact, the wrongdoers promise each other nothing but delusion.” | قل ارايتم شركاءكم الذين تدعون من دون الله اروني ماذا خلقوا من الارض ام لهم شرك في السماوات ام اتيناهم كتابا فهم على بينت منه بل ان يعد الظالمون بعضهم بعضا الا غرورا

Surah 35 Faatir, Ayah 41: Indeed, Allah ˹alone˺ keeps the heavens and the earth from falling apart. If they were to fall apart, none but Him could hold them up. He is truly Most Forbearing, All-Forgiving. | ان الله يمسك السماوات والارض ان تزولا ولئن زالتا ان امسكهما من احد من بعده انه كان حليما غفورا

Surah 35 Faatir, Ayah 42: They swore by Allah their most solemn oaths that if a warner were to come to them, they would certainly be better guided than any other community. Yet when a warner did come to them, it only drove them farther away— | واقسموا بالله جهد ايمانهم لئن جاءهم نذير ليكونن اهدى من احدى الامم فلما جاءهم نذير ما زادهم الا نفورا

Surah 35 Faatir, Ayah 43: behaving arrogantly in the land and plotting evil. But evil plotting only backfires on those who plot. Are they awaiting anything but the fate of those ˹destroyed˺ before? You will find no change in the way of Allah, nor will you find it diverted ˹to someone else˺. | استكبارا في الارض ومكر السيئ ولا يحيق المكر السيئ الا باهله فهل ينظرون الا سنت الاولين فلن تجد لسنت الله تبديلا ولن تجد لسنت الله تحويلا

Surah 35 Faatir, Ayah 44: Have they not travelled throughout the land to see what was the end of those ˹destroyed˺ before them? They were far superior in might. But there is nothing that can escape Allah in the heavens or the earth. He is certainly All-Knowing, Most Capable. | اولم يسيروا في الارض فينظروا كيف كان عاقبة الذين من قبلهم وكانوا اشد منهم قوة وما كان الله ليعجزه من شيء في السماوات ولا في الارض انه كان عليما قديرا

Surah 35 Faatir, Ayah 45: If Allah were to punish people ˹immediately˺ for what they have committed, He would not have left a single living being on earth. But He delays them for an appointed term. And when their time arrives, then surely Allah is All-Seeing of His servants. | ولو يؤاخذ الله الناس بما كسبوا ما ترك على ظهرها من دابة ولكن يؤخرهم الى اجل مسمى فاذا جاء اجلهم فان الله كان بعباده بصيرا
Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 1: Yâ-Sĩn. | يس
Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 2: By the Quran, rich in wisdom! | والقران الحكيم
Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 3: You ˹O Prophet˺ are truly one of the messengers | انك لمن المرسلين
Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 4: upon the Straight Path. | على صراط مستقيم
Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 5: ˹This is˺ a revelation from the Almighty, Most Merciful | تنزيل العزيز الرحيم
Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 6: so that you may warn a people whose forefathers were not warned, and so are heedless. | لتنذر قوما ما انذر اباؤهم فهم غافلون
Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 7: The decree ˹of torment˺ has already been justified against most of them, for they will never believe. | لقد حق القول على اكثرهم فهم لا يؤمنون
Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 8: ˹It is as if˺ We have put shackles around their necks up to their chins, so their heads are forced up | انا جعلنا في اعناقهم اغلالا فهي الى الاذقان فهم مقمحون

Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 9: and have placed a barrier before them and a barrier behind them and covered them ˹all˺ up, so they fail to see ˹the truth˺. | وجعلنا من بين ايديهم سدا ومن خلفهم سدا فاغشيناهم فهم لا يبصرون
Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 10: It is the same whether you warn them or not—they will never believe. | وسواء عليهم اانذرتهم ام لم تنذرهم لا يؤمنون

Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 11: You can only warn those who follow the Reminder and are in awe of the Most Compassionate without seeing Him. So give them good news of forgiveness and an honourable reward. | انما تنذر من اتبع الذكر وخشي الرحمن بالغيب فبشره بمغفرة واجر كريم

Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 12: It is certainly We Who resurrect the dead, and write what they send forth and what they leave behind. Everything is listed by Us in a perfect Record. | انا نحن نحيي الموتى ونكتب ما قدموا واثارهم وكل شيء احصيناه في امام مبين
Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 13: Give them an example ˹O Prophet˺ of the residents of a town, when the messengers came to them. | واضرب لهم مثلا اصحاب القرية اذ جاءها المرسلون

Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 14: We sent them two messengers, but they rejected both. So We reinforced ˹the two˺ with a third, and they declared, “We have indeed been sent to you ˹as messengers˺.” | اذ ارسلنا اليهم اثنين فكذبوهما فعززنا بثالث فقالوا انا اليكم مرسلون

Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 15: The people replied, “You are only humans like us, and the Most Compassionate has not revealed anything. You are simply lying!” | قالوا ما انتم الا بشر مثلنا وما انزل الرحمن من شيء ان انتم الا تكذبون
Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 16: The messengers responded, “Our Lord knows that we have truly been sent to you. | قالوا ربنا يعلم انا اليكم لمرسلون
Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 17: And our duty is only to deliver ˹the message˺ clearly.” | وما علينا الا البلاغ المبين

Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 18: The people replied, “We definitely see you as a bad omen for us. If you do not desist, we will certainly stone you ˹to death˺ and you will be touched with a painful punishment from us.” | قالوا انا تطيرنا بكم لئن لم تنتهوا لنرجمنكم وليمسنكم منا عذاب اليم

Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 19: The messengers said, “Your bad omen lies within yourselves. Are you saying this because you are reminded ˹of the truth˺? In fact, you are a transgressing people.” | قالوا طائركم معكم ائن ذكرتم بل انتم قوم مسرفون
Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 20: Then from the farthest end of the city a man came, rushing. He advised, “O my people! Follow the messengers. | وجاء من اقصى المدينة رجل يسعى قال يا قوم اتبعوا المرسلين
Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 21: Follow those who ask no reward of you, and are ˹rightly˺ guided. | اتبعوا من لا يسالكم اجرا وهم مهتدون
Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 22: And why should I not worship the One Who has originated me, and to Whom you will be returned. | وما لي لا اعبد الذي فطرني واليه ترجعون

Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 23: How could I take besides Him other gods whose intercession would not be of any benefit to me, nor could they save me if the Most Compassionate intended to harm me? | ااتخذ من دونه الهة ان يردن الرحمن بضر لا تغن عني شفاعتهم شيئا ولا ينقذون
Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 24: Indeed, I would then be clearly astray. | اني اذا لفي ضلال مبين
Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 25: I do believe in your Lord, so listen to me.” | اني امنت بربكم فاسمعون
Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 26: ˹But they killed him, then˺ he was told ˹by the angels˺, “Enter Paradise!” He said, “If only my people knew | قيل ادخل الجنة قال يا ليت قومي يعلمون
Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 27: of how my Lord has forgiven me, and made me one of the honourable.” | بما غفر لي ربي وجعلني من المكرمين
Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 28: We did not send any soldiers from the heavens against his people after his death, nor did We need to. | وما انزلنا على قومه من بعده من جند من السماء وما كنا منزلين
Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 29: All it took was one ˹mighty˺ blast, and they were extinguished at once. | ان كانت الا صيحة واحدة فاذا هم خامدون
Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 30: Oh pity, such beings! No messenger ever came to them without being mocked. | يا حسرة على العباد ما ياتيهم من رسول الا كانوا به يستهزئون
Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 31: Have the deniers not considered how many peoples We destroyed before them who never came back to life again? | الم يروا كم اهلكنا قبلهم من القرون انهم اليهم لا يرجعون
Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 32: Yet they will all be brought before Us. | وان كل لما جميع لدينا محضرون
Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 33: There is a sign for them in the dead earth: We give it life, producing grain from it for them to eat. | واية لهم الارض الميتة احييناها واخرجنا منها حبا فمنه ياكلون
Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 34: And We have placed in it gardens of palm trees and grapevines, and caused springs to gush forth in it | وجعلنا فيها جنات من نخيل واعناب وفجرنا فيها من العيون
Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 35: so that they may eat from its fruit, which they had no hand in making. Will they not then give thanks? | لياكلوا من ثمره وما عملته ايديهم افلا يشكرون

Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 36: Glory be to the One Who created all ˹things in˺ pairs—˹be it˺ what the earth produces, their genders, or what they do not know! | سبحان الذي خلق الازواج كلها مما تنبت الارض ومن انفسهم ومما لا يعلمون
Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 37: There is also a sign for them in the night: We strip from it daylight, then—behold!—they are in darkness. | واية لهم الليل نسلخ منه النهار فاذا هم مظلمون
Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 38: The sun travels for its fixed term. That is the design of the Almighty, All-Knowing. | والشمس تجري لمستقر لها ذلك تقدير العزيز العليم
Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 39: As for the moon, We have ordained ˹precise˺ phases for it, until it ends up like an old, curved palm stalk. | والقمر قدرناه منازل حتى عاد كالعرجون القديم

Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 40: It is not for the sun to catch up with the moon, nor does the night outrun the day. Each is travelling in an orbit of their own. | لا الشمس ينبغي لها ان تدرك القمر ولا الليل سابق النهار وكل في فلك يسبحون
Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 41: Another sign for them is that We carried their ancestors ˹with Noah˺ in the fully loaded Ark | واية لهم انا حملنا ذريتهم في الفلك المشحون
Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 42: and created for them similar things to ride in. | وخلقنا لهم من مثله ما يركبون
Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 43: If We willed, We could drown them: then no one would respond to their cries, nor would they be rescued— | وان نشا نغرقهم فلا صريخ لهم ولا هم ينقذون
Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 44: except by mercy from Us, allowing them enjoyment for a ˹little˺ while. | الا رحمة منا ومتاعا الى حين

Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 45: ˹Still they turn away˺ when it is said to them, “Beware of what is ahead of you ˹in the Hereafter˺ and what is behind you ˹of destroyed nations˺ so you may be shown mercy.” | واذا قيل لهم اتقوا ما بين ايديكم وما خلفكم لعلكم ترحمون
Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 46: Whenever a sign comes to them from their Lord, they turn away from it. | وما تاتيهم من اية من ايات ربهم الا كانوا عنها معرضين

Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 47: And when it is said to them, “Donate from what Allah has provided for you,” the disbelievers say to the believers, “Why should we feed those whom Allah could have fed if He wanted to? You are clearly astray!” | واذا قيل لهم انفقوا مما رزقكم الله قال الذين كفروا للذين امنوا انطعم من لو يشاء الله اطعمه ان انتم الا في ضلال مبين
Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 48: And they ask ˹the believers˺, “When will this threat come to pass, if what you say is true?” | ويقولون متى هذا الوعد ان كنتم صادقين
Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 49: They must be awaiting a single Blast, which will seize them while they are ˹entrenched˺ in ˹worldly˺ disputes. | ما ينظرون الا صيحة واحدة تاخذهم وهم يخصمون
Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 50: Then they will not be able to make a ˹last˺ will, nor can they return to their own people. | فلا يستطيعون توصية ولا الى اهلهم يرجعون
Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 51: The Trumpet will be blown ˹a second time˺, then—behold!—they will rush from the graves to their Lord. | ونفخ في الصور فاذا هم من الاجداث الى ربهم ينسلون

Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 52: They will cry, “Woe to us! Who has raised us up from our place of rest? This must be what the Most Compassionate warned us of; the messengers told the truth!” | قالوا يا ويلنا من بعثنا من مرقدنا هذا ما وعد الرحمن وصدق المرسلون
Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 53: It will only take one Blast, then at once they will all be brought before Us. | ان كانت الا صيحة واحدة فاذا هم جميع لدينا محضرون
Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 54: On that Day no soul will be wronged in the least, nor will you be rewarded except for what you used to do. | فاليوم لا تظلم نفس شيئا ولا تجزون الا ما كنتم تعملون
Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 55: Indeed, on that Day the residents of Paradise will be busy enjoying themselves. | ان اصحاب الجنة اليوم في شغل فاكهون
Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 56: They and their spouses will be in ˹cool˺ shade, reclining on ˹canopied˺ couches. | هم وازواجهم في ظلال على الارائك متكئون
Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 57: There they will have fruits and whatever they desire. | لهم فيها فاكهة ولهم ما يدعون
Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 58: And “Peace!” will be ˹their˺ greeting from the Merciful Lord. | سلام قولا من رب رحيم
Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 59: ˹Then the disbelievers will be told,˺ “Step away ˹from the believers˺ this Day, O  wicked ones! | وامتازوا اليوم ايها المجرمون
Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 60: Did I not command you, O  Children of Adam, not to follow Satan, for he is truly your sworn enemy | الم اعهد اليكم يا بني ادم ان لا تعبدوا الشيطان انه لكم عدو مبين
Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 61: but to worship Me ˹alone˺? This is the Straight Path. | وان اعبدوني هذا صراط مستقيم
Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 62: Yet he already misled great multitudes of you. Did you not have any sense? | ولقد اضل منكم جبلا كثيرا افلم تكونوا تعقلون
Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 63: This is the Hell you were warned of. | هذه جهنم التي كنتم توعدون
Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 64: Burn in it Today for your disbelief.” | اصلوها اليوم بما كنتم تكفرون

Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 65: On this Day We will seal their mouths, their hands will speak to Us, and their feet will testify to what they used to commit. | اليوم نختم على افواههم وتكلمنا ايديهم وتشهد ارجلهم بما كانوا يكسبون

Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 66: Had We willed, We could have easily blinded their eyes, so they would struggle to find their way. How then could they see? | ولو نشاء لطمسنا على اعينهم فاستبقوا الصراط فانى يبصرون

Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 67: And had We willed, We could have transfigured them on the spot, so they could neither progress forward nor turn back. | ولو نشاء لمسخناهم على مكانتهم فما استطاعوا مضيا ولا يرجعون
Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 68: And whoever We grant a long life, We reverse them in development. Will they not then understand? | ومن نعمره ننكسه في الخلق افلا يعقلون
Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 69: We have not taught him poetry, nor is it fitting for him. This ˹Book˺ is only a Reminder and a clear Quran | وما علمناه الشعر وما ينبغي له ان هو الا ذكر وقران مبين
Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 70: to warn whoever is ˹truly˺ alive and fulfil the decree ˹of torment˺ against the disbelievers. | لينذر من كان حيا ويحق القول على الكافرين

Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 71: Do they not see that We singlehandedly created for them, among other things, cattle which are under their control? | اولم يروا انا خلقنا لهم مما عملت ايدينا انعاما فهم لها مالكون
Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 72: And We have subjected these ˹animals˺ to them, so they may ride some and eat others. | وذللناها لهم فمنها ركوبهم ومنها ياكلون
Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 73: And they derive from them other benefits and drinks. Will they not then give thanks? | ولهم فيها منافع ومشارب افلا يشكرون
Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 74: Still they have taken other gods besides Allah, hoping to be helped ˹by them˺. | واتخذوا من دون الله الهة لعلهم ينصرون
Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 75: They cannot help the pagans, even though they serve the idols as dedicated guards. | لا يستطيعون نصرهم وهم لهم جند محضرون
Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 76: So do not let their words grieve you ˹O Prophet˺. Indeed, We ˹fully˺ know what they conceal and what they reveal. | فلا يحزنك قولهم انا نعلم ما يسرون وما يعلنون
Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 77: Do people not see that We have created them from a sperm-drop, then—behold!—they openly challenge ˹Us˺? | اولم ير الانسان انا خلقناه من نطفة فاذا هو خصيم مبين
Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 78: And they argue with Us—forgetting they were created—saying, “Who will give life to decayed bones?” | وضرب لنا مثلا ونسي خلقه قال من يحيي العظام وهي رميم

Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 79: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “They will be revived by the One Who produced them the first time, for He has ˹perfect˺ knowledge of every created being. | قل يحييها الذي انشاها اول مرة وهو بكل خلق عليم
Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 80: ˹He is the One˺ Who gives you fire from green trees, and—behold!—you kindle ˹fire˺ from them. | الذي جعل لكم من الشجر الاخضر نارا فاذا انتم منه توقدون

Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 81: Can the One Who created the heavens and the earth not ˹easily˺ resurrect these ˹deniers˺?” Yes ˹He can˺! For He is the Master Creator, All-Knowing. | اوليس الذي خلق السماوات والارض بقادر على ان يخلق مثلهم بلى وهو الخلاق العليم
Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 82: All it takes, when He wills something ˹to be˺, is simply to say to it: “Be!” And it is! | انما امره اذا اراد شيئا ان يقول له كن فيكون
Surah 36 Yaseen, Ayah 83: So glory be to the One in Whose Hands is the authority over all things, and to Whom ˹alone˺ you will ˹all˺ be returned. | فسبحان الذي بيده ملكوت كل شيء واليه ترجعون
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 1: By those ˹angels˺ lined up in ranks | والصافات صفا
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 2: and those who diligently drive ˹the clouds˺ | فالزاجرات زجرا
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 3: and those who recite the Reminder! | فالتاليات ذكرا
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 4: Surely your God is One! | ان الهكم لواحد
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 5: ˹He is˺ the Lord of the heavens and the earth and everything in between, and the Lord of all points of sunrise. | رب السماوات والارض وما بينهما ورب المشارق
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 6: Indeed, We have adorned the lowest heaven with the stars for decoration | انا زينا السماء الدنيا بزينة الكواكب
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 7: and ˹for˺ protection from every rebellious devil. | وحفظا من كل شيطان مارد
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 8: They cannot listen to the highest assembly ˹of angels˺ for they are pelted from every side | لا يسمعون الى الملا الاعلى ويقذفون من كل جانب
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 9: ˹fiercely˺ driven away. And they will suffer an everlasting torment. | دحورا ولهم عذاب واصب
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 10: But whoever manages to stealthily eavesdrop is ˹instantly˺ pursued by a piercing flare. | الا من خطف الخطفة فاتبعه شهاب ثاقب

Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 11: So ask them ˹O Prophet˺, which is harder to create: them or other marvels of Our creation? Indeed, We created them from a sticky clay. | فاستفتهم اهم اشد خلقا ام من خلقنا انا خلقناهم من طين لازب
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 12: In fact, you are astonished ˹by their denial˺, while they ridicule ˹you˺. | بل عجبت ويسخرون
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 13: When they are reminded, they are never mindful. | واذا ذكروا لا يذكرون
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 14: And whenever they see a sign, they make fun of it | واذا راوا اية يستسخرون
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 15: saying, “This is nothing but pure magic. | وقالوا ان هذا الا سحر مبين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 16: When we are dead and reduced to dust and bones, will we really be resurrected? | ااذا متنا وكنا ترابا وعظاما اانا لمبعوثون
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 17: And our forefathers as well?” | اواباؤنا الاولون
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 18: Say, “Yes! And you will be fully humbled.” | قل نعم وانتم داخرون
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 19: It will only take one Blast, then at once they will see ˹it all˺. | فانما هي زجرة واحدة فاذا هم ينظرون
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 20: They will cry, “Oh, woe to us! This is the Day of Judgment!” | وقالوا يا ويلنا هذا يوم الدين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 21: ˹They will be told,˺ “This is the Day of ˹Final˺ Decision which you used to deny.” | هذا يوم الفصل الذي كنتم به تكذبون
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 22: ˹Allah will say to the angels,˺ “Gather ˹all˺ the wrongdoers along with their peers, and whatever they used to worship | احشروا الذين ظلموا وازواجهم وما كانوا يعبدون
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 23: instead of Allah, then lead them ˹all˺ to the path of Hell. | من دون الله فاهدوهم الى صراط الجحيم
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 24: And detain them, for they must be questioned.” | وقفوهم انهم مسئولون
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 25: ˹Then they will be asked,˺ “What is the matter with you that you can no longer help each other?” | ما لكم لا تناصرون
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 26: In fact, on that Day they will be ˹fully˺ submissive. | بل هم اليوم مستسلمون
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 27: They will turn on each other, throwing blame. | واقبل بعضهم على بعض يتساءلون
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 28: The misled will say, “It was you who deluded us away from what is right.” | قالوا انكم كنتم تاتوننا عن اليمين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 29: The misleaders will reply, “No! You disbelieved on your own. | قالوا بل لم تكونوا مؤمنين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 30: We had no authority over you. In fact, you yourselves were a transgressing people. | وما كان لنا عليكم من سلطان بل كنتم قوما طاغين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 31: The decree of our Lord has come to pass against us ˹all˺: we will certainly taste ˹the punishment˺. | فحق علينا قول ربنا انا لذائقون
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 32: We caused you to deviate, for we ourselves were deviant.” | فاغويناكم انا كنا غاوين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 33: Surely on that Day they will ˹all˺ share in the punishment. | فانهم يومئذ في العذاب مشتركون
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 34: That is certainly how We deal with the wicked. | انا كذلك نفعل بالمجرمين

Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 35: For whenever it was said to them ˹in the world˺, “There is no god ˹worthy of worship˺ except Allah,” they acted arrogantly | انهم كانوا اذا قيل لهم لا اله الا الله يستكبرون
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 36: and argued, “Should we really abandon our gods for a mad poet?” | ويقولون ائنا لتاركو الهتنا لشاعر مجنون
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 37: In fact, he came with the truth, confirming ˹earlier˺ messengers. | بل جاء بالحق وصدق المرسلين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 38: You will certainly taste the painful torment | انكم لذائقو العذاب الاليم
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 39: and will only be rewarded for what you used to do. | وما تجزون الا ما كنتم تعملون
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 40: But not the chosen servants of Allah. | الا عباد الله المخلصين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 41: They will have a known provision: | اولئك لهم رزق معلوم
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 42: fruits ˹of every type˺. And they will be honoured | فواكه وهم مكرمون
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 43: in the Gardens of Bliss | في جنات النعيم
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 44: facing each other on thrones. | على سرر متقابلين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 45: A drink ˹of pure wine˺ will be passed around to them from a flowing stream: | يطاف عليهم بكاس من معين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 46: crystal-white, delicious to drink. | بيضاء لذة للشاربين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 47: It will neither harm ˹them˺, nor will they be intoxicated by it. | لا فيها غول ولا هم عنها ينزفون
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 48: And with them will be maidens of modest gaze and gorgeous eyes | وعندهم قاصرات الطرف عين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 49: as if they were pristine pearls. | كانهن بيض مكنون
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 50: Then they will turn to one another inquisitively. | فاقبل بعضهم على بعض يتساءلون
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 51: One of them will say, “I once had a companion ˹in the world˺ | قال قائل منهم اني كان لي قرين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 52: who used to ask ˹me˺, ‘Do you actually believe ˹in resurrection˺? | يقول اانك لمن المصدقين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 53: When we are dead and reduced to dust and bones, will we really be brought to judgment?’” | ااذا متنا وكنا ترابا وعظاما اانا لمدينون
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 54: He will ˹then˺ ask, “Would you care to see ˹his fate˺?” | قال هل انتم مطلعون
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 55: Then he ˹and the others˺ will look and spot him in the midst of the Hellfire. | فاطلع فراه في سواء الجحيم
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 56: He will ˹then˺ say, “By Allah! You nearly ruined me. | قال تالله ان كدت لتردين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 57: Had it not been for the grace of my Lord, I ˹too˺ would have certainly been among those brought ˹to Hell˺.” | ولولا نعمة ربي لكنت من المحضرين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 58: ˹Then he will ask his fellow believers,˺ “Can you imagine that we will never die | افما نحن بميتين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 59: except our first death, nor be punished ˹like the others˺?” | الا موتتنا الاولى وما نحن بمعذبين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 60: This is truly the ultimate triumph. | ان هذا لهو الفوز العظيم
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 61: For such ˹honour˺ all should strive. | لمثل هذا فليعمل العاملون
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 62: Is this ˹bliss˺ a better accommodation or the tree of Zaqqûm? | اذلك خير نزلا ام شجرة الزقوم
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 63: We have surely made it a test for the wrongdoers. | انا جعلناها فتنة للظالمين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 64: Indeed, it is a tree that grows in the depths of Hell | انها شجرة تخرج في اصل الجحيم
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 65: bearing fruit like devils’ heads. | طلعها كانه رءوس الشياطين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 66: The evildoers will certainly ˹be left to˺ eat from it, filling up their bellies with it. | فانهم لاكلون منها فمالئون منها البطون
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 67: Then on top of that they will be given a blend of boiling drink. | ثم ان لهم عليها لشوبا من حميم
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 68: Then they will ultimately return to ˹their place in˺ Hell. | ثم ان مرجعهم لالى الجحيم
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 69: Indeed, they found their forefathers astray | انهم الفوا اباءهم ضالين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 70: so they rushed in their footsteps! | فهم على اثارهم يهرعون
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 71: And surely most of the earlier generations had strayed before them | ولقد ضل قبلهم اكثر الاولين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 72: although We had certainly sent warners among them. | ولقد ارسلنا فيهم منذرين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 73: See then what was the end of those who had been warned. | فانظر كيف كان عاقبة المنذرين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 74: But not the chosen servants of Allah. | الا عباد الله المخلصين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 75: Indeed, Noah cried out to Us, and how excellent are We in responding! | ولقد نادانا نوح فلنعم المجيبون
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 76: We delivered him and his family from the great distress | ونجيناه واهله من الكرب العظيم
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 77: and made his descendants the sole survivors. | وجعلنا ذريته هم الباقين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 78: And We blessed him ˹with honourable mention˺ among later generations: | وتركنا عليه في الاخرين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 79: “Peace be upon Noah among all peoples.” | سلام على نوح في العالمين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 80: Indeed, this is how We reward the good-doers. | انا كذلك نجزي المحسنين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 81: ˹For˺ he was truly one of Our faithful servants. | انه من عبادنا المؤمنين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 82: Then We drowned the others. | ثم اغرقنا الاخرين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 83: And indeed, one of those who followed his way was Abraham. | وان من شيعته لابراهيم
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 84: ˹Remember˺ when he came to his Lord with a pure heart | اذ جاء ربه بقلب سليم
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 85: and said to his father and his people, “What are you worshipping? | اذ قال لابيه وقومه ماذا تعبدون
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 86: Is it false gods that you desire instead of Allah? | ائفكا الهة دون الله تريدون
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 87: What then do you expect from the Lord of all worlds?” | فما ظنكم برب العالمين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 88: He later looked up to the stars ˹in contemplation˺ | فنظر نظرة في النجوم
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 89: then said, “I am really sick.” | فقال اني سقيم
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 90: So they turned their backs on him and went away. | فتولوا عنه مدبرين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 91: Then he ˹stealthily˺ advanced towards their gods, and said ˹mockingly˺, “Will you not eat ˹your offerings˺? | فراغ الى الهتهم فقال الا تاكلون
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 92: What is wrong with you that you cannot speak?” | ما لكم لا تنطقون
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 93: Then he swiftly turned on them, striking ˹them˺ with his right hand. | فراغ عليهم ضربا باليمين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 94: Later, his people came rushing towards him ˹furiously˺. | فاقبلوا اليه يزفون
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 95: He argued, “How can you worship what you carve ˹with your own hands˺ | قال اتعبدون ما تنحتون
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 96: when it is Allah Who created you and whatever you do?” | والله خلقكم وما تعملون
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 97: They said ˹to one another˺, “Build him a furnace and cast him into the blazing fire.” | قالوا ابنوا له بنيانا فالقوه في الجحيم
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 98: And so they sought to harm him, but We made them inferior. | فارادوا به كيدا فجعلناهم الاسفلين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 99: He later said, “I am leaving ˹in obedience˺ to my Lord. He will guide me. | وقال اني ذاهب الى ربي سيهدين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 100: My Lord! Bless me with righteous offspring.” | رب هب لي من الصالحين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 101: So We gave him good news of a forbearing son. | فبشرناه بغلام حليم

Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 102: Then when the boy reached the age to work with him, Abraham said, “O my dear son! I have seen in a dream that I ˹must˺ sacrifice you. So tell me what you think.” He replied, “O my dear father! Do as you are commanded. Allah willing, you will find me steadfast.” | فلما بلغ معه السعي قال يا بني اني ارى في المنام اني اذبحك فانظر ماذا ترى قال يا ابت افعل ما تؤمر ستجدني ان شاء الله من الصابرين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 103: Then when they submitted ˹to Allah’s Will˺, and Abraham laid him on the side of his forehead ˹for sacrifice˺ | فلما اسلما وتله للجبين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 104: We called out to him, “O Abraham! | وناديناه ان يا ابراهيم
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 105: You have already fulfilled the vision.” Indeed, this is how We reward the good-doers. | قد صدقت الرؤيا انا كذلك نجزي المحسنين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 106: That was truly a revealing test. | ان هذا لهو البلاء المبين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 107: And We ransomed his son with a great sacrifice | وفديناه بذبح عظيم
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 108: and blessed Abraham ˹with honourable mention˺ among later generations: | وتركنا عليه في الاخرين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 109: “Peace be upon Abraham.” | سلام على ابراهيم
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 110: This is how We reward the good-doers. | كذلك نجزي المحسنين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 111: He was truly one of Our faithful servants. | انه من عبادنا المؤمنين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 112: We ˹later˺ gave him good news of Isaac—a prophet, and one of the righteous. | وبشرناه باسحاق نبيا من الصالحين

Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 113: We blessed him and Isaac as well. Some of their descendants did good, while others clearly wronged themselves. | وباركنا عليه وعلى اسحاق ومن ذريتهما محسن وظالم لنفسه مبين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 114: And We certainly showed favour to Moses and Aaron | ولقد مننا على موسى وهارون
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 115: and delivered them and their people from the great distress. | ونجيناهما وقومهما من الكرب العظيم
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 116: We helped them so it was they who prevailed. | ونصرناهم فكانوا هم الغالبين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 117: We gave them the clear Scripture | واتيناهما الكتاب المستبين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 118: and guided them to the Straight Path. | وهديناهما الصراط المستقيم
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 119: And We blessed them ˹with honourable mention˺ among later generations: | وتركنا عليهما في الاخرين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 120: “Peace be upon Moses and Aaron.” | سلام على موسى وهارون
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 121: Indeed, this is how We reward the good-doers. | انا كذلك نجزي المحسنين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 122: They were truly ˹two˺ of Our faithful servants. | انهما من عبادنا المؤمنين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 123: And Elias was indeed one of the messengers. | وان الياس لمن المرسلين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 124: ˹Remember˺ when he said to his people, “Will you not fear ˹Allah˺? | اذ قال لقومه الا تتقون
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 125: Do you call upon ˹the idol of˺ Ba’l and abandon the Best of Creators— | اتدعون بعلا وتذرون احسن الخالقين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 126: Allah, your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers?” | الله ربكم ورب ابائكم الاولين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 127: But they rejected him, so they will certainly be brought ˹for punishment˺. | فكذبوه فانهم لمحضرون
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 128: But not the chosen servants of Allah. | الا عباد الله المخلصين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 129: We blessed him ˹with honourable mention˺ among later generations: | وتركنا عليه في الاخرين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 130: “Peace be upon Elias.” | سلام على ال ياسين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 131: Indeed, this is how We reward the good-doers. | انا كذلك نجزي المحسنين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 132: He was truly one of Our faithful servants. | انه من عبادنا المؤمنين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 133: And Lot was indeed one of the messengers. | وان لوطا لمن المرسلين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 134: ˹Remember˺ when We delivered him and all of his family | اذ نجيناه واهله اجمعين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 135: except an old woman, who was one of the doomed. | الا عجوزا في الغابرين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 136: Then We ˹utterly˺ destroyed the rest. | ثم دمرنا الاخرين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 137: You ˹Meccans˺ certainly pass by their ruins day | وانكم لتمرون عليهم مصبحين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 138: and night. Will you not then understand? | وبالليل افلا تعقلون
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 139: And Jonah was indeed one of the messengers. | وان يونس لمن المرسلين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 140: ˹Remember˺ when he fled to the overloaded ship. | اذ ابق الى الفلك المشحون
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 141: Then ˹to save it from sinking,˺ he drew straws ˹with other passengers˺. He lost ˹and was thrown overboard˺. | فساهم فكان من المدحضين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 142: Then the whale engulfed him while he was blameworthy. | فالتقمه الحوت وهو مليم
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 143: Had he not ˹constantly˺ glorified ˹Allah˺ | فلولا انه كان من المسبحين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 144: he would have certainly remained in its belly until the Day of Resurrection. | للبث في بطنه الى يوم يبعثون
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 145: But We cast him onto the open ˹shore˺, ˹totally˺ worn out | فنبذناه بالعراء وهو سقيم
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 146: and caused a squash plant to grow over him. | وانبتنا عليه شجرة من يقطين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 147: We ˹later˺ sent him ˹back˺ to ˹his city of˺ at least one hundred thousand people | وارسلناه الى مائة الف او يزيدون
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 148: who then believed ˹in him˺, so We allowed them enjoyment for a while. | فامنوا فمتعناهم الى حين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 149: Ask them ˹O Prophet˺ if your Lord has daughters, while the pagans ˹prefer to˺ have sons. | فاستفتهم الربك البنات ولهم البنون
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 150: Or ˹ask them˺ if We created the angels as females right before their eyes. | ام خلقنا الملائكة اناثا وهم شاهدون
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 151: Indeed, it is one of their ˹outrageous˺ fabrications to say | الا انهم من افكهم ليقولون
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 152: “Allah has children.” They are simply liars. | ولد الله وانهم لكاذبون
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 153: Has He chosen daughters over sons? | اصطفى البنات على البنين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 154: What is the matter with you? How do you judge? | ما لكم كيف تحكمون
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 155: Will you not then be mindful? | افلا تذكرون
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 156: Or do you have ˹any˺ compelling proof? | ام لكم سلطان مبين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 157: Then bring ˹us˺ your scripture, if what you say is true! | فاتوا بكتابكم ان كنتم صادقين

Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 158: They have also established a ˹marital˺ relationship between Him and the jinn. Yet the jinn ˹themselves˺ know well that such people will certainly be brought ˹for punishment˺. | وجعلوا بينه وبين الجنة نسبا ولقد علمت الجنة انهم لمحضرون
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 159: Glorified is Allah far above what they claim! | سبحان الله عما يصفون
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 160: But not the chosen servants of Allah. | الا عباد الله المخلصين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 161: Surely you ˹pagans˺ and whatever ˹idols˺ you worship | فانكم وما تعبدون
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 162: can never lure ˹anyone˺ away from Him | ما انتم عليه بفاتنين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 163: except those ˹destined˺ to burn in Hell. | الا من هو صال الجحيم
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 164: ˹The angels respond,˺ “There is not one of us without an assigned station ˹of worship˺. | وما منا الا له مقام معلوم
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 165: We are indeed the ones lined up in ranks ˹for Allah˺. | وانا لنحن الصافون
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 166: And we are indeed the ones ˹constantly˺ glorifying ˹His praise˺.” | وانا لنحن المسبحون
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 167: They certainly used to say | وان كانوا ليقولون
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 168: “If only we had a Reminder like ˹those of˺ earlier peoples | لو ان عندنا ذكرا من الاولين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 169: we would have truly been Allah’s devoted servants.” | لكنا عباد الله المخلصين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 170: But ˹now˺ they reject it, so they will soon know. | فكفروا به فسوف يعلمون
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 171: Our Word has already gone forth to Our servants, the messengers | ولقد سبقت كلمتنا لعبادنا المرسلين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 172: that they would surely be helped | انهم لهم المنصورون
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 173: and that Our forces will certainly prevail. | وان جندنا لهم الغالبون
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 174: So turn away from the deniers for a while ˹O Prophet˺. | فتول عنهم حتى حين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 175: You will see ˹what will happen to˺ them, and they too will see! | وابصرهم فسوف يبصرون
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 176: Do they ˹really˺ wish to hasten Our punishment? | افبعذابنا يستعجلون
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 177: Yet when it descends upon them: how evil will that morning be for those who had been warned! | فاذا نزل بساحتهم فساء صباح المنذرين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 178: And turn away from them for a while. | وتول عنهم حتى حين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 179: You will see, and they too will see! | وابصر فسوف يبصرون
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 180: Glorified is your Lord—the Lord of Honour and Power—above what they claim! | سبحان ربك رب العزة عما يصفون
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 181: Peace be upon the messengers. | وسلام على المرسلين
Surah 37 As-Saaffaat, Ayah 182: And praise be to Allah—Lord of all worlds. | والحمد لله رب العالمين
Surah 38 Saad, Ayah 1: Ṣãd. By the Quran, full of reminders! | ص والقران ذي الذكر
Surah 38 Saad, Ayah 2: ˹This is the truth,˺ yet the disbelievers are ˹entrenched˺ in arrogance and opposition. | بل الذين كفروا في عزة وشقاق
Surah 38 Saad, Ayah 3: ˹Imagine˺ how many peoples We destroyed before them, and they cried out when it was too late to escape. | كم اهلكنا من قبلهم من قرن فنادوا ولات حين مناص

Surah 38 Saad, Ayah 4: Now, the pagans are astonished that a warner has come to them from among themselves. And the disbelievers say, “This is a magician, a total liar! | وعجبوا ان جاءهم منذر منهم وقال الكافرون هذا ساحر كذاب
Surah 38 Saad, Ayah 5: Has he reduced ˹all˺ the gods to One God? Indeed, this is something totally astonishing.” | اجعل الالهة الها واحدا ان هذا لشيء عجاب

Surah 38 Saad, Ayah 6: The chiefs among them went forth saying, “Carry on, and stand firm in devotion to your gods. Certainly this is just a scheme ˹for power˺. | وانطلق الملا منهم ان امشوا واصبروا على الهتكم ان هذا لشيء يراد
Surah 38 Saad, Ayah 7: We have never heard of this in the previous faith. This is nothing but a fabrication. | ما سمعنا بهذا في الملة الاخرة ان هذا الا اختلاق

Surah 38 Saad, Ayah 8: Has the Reminder been revealed ˹only˺ to him out of ˹all of˺ us?” In fact, they are ˹only˺ in doubt of My ˹revealed˺ Reminder. In fact, ˹they do so because˺ they have not yet tasted My punishment. | اانزل عليه الذكر من بيننا بل هم في شك من ذكري بل لما يذوقوا عذاب
Surah 38 Saad, Ayah 9: Or ˹is it because˺ they possess the treasuries of the mercy of your Lord—the Almighty, the Giver ˹of all bounties˺. | ام عندهم خزائن رحمة ربك العزيز الوهاب

Surah 38 Saad, Ayah 10: Or ˹is it because˺ the kingdom of the heavens and the earth and everything in between belongs to them? Let them then climb their way ˹to heaven, if their claim is true˺. | ام لهم ملك السماوات والارض وما بينهما فليرتقوا في الاسباب
Surah 38 Saad, Ayah 11: This is just another ˹enemy˺ force bound for defeat out there. | جند ما هنالك مهزوم من الاحزاب
Surah 38 Saad, Ayah 12: Before them, the people of Noah denied ˹the truth˺, as did ’Âd, Pharaoh of the mighty structures | كذبت قبلهم قوم نوح وعاد وفرعون ذو الاوتاد
Surah 38 Saad, Ayah 13: Thamûd, the people of Lot, and the residents of the Forest. These were ˹all˺ enemy forces. | وثمود وقوم لوط واصحاب الايكة اولئك الاحزاب
Surah 38 Saad, Ayah 14: Each rejected their messenger, so My punishment was justified. | ان كل الا كذب الرسل فحق عقاب
Surah 38 Saad, Ayah 15: These ˹pagans˺ are awaiting nothing but a single Blast that cannot be stopped. | وما ينظر هؤلاء الا صيحة واحدة ما لها من فواق
Surah 38 Saad, Ayah 16: They say ˹mockingly˺, “Our Lord! Hasten for us our share ˹of the punishment˺ before the Day of Reckoning.” | وقالوا ربنا عجل لنا قطنا قبل يوم الحساب

Surah 38 Saad, Ayah 17: Be patient ˹O Prophet˺ with what they say. And remember Our servant, David, the man of strength. Indeed, he ˹constantly˺ turned ˹to Allah˺. | اصبر على ما يقولون واذكر عبدنا داوود ذا الايد انه اواب
Surah 38 Saad, Ayah 18: We truly subjected the mountains to hymn ˹Our praises˺ along with him in the evening and after sunrise. | انا سخرنا الجبال معه يسبحن بالعشي والاشراق
