Surah 64 At-Taghaabun, Ayah 2: He is the One Who created you, yet some of you are disbelievers while some are believers. And Allah is All-Seeing of what you do. | هو الذي خلقكم فمنكم كافر ومنكم مؤمن والله بما تعملون بصير

Surah 64 At-Taghaabun, Ayah 3: He created the heavens and the earth for a purpose. He shaped you ˹in the womb˺, perfecting your form. And to Him is the final return. | خلق السماوات والارض بالحق وصوركم فاحسن صوركم واليه المصير

Surah 64 At-Taghaabun, Ayah 4: He knows whatever is in the heavens and the earth. And He knows whatever you conceal and whatever you reveal. For Allah knows best what is ˹hidden˺ in the heart. | يعلم ما في السماوات والارض ويعلم ما تسرون وما تعلنون والله عليم بذات الصدور

Surah 64 At-Taghaabun, Ayah 5: Have the stories of those who disbelieved before not reached you ˹pagans˺? They tasted the evil consequences of their doings, and they will suffer a painful punishment. | الم ياتكم نبا الذين كفروا من قبل فذاقوا وبال امرهم ولهم عذاب اليم

Surah 64 At-Taghaabun, Ayah 6: That was because their messengers used to come to them with clear proofs, but they said ˹mockingly˺, “How can humans be our guides?” So they persisted in disbelief and turned away. And Allah was not in need ˹of their faith˺. For Allah is Self-Sufficient, Praiseworthy. | ذلك بانه كانت تاتيهم رسلهم بالبينات فقالوا ابشر يهدوننا فكفروا وتولوا واستغنى الله والله غني حميد

Surah 64 At-Taghaabun, Ayah 7: The disbelievers claim they will not be resurrected. Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Yes, by my Lord, you will surely be resurrected, then you will certainly be informed of what you have done. And that is easy for Allah.” | زعم الذين كفروا ان لن يبعثوا قل بلى وربي لتبعثن ثم لتنبؤن بما عملتم وذلك على الله يسير

Surah 64 At-Taghaabun, Ayah 8: So believe in Allah and His Messenger and in the Light We have revealed. And Allah is All-Aware of what you do. | فامنوا بالله ورسوله والنور الذي انزلنا والله بما تعملون خبير

Surah 64 At-Taghaabun, Ayah 9: ˹Consider˺ the Day He will gather you ˹all˺ for the Day of Gathering—that will be the Day of mutual loss and gain. So whoever believes in Allah and does good, He will absolve them of their sins and admit them into Gardens under which rivers flow, to stay there for ever and ever. That is the ultimate triumph. | يوم يجمعكم ليوم الجمع ذلك يوم التغابن ومن يؤمن بالله ويعمل صالحا يكفر عنه سيئاته ويدخله جنات تجري من تحتها الانهار خالدين فيها ابدا ذلك الفوز العظيم

Surah 64 At-Taghaabun, Ayah 10: As for those who disbelieve and reject Our revelations, they will be the residents of the Fire, staying there forever. What an evil destination! | والذين كفروا وكذبوا باياتنا اولئك اصحاب النار خالدين فيها وبئس المصير

Surah 64 At-Taghaabun, Ayah 11: No calamity befalls ˹anyone˺ except by Allah’s Will. And whoever has faith in Allah, He will ˹rightly˺ guide their hearts ˹through adversity˺. And Allah has ˹perfect˺ knowledge of all things. | ما اصاب من مصيبة الا باذن الله ومن يؤمن بالله يهد قلبه والله بكل شيء عليم

Surah 64 At-Taghaabun, Ayah 12: Obey Allah and obey the Messenger! But if you turn away, then Our Messenger’s duty is only to deliver ˹the message˺ clearly. | واطيعوا الله واطيعوا الرسول فان توليتم فانما على رسولنا البلاغ المبين
Surah 64 At-Taghaabun, Ayah 13: Allah—there is no god ˹worthy of worship˺ except Him. So in Allah let the believers put their trust. | الله لا اله الا هو وعلى الله فليتوكل المؤمنون

Surah 64 At-Taghaabun, Ayah 14: O believers! Indeed, some of your spouses and children are enemies to you, so beware of them. But if you pardon, overlook, and forgive ˹their faults˺, then Allah is truly All-Forgiving, Most Merciful. | يا ايها الذين امنوا ان من ازواجكم واولادكم عدوا لكم فاحذروهم وان تعفوا وتصفحوا وتغفروا فان الله غفور رحيم
Surah 64 At-Taghaabun, Ayah 15: Your wealth and children are only a test, but Allah ˹alone˺ has a great reward. | انما اموالكم واولادكم فتنة والله عنده اجر عظيم

Surah 64 At-Taghaabun, Ayah 16: So be mindful of Allah to the best of your ability, hear and obey, and spend in charity—that will be best for you. And whoever is saved from the selfishness of their own souls, it is they who are ˹truly˺ successful. | فاتقوا الله ما استطعتم واسمعوا واطيعوا وانفقوا خيرا لانفسكم ومن يوق شح نفسه فاولئك هم المفلحون

Surah 64 At-Taghaabun, Ayah 17: If you lend to Allah a good loan, He will multiply it for you and forgive you. For Allah is Most Appreciative, Most Forbearing. | ان تقرضوا الله قرضا حسنا يضاعفه لكم ويغفر لكم والله شكور حليم
Surah 64 At-Taghaabun, Ayah 18: ˹He is the˺ Knower of the seen and unseen—the Almighty, All-Wise. | عالم الغيب والشهادة العزيز الحكيم

Surah 65 At-Talaaq, Ayah 1: O Prophet! ˹Instruct the believers:˺ When you ˹intend to˺ divorce women, then divorce them with concern for their waiting period, and count it accurately. And fear Allah, your Lord. Do not force them out of their homes, nor should they leave—unless they commit a blatant misconduct. These are the limits set by Allah. And whoever transgresses Allah’s limits has truly wronged his own soul. You never know, perhaps Allah will bring about a change ˹of heart˺ later. | يا ايها النبي اذا طلقتم النساء فطلقوهن لعدتهن واحصوا العدة واتقوا الله ربكم لا تخرجوهن من بيوتهن ولا يخرجن الا ان ياتين بفاحشة مبينة وتلك حدود الله ومن يتعد حدود الله فقد ظلم نفسه لا تدري لعل الله يحدث بعد ذلك امرا

Surah 65 At-Talaaq, Ayah 2: Then when they have ˹almost˺ reached the end of their waiting period, either retain them honourably or separate from them honourably. And call two of your reliable men to witness ˹either way˺—and ˹let the witnesses˺ bear true testimony for ˹the sake of˺ Allah. This is enjoined on whoever has faith in Allah and the Last Day. And whoever is mindful of Allah, He will make a way out for them | فاذا بلغن اجلهن فامسكوهن بمعروف او فارقوهن بمعروف واشهدوا ذوي عدل منكم واقيموا الشهادة لله ذلكم يوعظ به من كان يؤمن بالله واليوم الاخر ومن يتق الله يجعل له مخرجا

Surah 65 At-Talaaq, Ayah 3: and provide for them from sources they could never imagine. And whoever puts their trust in Allah, then He ˹alone˺ is sufficient for them. Certainly Allah achieves His Will. Allah has already set a destiny for everything. | ويرزقه من حيث لا يحتسب ومن يتوكل على الله فهو حسبه ان الله بالغ امره قد جعل الله لكل شيء قدرا

Surah 65 At-Talaaq, Ayah 4: As for your women past the age of menstruation, in case you do not know, their waiting period is three months, and those who have not menstruated as well. As for those who are pregnant, their waiting period ends with delivery. And whoever is mindful of Allah, He will make their matters easy for them. | واللائي يئسن من المحيض من نسائكم ان ارتبتم فعدتهن ثلاثة اشهر واللائي لم يحضن واولات الاحمال اجلهن ان يضعن حملهن ومن يتق الله يجعل له من امره يسرا

Surah 65 At-Talaaq, Ayah 5: This is the commandment of Allah, which He has revealed to you. And whoever is mindful of Allah, He will absolve them of their sins and reward them immensely. | ذلك امر الله انزله اليكم ومن يتق الله يكفر عنه سيئاته ويعظم له اجرا

Surah 65 At-Talaaq, Ayah 6: Let them live where you live ˹during their waiting period˺, according to your means. And do not harass them to make their stay unbearable. If they are pregnant, then maintain them until they deliver. And if they nurse your child, compensate them, and consult together courteously. But if you fail to reach an agreement, then another woman will nurse ˹the child˺ for the father. | اسكنوهن من حيث سكنتم من وجدكم ولا تضاروهن لتضيقوا عليهن وان كن اولات حمل فانفقوا عليهن حتى يضعن حملهن فان ارضعن لكم فاتوهن اجورهن واتمروا بينكم بمعروف وان تعاسرتم فسترضع له اخرى

Surah 65 At-Talaaq, Ayah 7: Let the man of wealth provide according to his means. As for the one with limited resources, let him provide according to whatever Allah has given him. Allah does not require of any soul beyond what He has given it. After hardship, Allah will bring about ease. | لينفق ذو سعة من سعته ومن قدر عليه رزقه فلينفق مما اتاه الله لا يكلف الله نفسا الا ما اتاها سيجعل الله بعد عسر يسرا

Surah 65 At-Talaaq, Ayah 8: ˹Imagine˺ how many societies rebelled against the commandments of their Lord and His messengers, so We called each ˹society˺ to a severe account and subjected them to a horrible punishment. | وكاين من قرية عتت عن امر ربها ورسله فحاسبناها حسابا شديدا وعذبناها عذابا نكرا
Surah 65 At-Talaaq, Ayah 9: So they tasted the evil consequences of their doings, and the outcome of their doings was ˹total˺ loss. | فذاقت وبال امرها وكان عاقبة امرها خسرا

Surah 65 At-Talaaq, Ayah 10: Allah has ˹also˺ prepared for them a severe punishment. So fear Allah, O  people of reason and faith. Allah has indeed revealed to you a Reminder | اعد الله لهم عذابا شديدا فاتقوا الله يا اولي الالباب الذين امنوا قد انزل الله اليكم ذكرا

Surah 65 At-Talaaq, Ayah 11: ˹and sent˺ a messenger reciting to you Allah’s revelations, making things clear so that He may bring those who believe and do good out of darkness and into light. And whoever believes in Allah and does good will be admitted by Him into Gardens under which rivers flow, to stay there for ever and ever. Allah will have indeed granted them an excellent provision. | رسولا يتلو عليكم ايات الله مبينات ليخرج الذين امنوا وعملوا الصالحات من الظلمات الى النور ومن يؤمن بالله ويعمل صالحا يدخله جنات تجري من تحتها الانهار خالدين فيها ابدا قد احسن الله له رزقا

Surah 65 At-Talaaq, Ayah 12: Allah is the One Who created seven heavens ˹in layers˺, and likewise for the earth. The ˹divine˺ command descends between them so you may know that Allah is Most Capable of everything and that Allah certainly encompasses all things in ˹His˺ knowledge. | الله الذي خلق سبع سماوات ومن الارض مثلهن يتنزل الامر بينهن لتعلموا ان الله على كل شيء قدير وان الله قد احاط بكل شيء علما

Surah 66 At-Tahrim, Ayah 1: O Prophet! Why do you prohibit ˹yourself˺ from what Allah has made lawful to you, seeking to please your wives? And Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful. | يا ايها النبي لم تحرم ما احل الله لك تبتغي مرضات ازواجك والله غفور رحيم

Surah 66 At-Tahrim, Ayah 2: Allah has already ordained for you ˹believers˺ the way to absolve yourselves from your oaths. For Allah is your Guardian. And He is the All-Knowing, All-Wise. | قد فرض الله لكم تحلة ايمانكم والله مولاكم وهو العليم الحكيم

Surah 66 At-Tahrim, Ayah 3: ˹Remember˺ when the Prophet had ˹once˺ confided something to one of his wives, then when she disclosed it ˹to another wife˺ and Allah made it known to him, he presented ˹to her˺ part of what was disclosed and overlooked a part. So when he informed her of it, she exclaimed, “Who told you this?” He replied, “I was informed by the All-Knowing, All-Aware.” | واذ اسر النبي الى بعض ازواجه حديثا فلما نبات به واظهره الله عليه عرف بعضه واعرض عن بعض فلما نباها به قالت من انباك هذا قال نباني العليم الخبير

Surah 66 At-Tahrim, Ayah 4: ˹It will be better˺ if you ˹wives˺ both turn to Allah in repentance, for your hearts have certainly faltered. But if you ˹continue to˺ collaborate against him, then ˹know that˺ Allah Himself is his Guardian. And Gabriel, the righteous believers, and the angels are ˹all˺ his supporters as well. | ان تتوبا الى الله فقد صغت قلوبكما وان تظاهرا عليه فان الله هو مولاه وجبريل وصالح المؤمنين والملائكة بعد ذلك ظهير

Surah 66 At-Tahrim, Ayah 5: Perhaps, if he were to divorce you ˹all˺, his Lord would replace you with better wives who are submissive ˹to Allah˺, faithful ˹to Him˺, devout, repentant, dedicated to worship and fasting—previously married or virgins. | عسى ربه ان طلقكن ان يبدله ازواجا خيرا منكن مسلمات مؤمنات قانتات تائبات عابدات سائحات ثيبات وابكارا

Surah 66 At-Tahrim, Ayah 6: O believers! Protect yourselves and your families from a Fire whose fuel is people and stones, overseen by formidable and severe angels, who never disobey whatever Allah orders—always doing as commanded. | يا ايها الذين امنوا قوا انفسكم واهليكم نارا وقودها الناس والحجارة عليها ملائكة غلاظ شداد لا يعصون الله ما امرهم ويفعلون ما يؤمرون

Surah 66 At-Tahrim, Ayah 7: ˹The deniers will then be told,˺ “O disbelievers! Make no excuses this Day! You are only rewarded for what you used to do.” | يا ايها الذين كفروا لا تعتذروا اليوم انما تجزون ما كنتم تعملون

Surah 66 At-Tahrim, Ayah 8: O believers! Turn to Allah in sincere repentance, so your Lord may absolve you of your sins and admit you into Gardens, under which rivers flow, on the Day Allah will not disgrace the Prophet or the believers with him. Their light will shine ahead of them and on their right. They will say, “Our Lord! Perfect our light for us, and forgive us. ˹For˺ You are truly Most Capable of everything.” | يا ايها الذين امنوا توبوا الى الله توبة نصوحا عسى ربكم ان يكفر عنكم سيئاتكم ويدخلكم جنات تجري من تحتها الانهار يوم لا يخزي الله النبي والذين امنوا معه نورهم يسعى بين ايديهم وبايمانهم يقولون ربنا اتمم لنا نورنا واغفر لنا انك على كل شيء قدير

Surah 66 At-Tahrim, Ayah 9: O Prophet! Struggle against the disbelievers and the hypocrites, and be firm with them. Hell will be their home. What an evil destination! | يا ايها النبي جاهد الكفار والمنافقين واغلظ عليهم وماواهم جهنم وبئس المصير

Surah 66 At-Tahrim, Ayah 10: Allah sets forth an example for the disbelievers: the wife of Noah and the wife of Lot. Each was married to one of Our righteous servants, yet betrayed them. So their husbands were of no benefit to them against Allah whatsoever. Both were told, “Enter the Fire, along with the others!” | ضرب الله مثلا للذين كفروا امرات نوح وامرات لوط كانتا تحت عبدين من عبادنا صالحين فخانتاهما فلم يغنيا عنهما من الله شيئا وقيل ادخلا النار مع الداخلين

Surah 66 At-Tahrim, Ayah 11: And Allah sets forth an example for the believers: the wife of Pharaoh, who prayed, “My Lord! Build me a house in Paradise near You, deliver me from Pharaoh and his ˹evil˺ doing, and save me from the wrongdoing people.” | وضرب الله مثلا للذين امنوا امرات فرعون اذ قالت رب ابن لي عندك بيتا في الجنة ونجني من فرعون وعمله ونجني من القوم الظالمين

Surah 66 At-Tahrim, Ayah 12: ˹There is˺ also ˹the example of˺ Mary, the daughter of ’Imrân, who guarded her chastity, so We breathed into her ˹womb˺ through Our angel ˹Gabriel˺. She testified to the words of her Lord and His Scriptures, and was one of the ˹sincerely˺ devout. | ومريم ابنت عمران التي احصنت فرجها فنفخنا فيه من روحنا وصدقت بكلمات ربها وكتبه وكانت من القانتين
Surah 67 Al-Mulk, Ayah 1: Blessed is the One in Whose Hands rests all authority. And He is Most Capable of everything. | تبارك الذي بيده الملك وهو على كل شيء قدير

Surah 67 Al-Mulk, Ayah 2: ˹He is the One˺ Who created death and life in order to test which of you is best in deeds. And He is the Almighty, All-Forgiving. | الذي خلق الموت والحياة ليبلوكم ايكم احسن عملا وهو العزيز الغفور

Surah 67 Al-Mulk, Ayah 3: ˹He is the One˺ Who created seven heavens, one above the other. You will never see any imperfection in the creation of the Most Compassionate. So look again: do you see any flaws? | الذي خلق سبع سماوات طباقا ما ترى في خلق الرحمن من تفاوت فارجع البصر هل ترى من فطور
Surah 67 Al-Mulk, Ayah 4: Then look again and again—your sight will return frustrated and weary. | ثم ارجع البصر كرتين ينقلب اليك البصر خاسئا وهو حسير

Surah 67 Al-Mulk, Ayah 5: And indeed, We adorned the lowest heaven with ˹stars like˺ lamps, and made them ˹as missiles˺ for stoning ˹eavesdropping˺ devils, for whom We have also prepared the torment of the Blaze. | ولقد زينا السماء الدنيا بمصابيح وجعلناها رجوما للشياطين واعتدنا لهم عذاب السعير
Surah 67 Al-Mulk, Ayah 6: Those who disbelieve in their Lord will suffer the punishment of Hell. What an evil destination! | وللذين كفروا بربهم عذاب جهنم وبئس المصير
Surah 67 Al-Mulk, Ayah 7: When they are tossed into it, they will hear its roaring as it boils over | اذا القوا فيها سمعوا لها شهيقا وهي تفور

Surah 67 Al-Mulk, Ayah 8: almost bursting in fury. Every time a group is cast into it, its keepers will ask them, “Did a warner not come to you?” | تكاد تميز من الغيظ كلما القي فيها فوج سالهم خزنتها الم ياتكم نذير

Surah 67 Al-Mulk, Ayah 9: They will reply, “Yes, a warner did come to us, but we denied and said, ‘Allah has revealed nothing. You are extremely astray.’” | قالوا بلى قد جاءنا نذير فكذبنا وقلنا ما نزل الله من شيء ان انتم الا في ضلال كبير
Surah 67 Al-Mulk, Ayah 10: And they will lament, “If only we had listened and reasoned, we would not be among the residents of the Blaze!” | وقالوا لو كنا نسمع او نعقل ما كنا في اصحاب السعير
Surah 67 Al-Mulk, Ayah 11: And so they will confess their sins. So away with the residents of the Blaze! | فاعترفوا بذنبهم فسحقا لاصحاب السعير
Surah 67 Al-Mulk, Ayah 12: Indeed, those in awe of their Lord without seeing Him will have forgiveness and a mighty reward. | ان الذين يخشون ربهم بالغيب لهم مغفرة واجر كبير
Surah 67 Al-Mulk, Ayah 13: Whether you speak secretly or openly—He surely knows best what is ˹hidden˺ in the heart. | واسروا قولكم او اجهروا به انه عليم بذات الصدور
Surah 67 Al-Mulk, Ayah 14: How could He not know His Own creation? For He ˹alone˺ is the Most Subtle, All-Aware. | الا يعلم من خلق وهو اللطيف الخبير

Surah 67 Al-Mulk, Ayah 15: He is the One Who smoothed out the earth for you, so move about in its regions and eat from His provisions. And to Him is the resurrection ˹of all˺. | هو الذي جعل لكم الارض ذلولا فامشوا في مناكبها وكلوا من رزقه واليه النشور
Surah 67 Al-Mulk, Ayah 16: Do you feel secure that the One Who is in heaven will not cause the earth to swallow you up as it quakes violently? | اامنتم من في السماء ان يخسف بكم الارض فاذا هي تمور

Surah 67 Al-Mulk, Ayah 17: Or do you feel secure that the One Who is in heaven will not unleash upon you a storm of stones. Only then would you know how ˹serious˺ My warning was! | ام امنتم من في السماء ان يرسل عليكم حاصبا فستعلمون كيف نذير
Surah 67 Al-Mulk, Ayah 18: And certainly those before them denied ˹as well˺, then how severe was My response! | ولقد كذب الذين من قبلهم فكيف كان نكير

Surah 67 Al-Mulk, Ayah 19: Have they not seen the birds above them, spreading and folding their wings? None holds them up except the Most Compassionate. Indeed, He is All-Seeing of everything. | اولم يروا الى الطير فوقهم صافات ويقبضن ما يمسكهن الا الرحمن انه بكل شيء بصير

Surah 67 Al-Mulk, Ayah 20: Also, which ˹powerless˺ force will come to your help instead of the Most Compassionate? Indeed, the disbelievers are only ˹lost˺ in delusion. | امن هذا الذي هو جند لكم ينصركم من دون الرحمن ان الكافرون الا في غرور

Surah 67 Al-Mulk, Ayah 21: Or who is it that will provide for you if He withholds His provision? In fact, they persist in arrogance and aversion ˹to the truth˺. | امن هذا الذي يرزقكم ان امسك رزقه بل لجوا في عتو ونفور
Surah 67 Al-Mulk, Ayah 22: Who is ˹rightly˺ guided: the one who crawls facedown or the one who walks upright on the Straight Path? | افمن يمشي مكبا على وجهه اهدى امن يمشي سويا على صراط مستقيم

Surah 67 Al-Mulk, Ayah 23: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “He is the One Who brought you into being and gave you hearing, sight, and intellect. ˹Yet˺ you hardly give any thanks.” | قل هو الذي انشاكم وجعل لكم السمع والابصار والافئدة قليلا ما تشكرون
Surah 67 Al-Mulk, Ayah 24: ˹Also˺ say, “He is the One Who has dispersed you ˹all˺ over the earth, and to Him you will ˹all˺ be gathered.” | قل هو الذي ذراكم في الارض واليه تحشرون
Surah 67 Al-Mulk, Ayah 25: ˹Still˺ they ask ˹the believers˺, “When will this threat come to pass, if what you say is true?” | ويقولون متى هذا الوعد ان كنتم صادقين
Surah 67 Al-Mulk, Ayah 26: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “That knowledge is with Allah alone, and I am only sent with a clear warning.” | قل انما العلم عند الله وانما انا نذير مبين

Surah 67 Al-Mulk, Ayah 27: Then when they see the torment drawing near, the faces of the disbelievers will become gloomy, and it will be said ˹to them˺, “This is what you claimed would never come.” | فلما راوه زلفة سيئت وجوه الذين كفروا وقيل هذا الذي كنتم به تدعون

Surah 67 Al-Mulk, Ayah 28: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Consider this: whether Allah causes me and those with me to die or shows us mercy, who will save the disbelievers from a painful punishment?” | قل ارايتم ان اهلكني الله ومن معي او رحمنا فمن يجير الكافرين من عذاب اليم

Surah 67 Al-Mulk, Ayah 29: Say, “He is the Most Compassionate—in Him ˹alone˺ we believe, and in Him ˹alone˺ we trust. You will soon know who is clearly astray.” | قل هو الرحمن امنا به وعليه توكلنا فستعلمون من هو في ضلال مبين
Surah 67 Al-Mulk, Ayah 30: Say, “Consider this: if your water were to sink ˹into the earth˺, then who ˹else˺ could bring you flowing water?” | قل ارايتم ان اصبح ماؤكم غورا فمن ياتيكم بماء معين
Surah 68 Al-Qalam, Ayah 1: Nũn. By the pen and what everyone writes! | ن والقلم وما يسطرون
Surah 68 Al-Qalam, Ayah 2: By the grace of your Lord, you ˹O Prophet˺ are not insane. | ما انت بنعمة ربك بمجنون
Surah 68 Al-Qalam, Ayah 3: You will certainly have a never-ending reward. | وان لك لاجرا غير ممنون
Surah 68 Al-Qalam, Ayah 4: And you are truly ˹a man˺ of outstanding character. | وانك لعلى خلق عظيم
Surah 68 Al-Qalam, Ayah 5: Soon you and the pagans will see | فستبصر ويبصرون
Surah 68 Al-Qalam, Ayah 6: which of you is mad. | باييكم المفتون
Surah 68 Al-Qalam, Ayah 7: Surely your Lord ˹alone˺ knows best who has strayed from His Way and who is ˹rightly˺ guided. | ان ربك هو اعلم بمن ضل عن سبيله وهو اعلم بالمهتدين
Surah 68 Al-Qalam, Ayah 8: So do not give in to the deniers. | فلا تطع المكذبين
Surah 68 Al-Qalam, Ayah 9: They wish you would compromise so they would yield ˹to you˺. | ودوا لو تدهن فيدهنون
Surah 68 Al-Qalam, Ayah 10: And do not obey the despicable, vain oath-taker | ولا تطع كل حلاف مهين
Surah 68 Al-Qalam, Ayah 11: slanderer, gossip-monger | هماز مشاء بنميم
Surah 68 Al-Qalam, Ayah 12: withholder of good, transgressor, evildoer | مناع للخير معتد اثيم
Surah 68 Al-Qalam, Ayah 13: brute, and—on top of all that—an illegitimate child. | عتل بعد ذلك زنيم
Surah 68 Al-Qalam, Ayah 14: Now, ˹simply˺ because he has been blessed with ˹abundant˺ wealth and children | ان كان ذا مال وبنين
Surah 68 Al-Qalam, Ayah 15: whenever Our revelations are recited to him, he says, “Ancient fables!” | اذا تتلى عليه اياتنا قال اساطير الاولين
Surah 68 Al-Qalam, Ayah 16: We will soon mark his snout. | سنسمه على الخرطوم

Surah 68 Al-Qalam, Ayah 17: Indeed, We have tested those ˹Meccans˺ as We tested the owners of the garden—when they swore they would surely harvest ˹all˺ its fruit in the early morning | انا بلوناهم كما بلونا اصحاب الجنة اذ اقسموا ليصرمنها مصبحين
Surah 68 Al-Qalam, Ayah 18: leaving no thought for Allah’s Will. | ولا يستثنون
Surah 68 Al-Qalam, Ayah 19: Then it was struck by a torment from your Lord while they slept | فطاف عليها طائف من ربك وهم نائمون
Surah 68 Al-Qalam, Ayah 20: so it was reduced to ashes. | فاصبحت كالصريم
Surah 68 Al-Qalam, Ayah 21: Then by daybreak they called out to each other | فتنادوا مصبحين
Surah 68 Al-Qalam, Ayah 22: ˹saying,˺ “Go early to your harvest, if you want to pick ˹all˺ the fruit.” | ان اغدوا على حرثكم ان كنتم صارمين
Surah 68 Al-Qalam, Ayah 23: So they went off, whispering to one another | فانطلقوا وهم يتخافتون
Surah 68 Al-Qalam, Ayah 24: “Do not let any poor person enter your garden today.” | ان لا يدخلنها اليوم عليكم مسكين
Surah 68 Al-Qalam, Ayah 25: And they proceeded early, totally fixated on their purpose. | وغدوا على حرد قادرين
Surah 68 Al-Qalam, Ayah 26: But when they saw it ˹devastated˺, they cried, “We must have lost ˹our˺ way! | فلما راوها قالوا انا لضالون
Surah 68 Al-Qalam, Ayah 27: In fact, we have been deprived ˹of our livelihood˺.” | بل نحن محرومون
Surah 68 Al-Qalam, Ayah 28: The most sensible of them said, “Did I not urge you to say, ‘Allah willing.’?” | قال اوسطهم الم اقل لكم لولا تسبحون
Surah 68 Al-Qalam, Ayah 29: They replied, “Glory be to our Lord! We have truly been wrongdoers.” | قالوا سبحان ربنا انا كنا ظالمين
Surah 68 Al-Qalam, Ayah 30: Then they turned on each other, throwing blame. | فاقبل بعضهم على بعض يتلاومون
Surah 68 Al-Qalam, Ayah 31: They said, “Woe to us! We have certainly been transgressors. | قالوا يا ويلنا انا كنا طاغين
Surah 68 Al-Qalam, Ayah 32: We trust our Lord will give us a better garden than this, ˹for˺ we are indeed turning to our Lord with hope.” | عسى ربنا ان يبدلنا خيرا منها انا الى ربنا راغبون

Surah 68 Al-Qalam, Ayah 33: That is the ˹way of Our˺ punishment ˹in this world˺. But the punishment of the Hereafter is certainly far worse, if only they knew. | كذلك العذاب ولعذاب الاخرة اكبر لو كانوا يعلمون
Surah 68 Al-Qalam, Ayah 34: Indeed, the righteous will have the Gardens of Bliss with their Lord. | ان للمتقين عند ربهم جنات النعيم
Surah 68 Al-Qalam, Ayah 35: Should We then treat those who have submitted like the wicked? | افنجعل المسلمين كالمجرمين
Surah 68 Al-Qalam, Ayah 36: What is the matter with you? How do you judge? | ما لكم كيف تحكمون
Surah 68 Al-Qalam, Ayah 37: Or do you have a scripture, in which you read | ام لكم كتاب فيه تدرسون
Surah 68 Al-Qalam, Ayah 38: that you will have whatever you choose? | ان لكم فيه لما تخيرون
Surah 68 Al-Qalam, Ayah 39: Or do you have oaths binding on Us until the Day of Judgment that you will have whatever you decide? | ام لكم ايمان علينا بالغة الى يوم القيامة ان لكم لما تحكمون
Surah 68 Al-Qalam, Ayah 40: Ask them ˹O Prophet˺ which of them can guarantee all that. | سلهم ايهم بذلك زعيم

Surah 68 Al-Qalam, Ayah 41: Or do they have associate-gods ˹supporting this claim˺? Then let them bring forth their associate-gods, if what they say is true. | ام لهم شركاء فلياتوا بشركائهم ان كانوا صادقين

Surah 68 Al-Qalam, Ayah 42: ˹Beware of˺ the Day the Shin ˹of Allah˺ will be bared, and the wicked will be asked to prostrate, but they will not be able to do so | يوم يكشف عن ساق ويدعون الى السجود فلا يستطيعون

Surah 68 Al-Qalam, Ayah 43: with eyes downcast, totally covered with disgrace. For they were ˹always˺ called to prostrate ˹in the world˺ when they were fully capable ˹but they chose not to˺. | خاشعة ابصارهم ترهقهم ذلة وقد كانوا يدعون الى السجود وهم سالمون

Surah 68 Al-Qalam, Ayah 44: So leave to Me ˹O Prophet˺ those who reject this message. We will gradually draw them to destruction in ways they cannot comprehend. | فذرني ومن يكذب بهذا الحديث سنستدرجهم من حيث لا يعلمون
Surah 68 Al-Qalam, Ayah 45: I ˹only˺ delay their end for a while, but My planning is flawless. | واملي لهم ان كيدي متين
Surah 68 Al-Qalam, Ayah 46: Or are you asking them for a reward ˹for the message˺ so that they are overburdened by debt? | ام تسالهم اجرا فهم من مغرم مثقلون
Surah 68 Al-Qalam, Ayah 47: Or do they have access to ˹the Record in˺ the unseen, so they copy it ˹for all to see˺? | ام عندهم الغيب فهم يكتبون

Surah 68 Al-Qalam, Ayah 48: So be patient with your Lord’s decree, and do not be like ˹Jonah,˺ the Man of the Whale, who cried out ˹to Allah˺, in total distress. | فاصبر لحكم ربك ولا تكن كصاحب الحوت اذ نادى وهو مكظوم
Surah 68 Al-Qalam, Ayah 49: Had he not been shown grace by his Lord, he would have certainly been cast onto the open ˹shore˺, still blameworthy. | لولا ان تداركه نعمة من ربه لنبذ بالعراء وهو مذموم
Surah 68 Al-Qalam, Ayah 50: Then his Lord chose him, making him one of the righteous. | فاجتباه ربه فجعله من الصالحين

Surah 68 Al-Qalam, Ayah 51: The disbelievers would almost cut you down with their eyes when they hear ˹you recite˺ the Reminder, and say, “He is certainly a madman.” | وان يكاد الذين كفروا ليزلقونك بابصارهم لما سمعوا الذكر ويقولون انه لمجنون
Surah 68 Al-Qalam, Ayah 52: But it is simply a reminder to the whole world. | وما هو الا ذكر للعالمين
Surah 69 Al-Haaqqa, Ayah 1: The Inevitable Hour! | الحاقة
Surah 69 Al-Haaqqa, Ayah 2: What is the Inevitable Hour? | ما الحاقة
Surah 69 Al-Haaqqa, Ayah 3: And what will make you realize what the Inevitable Hour is? | وما ادراك ما الحاقة
Surah 69 Al-Haaqqa, Ayah 4: ˹Both˺ Thamûd and ’Ȃd denied the Striking Disaster. | كذبت ثمود وعاد بالقارعة
Surah 69 Al-Haaqqa, Ayah 5: As for Thamûd, they were destroyed by an overwhelming blast. | فاما ثمود فاهلكوا بالطاغية
Surah 69 Al-Haaqqa, Ayah 6: And as for ’Ȃd, they were destroyed by a furious, bitter wind | واما عاد فاهلكوا بريح صرصر عاتية

Surah 69 Al-Haaqqa, Ayah 7: which Allah unleashed on them non-stop for seven nights and eight days, so that you would have seen its people lying dead like trunks of uprooted palm trees. | سخرها عليهم سبع ليال وثمانية ايام حسوما فترى القوم فيها صرعى كانهم اعجاز نخل خاوية
Surah 69 Al-Haaqqa, Ayah 8: Do you see any of them left alive? | فهل ترى لهم من باقية
Surah 69 Al-Haaqqa, Ayah 9: Also, Pharaoh and those before him, and ˹the people of˺ the overturned cities ˹of Lot˺ indulged in sin | وجاء فرعون ومن قبله والمؤتفكات بالخاطئة
Surah 69 Al-Haaqqa, Ayah 10: each disobeying their Lord’s messenger, so He seized them with a crushing grip. | فعصوا رسول ربهم فاخذهم اخذة رابية
Surah 69 Al-Haaqqa, Ayah 11: Indeed, when the floodwater had overflowed, We carried you in the floating Ark ˹with Noah˺ | انا لما طغى الماء حملناكم في الجارية
Surah 69 Al-Haaqqa, Ayah 12: so that We may make this a reminder to you, and that attentive ears may grasp it. | لنجعلها لكم تذكرة وتعيها اذن واعية
Surah 69 Al-Haaqqa, Ayah 13: At last, when the Trumpet will be blown with one blast | فاذا نفخ في الصور نفخة واحدة
Surah 69 Al-Haaqqa, Ayah 14: and the earth and mountains will be lifted up and crushed with one blow | وحملت الارض والجبال فدكتا دكة واحدة
Surah 69 Al-Haaqqa, Ayah 15: on that Day the Inevitable Event will have come to pass. | فيومئذ وقعت الواقعة
Surah 69 Al-Haaqqa, Ayah 16: The sky will then be so torn that it will be frail | وانشقت السماء فهي يومئذ واهية
Surah 69 Al-Haaqqa, Ayah 17: with the angels on its sides. On that Day eight ˹mighty angels˺ will bear the Throne of your Lord above them. | والملك على ارجائها ويحمل عرش ربك فوقهم يومئذ ثمانية
Surah 69 Al-Haaqqa, Ayah 18: You will then be presented ˹before Him for judgment˺, and none of your secrets will stay hidden. | يومئذ تعرضون لا تخفى منكم خافية
Surah 69 Al-Haaqqa, Ayah 19: As for those given their records in their right hand, they will cry ˹happily˺, “Here ˹everyone˺! Read my record! | فاما من اوتي كتابه بيمينه فيقول هاؤم اقرءوا كتابيه
Surah 69 Al-Haaqqa, Ayah 20: I surely knew I would face my reckoning.” | اني ظننت اني ملاق حسابيه
Surah 69 Al-Haaqqa, Ayah 21: They will be in a life of bliss | فهو في عيشة راضية
Surah 69 Al-Haaqqa, Ayah 22: in an elevated Garden | في جنة عالية
Surah 69 Al-Haaqqa, Ayah 23: whose fruit will hang within reach. | قطوفها دانية
Surah 69 Al-Haaqqa, Ayah 24: ˹They will be told,˺ “Eat and drink joyfully for what you did in the days gone by.” | كلوا واشربوا هنيئا بما اسلفتم في الايام الخالية

Surah 69 Al-Haaqqa, Ayah 25: And as for those given their record in their left hand, they will cry ˹bitterly˺, “I wish I had not been given my record | واما من اوتي كتابه بشماله فيقول يا ليتني لم اوت كتابيه
Surah 69 Al-Haaqqa, Ayah 26: nor known anything of my reckoning! | ولم ادر ما حسابيه
Surah 69 Al-Haaqqa, Ayah 27: I wish death was the end! | يا ليتها كانت القاضية
Surah 69 Al-Haaqqa, Ayah 28: My wealth has not benefited me! | ما اغنى عني ماليه
Surah 69 Al-Haaqqa, Ayah 29: My authority has been stripped from me.” | هلك عني سلطانيه
Surah 69 Al-Haaqqa, Ayah 30: ˹It will be said,˺ “Seize and shackle them | خذوه فغلوه
Surah 69 Al-Haaqqa, Ayah 31: then burn them in Hell | ثم الجحيم صلوه
Surah 69 Al-Haaqqa, Ayah 32: then tie them up with chains seventy arms long. | ثم في سلسلة ذرعها سبعون ذراعا فاسلكوه
Surah 69 Al-Haaqqa, Ayah 33: For they never had faith in Allah, the Greatest | انه كان لا يؤمن بالله العظيم
Surah 69 Al-Haaqqa, Ayah 34: nor encouraged the feeding of the poor. | ولا يحض على طعام المسكين
Surah 69 Al-Haaqqa, Ayah 35: So this Day they will have no close friend here | فليس له اليوم هاهنا حميم
Surah 69 Al-Haaqqa, Ayah 36: nor any food except ˹oozing˺ pus | ولا طعام الا من غسلين
Surah 69 Al-Haaqqa, Ayah 37: which none will eat except the evildoers.” | لا ياكله الا الخاطئون
Surah 69 Al-Haaqqa, Ayah 38: Now, I do swear by whatever you see | فلا اقسم بما تبصرون
Surah 69 Al-Haaqqa, Ayah 39: and whatever you cannot see! | وما لا تبصرون
Surah 69 Al-Haaqqa, Ayah 40: Indeed, this ˹Quran˺ is the recitation of a noble Messenger. | انه لقول رسول كريم
Surah 69 Al-Haaqqa, Ayah 41: It is not the prose of a poet ˹as you claim˺, ˹yet˺ you hardly have any faith. | وما هو بقول شاعر قليلا ما تؤمنون
Surah 69 Al-Haaqqa, Ayah 42: Nor is it the mumbling of a fortune-teller, ˹yet˺ you are hardly mindful. | ولا بقول كاهن قليلا ما تذكرون
Surah 69 Al-Haaqqa, Ayah 43: ˹It is˺ a revelation from the Lord of all worlds. | تنزيل من رب العالمين
Surah 69 Al-Haaqqa, Ayah 44: Had the Messenger made up something in Our Name | ولو تقول علينا بعض الاقاويل
Surah 69 Al-Haaqqa, Ayah 45: We would have certainly seized him by his right hand | لاخذنا منه باليمين
Surah 69 Al-Haaqqa, Ayah 46: then severed his aorta | ثم لقطعنا منه الوتين
Surah 69 Al-Haaqqa, Ayah 47: and none of you could have shielded him ˹from Us˺! | فما منكم من احد عنه حاجزين
Surah 69 Al-Haaqqa, Ayah 48: Indeed, this ˹Quran˺ is a reminder to those mindful ˹of Allah˺. | وانه لتذكرة للمتقين
Surah 69 Al-Haaqqa, Ayah 49: And We certainly know that some of you will persist in denial | وانا لنعلم ان منكم مكذبين
Surah 69 Al-Haaqqa, Ayah 50: and it will surely be a source of regret for the disbelievers. | وانه لحسرة على الكافرين
Surah 69 Al-Haaqqa, Ayah 51: And indeed, this ˹Quran˺ is the absolute truth. | وانه لحق اليقين
Surah 69 Al-Haaqqa, Ayah 52: So glorify the Name of your Lord, the Greatest. | فسبح باسم ربك العظيم
Surah 70 Al-Ma'aarij, Ayah 1: A challenger has demanded a punishment bound to come | سال سائل بعذاب واقع
Surah 70 Al-Ma'aarij, Ayah 2: for the disbelievers—to be averted by none— | للكافرين ليس له دافع
Surah 70 Al-Ma'aarij, Ayah 3: from Allah, Lord of pathways of ˹heavenly˺ ascent | من الله ذي المعارج
Surah 70 Al-Ma'aarij, Ayah 4: ˹through which˺ the angels and the ˹holy˺ spirit will ascend to Him on a Day fifty thousand years in length. | تعرج الملائكة والروح اليه في يوم كان مقداره خمسين الف سنة
Surah 70 Al-Ma'aarij, Ayah 5: So endure ˹this denial, O  Prophet,˺ with beautiful patience. | فاصبر صبرا جميلا
Surah 70 Al-Ma'aarij, Ayah 6: They truly see this ˹Day˺ as impossible | انهم يرونه بعيدا
Surah 70 Al-Ma'aarij, Ayah 7: but We see it as inevitable. | ونراه قريبا
Surah 70 Al-Ma'aarij, Ayah 8: On that Day the sky will be like molten brass | يوم تكون السماء كالمهل
Surah 70 Al-Ma'aarij, Ayah 9: and the mountains like ˹tufts of˺ wool. | وتكون الجبال كالعهن
Surah 70 Al-Ma'aarij, Ayah 10: And no close friend will ask ˹about˺ their friends | ولا يسال حميم حميما

Surah 70 Al-Ma'aarij, Ayah 11: ˹although˺ they will be made to see each other. The wicked will wish to ransom themselves from the punishment of that Day by their children | يبصرونهم يود المجرم لو يفتدي من عذاب يومئذ ببنيه
Surah 70 Al-Ma'aarij, Ayah 12: their spouses, their siblings | وصاحبته واخيه
Surah 70 Al-Ma'aarij, Ayah 13: their clan that sheltered them | وفصيلته التي تؤويه
Surah 70 Al-Ma'aarij, Ayah 14: and everyone on earth altogether, just to save themselves. | ومن في الارض جميعا ثم ينجيه
Surah 70 Al-Ma'aarij, Ayah 15: But no! There will certainly be a raging Flame | كلا انها لظى
Surah 70 Al-Ma'aarij, Ayah 16: ripping off scalps. | نزاعة للشوى
Surah 70 Al-Ma'aarij, Ayah 17: It will summon whoever turned their backs ˹on Allah˺ and turned away ˹from the truth˺ | تدعو من ادبر وتولى
Surah 70 Al-Ma'aarij, Ayah 18: and gathered and hoarded ˹wealth˺. | وجمع فاوعى
Surah 70 Al-Ma'aarij, Ayah 19: Indeed, humankind was created impatient: | ان الانسان خلق هلوعا
Surah 70 Al-Ma'aarij, Ayah 20: distressed when touched with evil | اذا مسه الشر جزوعا
Surah 70 Al-Ma'aarij, Ayah 21: and withholding when touched with good— | واذا مسه الخير منوعا
Surah 70 Al-Ma'aarij, Ayah 22: except those who pray | الا المصلين
Surah 70 Al-Ma'aarij, Ayah 23: consistently performing their prayers; | الذين هم على صلاتهم دائمون
Surah 70 Al-Ma'aarij, Ayah 24: and who give the rightful share of their wealth | والذين في اموالهم حق معلوم
Surah 70 Al-Ma'aarij, Ayah 25: to the beggar and the poor; | للسائل والمحروم
Surah 70 Al-Ma'aarij, Ayah 26: and who ˹firmly˺ believe in the Day of Judgment; | والذين يصدقون بيوم الدين
Surah 70 Al-Ma'aarij, Ayah 27: and those who fear the punishment of their Lord— | والذين هم من عذاب ربهم مشفقون
Surah 70 Al-Ma'aarij, Ayah 28: ˹knowing that˺ none should feel secure from their Lord’s punishment— | ان عذاب ربهم غير مامون
Surah 70 Al-Ma'aarij, Ayah 29: and those who guard their chastity | والذين هم لفروجهم حافظون
Surah 70 Al-Ma'aarij, Ayah 30: except with their wives or those ˹bondwomen˺ in their possession, for then they are free from blame | الا على ازواجهم او ما ملكت ايمانهم فانهم غير ملومين
Surah 70 Al-Ma'aarij, Ayah 31: but whoever seeks beyond that are the transgressors. | فمن ابتغى وراء ذلك فاولئك هم العادون
Surah 70 Al-Ma'aarij, Ayah 32: ˹The faithful are˺ also those who are true to their trusts and covenants; | والذين هم لاماناتهم وعهدهم راعون
Surah 70 Al-Ma'aarij, Ayah 33: and who are honest in their testimony; | والذين هم بشهاداتهم قائمون
Surah 70 Al-Ma'aarij, Ayah 34: and who are ˹properly˺ observant of their prayers. | والذين هم على صلاتهم يحافظون
Surah 70 Al-Ma'aarij, Ayah 35: These will be in Gardens, held in honour. | اولئك في جنات مكرمون
Surah 70 Al-Ma'aarij, Ayah 36: So what is the matter with the disbelievers that they rush ˹head-long˺ towards you ˹O Prophet˺ | فمال الذين كفروا قبلك مهطعين
Surah 70 Al-Ma'aarij, Ayah 37: from the right and the left, in groups ˹to mock you˺? | عن اليمين وعن الشمال عزين
Surah 70 Al-Ma'aarij, Ayah 38: Does every one of them expect to be admitted into a Garden of Bliss? | ايطمع كل امرئ منهم ان يدخل جنة نعيم
Surah 70 Al-Ma'aarij, Ayah 39: But no! Indeed, they ˹already˺ know what We created them from. | كلا انا خلقناهم مما يعلمون
Surah 70 Al-Ma'aarij, Ayah 40: So, I do swear by the Lord of ˹all˺ the points of sunrise and sunset that We are truly capable | فلا اقسم برب المشارق والمغارب انا لقادرون
Surah 70 Al-Ma'aarij, Ayah 41: of replacing them with ˹others˺ better than them, and We cannot be prevented ˹from doing so˺. | على ان نبدل خيرا منهم وما نحن بمسبوقين

Surah 70 Al-Ma'aarij, Ayah 42: So let them indulge ˹in falsehood˺ and amuse ˹themselves˺ until they face their Day, which they have been threatened with— | فذرهم يخوضوا ويلعبوا حتى يلاقوا يومهم الذي يوعدون
Surah 70 Al-Ma'aarij, Ayah 43: the Day they will come forth from the graves swiftly, as if racing to an idol ˹for a blessing˺ | يوم يخرجون من الاجداث سراعا كانهم الى نصب يوفضون
Surah 70 Al-Ma'aarij, Ayah 44: with eyes downcast, utterly covered with disgrace. That is the Day they have ˹always˺ been warned of. | خاشعة ابصارهم ترهقهم ذلة ذلك اليوم الذي كانوا يوعدون

Surah 71 Nooh, Ayah 1: Indeed, We sent Noah to his people ˹saying to him˺, “Warn your people before a painful punishment comes to them.” | انا ارسلنا نوحا الى قومه ان انذر قومك من قبل ان ياتيهم عذاب اليم
Surah 71 Nooh, Ayah 2: Noah proclaimed, “O my people! I am truly sent to you with a clear warning: | قال يا قوم اني لكم نذير مبين
Surah 71 Nooh, Ayah 3: worship Allah ˹alone˺, fear Him, and obey me. | ان اعبدوا الله واتقوه واطيعون

Surah 71 Nooh, Ayah 4: He will forgive your sins, and delay your end until the appointed time. Indeed, when the time set by Allah comes, it cannot be delayed, if only you knew!” | يغفر لكم من ذنوبكم ويؤخركم الى اجل مسمى ان اجل الله اذا جاء لا يؤخر لو كنتم تعلمون
Surah 71 Nooh, Ayah 5: He cried, “My Lord! I have surely called my people day and night | قال رب اني دعوت قومي ليلا ونهارا
Surah 71 Nooh, Ayah 6: but my calls only made them run farther away. | فلم يزدهم دعائي الا فرارا

Surah 71 Nooh, Ayah 7: And whenever I invite them to be forgiven by You, they press their fingers into their ears, cover themselves with their clothes, persist ˹in denial˺, and act very arrogantly. | واني كلما دعوتهم لتغفر لهم جعلوا اصابعهم في اذانهم واستغشوا ثيابهم واصروا واستكبروا استكبارا
Surah 71 Nooh, Ayah 8: Then I certainly called them openly | ثم اني دعوتهم جهارا
Surah 71 Nooh, Ayah 9: then I surely preached to them publicly and privately | ثم اني اعلنت لهم واسررت لهم اسرارا
Surah 71 Nooh, Ayah 10: saying, ‘Seek your Lord’s forgiveness, ˹for˺ He is truly Most Forgiving. | فقلت استغفروا ربكم انه كان غفارا
Surah 71 Nooh, Ayah 11: He will shower you with abundant rain | يرسل السماء عليكم مدرارا
Surah 71 Nooh, Ayah 12: supply you with wealth and children, and give you gardens as well as rivers. | ويمددكم باموال وبنين ويجعل لكم جنات ويجعل لكم انهارا
Surah 71 Nooh, Ayah 13: What is the matter with you that you are not in awe of the Majesty of Allah | ما لكم لا ترجون لله وقارا
Surah 71 Nooh, Ayah 14: when He truly created you in stages ˹of development˺? | وقد خلقكم اطوارا
Surah 71 Nooh, Ayah 15: Do you not see how Allah created seven heavens, one above the other | الم تروا كيف خلق الله سبع سماوات طباقا
Surah 71 Nooh, Ayah 16: placing the moon within them as a ˹reflected˺ light, and the sun as a ˹radiant˺ lamp? | وجعل القمر فيهن نورا وجعل الشمس سراجا
Surah 71 Nooh, Ayah 17: Allah ˹alone˺ caused you to grow from the earth like a plant. | والله انبتكم من الارض نباتا
Surah 71 Nooh, Ayah 18: Then He will return you to it, and then simply bring you forth ˹again˺. | ثم يعيدكم فيها ويخرجكم اخراجا
Surah 71 Nooh, Ayah 19: And Allah ˹alone˺ spread out the earth for you | والله جعل لكم الارض بساطا
Surah 71 Nooh, Ayah 20: to walk along its spacious pathways.’” | لتسلكوا منها سبلا فجاجا

Surah 71 Nooh, Ayah 21: ˹Eventually,˺ Noah cried, “My Lord! They have certainly persisted in disobeying me, and followed ˹instead˺ those ˹elite˺ whose ˹abundant˺ wealth and children only increase them in loss | قال نوح رب انهم عصوني واتبعوا من لم يزده ماله وولده الا خسارا
Surah 71 Nooh, Ayah 22: and who have devised a tremendous plot | ومكروا مكرا كبارا
Surah 71 Nooh, Ayah 23: urging ˹their followers˺, ‘Do not abandon your idols—especially Wadd, Suwâ’, Yaghûth, Ya’ûq, and Nasr.’ | وقالوا لا تذرن الهتكم ولا تذرن ودا ولا سواعا ولا يغوث ويعوق ونسرا
Surah 71 Nooh, Ayah 24: Those ˹elite˺ have already led many astray. So ˹O Lord˺, only allow the wrongdoers to stray farther away.” | وقد اضلوا كثيرا ولا تزد الظالمين الا ضلالا

Surah 71 Nooh, Ayah 25: So because of their sins, they were drowned, then admitted into the Fire. And they found none to help them against Allah. | مما خطيئاتهم اغرقوا فادخلوا نارا فلم يجدوا لهم من دون الله انصارا
Surah 71 Nooh, Ayah 26: Noah had prayed, “My Lord! Do not leave a single disbeliever on earth. | وقال نوح رب لا تذر على الارض من الكافرين ديارا

Surah 71 Nooh, Ayah 27: For if You spare ˹any of˺ them, they will certainly mislead Your servants, and give birth only to ˹wicked˺ sinners, staunch disbelievers. | انك ان تذرهم يضلوا عبادك ولا يلدوا الا فاجرا كفارا

Surah 71 Nooh, Ayah 28: My Lord! Forgive me, my parents, and whoever enters my house in faith, and ˹all˺ believing men and women. And increase the wrongdoers only in destruction.” | رب اغفر لي ولوالدي ولمن دخل بيتي مؤمنا وللمؤمنين والمؤمنات ولا تزد الظالمين الا تبارا

Surah 72 Al-Jinn, Ayah 1: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “It has been revealed to me that a group of jinn listened ˹to the Quran,˺ and said ˹to their fellow jinn˺: ‘Indeed, we have heard a wondrous recitation. | قل اوحي الي انه استمع نفر من الجن فقالوا انا سمعنا قرانا عجبا
Surah 72 Al-Jinn, Ayah 2: It leads to Right Guidance so we believed in it, and we will never associate anyone with our Lord ˹in worship˺. | يهدي الى الرشد فامنا به ولن نشرك بربنا احدا
Surah 72 Al-Jinn, Ayah 3: ˹Now, we believe that˺ our Lord—Exalted is His Majesty—has neither taken a mate nor offspring | وانه تعالى جد ربنا ما اتخذ صاحبة ولا ولدا
Surah 72 Al-Jinn, Ayah 4: and that the foolish of us used to utter ˹outrageous˺ falsehoods about Allah. | وانه كان يقول سفيهنا على الله شططا
Surah 72 Al-Jinn, Ayah 5: We certainly thought that humans and jinn would never speak lies about Allah. | وانا ظننا ان لن تقول الانس والجن على الله كذبا
Surah 72 Al-Jinn, Ayah 6: And some men used to seek refuge with some jinn—so they increased each other in wickedness. | وانه كان رجال من الانس يعوذون برجال من الجن فزادوهم رهقا
Surah 72 Al-Jinn, Ayah 7: And those ˹humans˺ thought, just like you ˹jinn˺, that Allah would not resurrect anyone ˹for judgment˺. | وانهم ظنوا كما ظننتم ان لن يبعث الله احدا
Surah 72 Al-Jinn, Ayah 8: ˹Earlier˺ we tried to reach heaven ˹for news˺, only to find it filled with stern guards and shooting stars. | وانا لمسنا السماء فوجدناها ملئت حرسا شديدا وشهبا

Surah 72 Al-Jinn, Ayah 9: We used to take up positions there for eavesdropping, but whoever dares eavesdrop now will find a flare lying in wait for them. | وانا كنا نقعد منها مقاعد للسمع فمن يستمع الان يجد له شهابا رصدا
Surah 72 Al-Jinn, Ayah 10: Now, we have no clue whether evil is intended for those on earth, or their Lord intends for them what is right. | وانا لا ندري اشر اريد بمن في الارض ام اراد بهم ربهم رشدا
Surah 72 Al-Jinn, Ayah 11: Among us are those who are righteous and those who are less so. We have been of different factions. | وانا منا الصالحون ومنا دون ذلك كنا طرائق قددا
Surah 72 Al-Jinn, Ayah 12: ˹Now,˺ we truly know that we cannot frustrate Allah on earth, nor can we escape from Him ˹into heaven˺. | وانا ظننا ان لن نعجز الله في الارض ولن نعجزه هربا

Surah 72 Al-Jinn, Ayah 13: When we heard the guidance ˹of the Quran˺, we ˹readily˺ believed in it. For whoever believes in their Lord will have no fear of being denied ˹a reward˺ or wronged. | وانا لما سمعنا الهدى امنا به فمن يؤمن بربه فلا يخاف بخسا ولا رهقا

Surah 72 Al-Jinn, Ayah 14: And among us are those who have submitted ˹to Allah˺ and those who are deviant. So ˹as for˺ those who submitted, it is they who have attained Right Guidance. | وانا منا المسلمون ومنا القاسطون فمن اسلم فاولئك تحروا رشدا
Surah 72 Al-Jinn, Ayah 15: And as for the deviant, they will be fuel for Hell.’” | واما القاسطون فكانوا لجهنم حطبا
Surah 72 Al-Jinn, Ayah 16: Had the deniers followed the Right Way, We would have certainly granted them abundant rain to drink— | وان لو استقاموا على الطريقة لاسقيناهم ماء غدقا

Surah 72 Al-Jinn, Ayah 17: as a test for them. And whoever turns away from the remembrance of their Lord will be admitted by Him into an overwhelming punishment. | لنفتنهم فيه ومن يعرض عن ذكر ربه يسلكه عذابا صعدا
Surah 72 Al-Jinn, Ayah 18: The places of worship are ˹only˺ for Allah, so do not invoke anyone besides Him. | وان المساجد لله فلا تدعوا مع الله احدا
Surah 72 Al-Jinn, Ayah 19: Yet when the servant of Allah stood up calling upon Him ˹alone˺, the pagans almost swarmed over him. | وانه لما قام عبد الله يدعوه كادوا يكونون عليه لبدا
Surah 72 Al-Jinn, Ayah 20: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “I call only upon my Lord, associating none with Him ˹in worship˺.” | قل انما ادعو ربي ولا اشرك به احدا
Surah 72 Al-Jinn, Ayah 21: Say, “It is not in my power to harm or benefit you.” | قل اني لا املك لكم ضرا ولا رشدا
Surah 72 Al-Jinn, Ayah 22: Say, “No one can protect me from Allah ˹if I were to disobey Him˺, nor can I find any refuge other than Him. | قل اني لن يجيرني من الله احد ولن اجد من دونه ملتحدا

Surah 72 Al-Jinn, Ayah 23: ˹My duty is˺ only to convey ˹the truth˺ from Allah and ˹deliver˺ His messages.” And whoever disobeys Allah and His Messenger will certainly be in the Fire of Hell, to stay there for ever and ever. | الا بلاغا من الله ورسالاته ومن يعص الله ورسوله فان له نار جهنم خالدين فيها ابدا

Surah 72 Al-Jinn, Ayah 24: Only when they see what they have been threatened with will they know who is weaker in helpers and inferior in manpower. | حتى اذا راوا ما يوعدون فسيعلمون من اضعف ناصرا واقل عددا
Surah 72 Al-Jinn, Ayah 25: Say, “I do not know if what you are promised is near or my Lord has set a distant time for it. | قل ان ادري اقريب ما توعدون ام يجعل له ربي امدا
Surah 72 Al-Jinn, Ayah 26: ˹He is the˺ Knower of the unseen, disclosing none of it to anyone | عالم الغيب فلا يظهر على غيبه احدا
Surah 72 Al-Jinn, Ayah 27: except messengers of His choice. Then He appoints angel-guards before and behind them | الا من ارتضى من رسول فانه يسلك من بين يديه ومن خلفه رصدا

Surah 72 Al-Jinn, Ayah 28: to ensure that the messengers fully deliver the messages of their Lord—though He ˹already˺ knows all about them, and keeps account of everything.” | ليعلم ان قد ابلغوا رسالات ربهم واحاط بما لديهم واحصى كل شيء عددا
Surah 73 Al-Muzzammil, Ayah 1: O you wrapped ˹in your clothes˺! | يا ايها المزمل
Surah 73 Al-Muzzammil, Ayah 2: Stand all night ˹in prayer˺ except a little— | قم الليل الا قليلا
Surah 73 Al-Muzzammil, Ayah 3: ˹pray˺ half the night, or a little less | نصفه او انقص منه قليلا
Surah 73 Al-Muzzammil, Ayah 4: or a little more—and recite the Quran ˹properly˺ in a measured way. | او زد عليه ورتل القران ترتيلا
Surah 73 Al-Muzzammil, Ayah 5: ˹For˺ We will soon send upon you a weighty revelation. | انا سنلقي عليك قولا ثقيلا
Surah 73 Al-Muzzammil, Ayah 6: Indeed, worship in the night is more impactful and suitable for recitation. | ان ناشئة الليل هي اشد وطئا واقوم قيلا
Surah 73 Al-Muzzammil, Ayah 7: For during the day you are over-occupied ˹with worldly duties˺. | ان لك في النهار سبحا طويلا
Surah 73 Al-Muzzammil, Ayah 8: ˹Always˺ remember the Name of your Lord, and devote yourself to Him wholeheartedly. | واذكر اسم ربك وتبتل اليه تبتيلا

Surah 73 Al-Muzzammil, Ayah 9: ˹He is the˺ Lord of the east and the west. There is no god ˹worthy of worship˺ except Him, so take Him ˹alone˺ as a Trustee of Affairs. | رب المشرق والمغرب لا اله الا هو فاتخذه وكيلا
Surah 73 Al-Muzzammil, Ayah 10: Be patient ˹O Prophet˺ with what they say, and depart from them courteously. | واصبر على ما يقولون واهجرهم هجرا جميلا
Surah 73 Al-Muzzammil, Ayah 11: And leave to Me the deniers—the people of luxury—and bear with them for a little while. | وذرني والمكذبين اولي النعمة ومهلهم قليلا
Surah 73 Al-Muzzammil, Ayah 12: ˹For˺ We certainly have shackles, a ˹raging˺ Fire | ان لدينا انكالا وجحيما
Surah 73 Al-Muzzammil, Ayah 13: choking food, and a painful punishment ˹in store for them˺ | وطعاما ذا غصة وعذابا اليما
Surah 73 Al-Muzzammil, Ayah 14: on the Day the earth and mountains will shake ˹violently˺, and mountains will be ˹reduced to˺ dunes of shifting sand. | يوم ترجف الارض والجبال وكانت الجبال كثيبا مهيلا
Surah 73 Al-Muzzammil, Ayah 15: Indeed, We have sent to you a messenger as a witness over you, just as We sent a messenger to Pharaoh. | انا ارسلنا اليكم رسولا شاهدا عليكم كما ارسلنا الى فرعون رسولا
Surah 73 Al-Muzzammil, Ayah 16: But Pharaoh disobeyed the messenger, so We seized him with a stern grip. | فعصى فرعون الرسول فاخذناه اخذا وبيلا

Surah 73 Al-Muzzammil, Ayah 17: If you ˹pagans˺ persist in disbelief, then how will you guard yourselves against ˹the horrors of˺ a Day which will turn children’s hair grey? | فكيف تتقون ان كفرتم يوما يجعل الولدان شيبا
Surah 73 Al-Muzzammil, Ayah 18: It will ˹even˺ cause the sky to split apart. His promise ˹of judgment˺ must be fulfilled. | السماء منفطر به كان وعده مفعولا
Surah 73 Al-Muzzammil, Ayah 19: Surely this is a reminder. So let whoever wills take the ˹Right˺ Way to their Lord. | ان هذه تذكرة فمن شاء اتخذ الى ربه سبيلا

Surah 73 Al-Muzzammil, Ayah 20: Surely your Lord knows that you ˹O Prophet˺ stand ˹in prayer˺ for nearly two-thirds of the night, or ˹sometimes˺ half of it, or a third, as do some of those with you. Allah ˹alone˺ keeps a ˹precise˺ measure of the day and night. He knows that you ˹believers˺ are unable to endure this, and has turned to you in mercy. So recite ˹in prayer˺ whatever you can from the Quran. He knows that some of you will be sick, some will be travelling throughout the land seeking Allah’s bounty, and some fighting in the cause of Allah. So recite whatever you can from it. And ˹continue to˺ perform ˹regular˺ prayers, pay alms-tax, and lend to Allah a good loan. Whatever good you send forth for yourselves, you will find it with Allah far better and more rewarding. And seek Allah’s forgiveness. Surely Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful. | ان ربك يعلم انك تقوم ادنى من ثلثي الليل ونصفه وثلثه وطائفة من الذين معك والله يقدر الليل والنهار علم ان لن تحصوه فتاب عليكم فاقرءوا ما تيسر من القران علم ان سيكون منكم مرضى واخرون يضربون في الارض يبتغون من فضل الله واخرون يقاتلون في سبيل الله فاقرءوا ما تيسر منه واقيموا الصلاة واتوا الزكاة واقرضوا الله قرضا حسنا وما تقدموا لانفسكم من خير تجدوه عند الله هو خيرا واعظم اجرا واستغفروا الله ان الله غفور رحيم
Surah 74 Al-Muddaththir, Ayah 1: O you covered up ˹in your clothes˺! | يا ايها المدثر
Surah 74 Al-Muddaththir, Ayah 2: Arise and warn ˹all˺. | قم فانذر
Surah 74 Al-Muddaththir, Ayah 3: Revere your Lord ˹alone˺. | وربك فكبر
Surah 74 Al-Muddaththir, Ayah 4: Purify your garments. | وثيابك فطهر
Surah 74 Al-Muddaththir, Ayah 5: ˹Continue to˺ shun idols. | والرجز فاهجر
Surah 74 Al-Muddaththir, Ayah 6: Do not do a favour expecting more ˹in return˺. | ولا تمنن تستكثر
Surah 74 Al-Muddaththir, Ayah 7: And persevere for ˹the sake of˺ your Lord. | ولربك فاصبر
Surah 74 Al-Muddaththir, Ayah 8: ˹For˺ when the Trumpet will be sounded | فاذا نقر في الناقور
Surah 74 Al-Muddaththir, Ayah 9: that will ˹truly˺ be a difficult Day— | فذلك يومئذ يوم عسير
Surah 74 Al-Muddaththir, Ayah 10: far from easy for the disbelievers. | على الكافرين غير يسير
Surah 74 Al-Muddaththir, Ayah 11: And leave to me ˹O Prophet˺ the one I created all by Myself | ذرني ومن خلقت وحيدا
Surah 74 Al-Muddaththir, Ayah 12: and granted him abundant wealth | وجعلت له مالا ممدودا
Surah 74 Al-Muddaththir, Ayah 13: and children always by his side | وبنين شهودا
Surah 74 Al-Muddaththir, Ayah 14: and made life very easy for him. | ومهدت له تمهيدا
Surah 74 Al-Muddaththir, Ayah 15: Yet he is hungry for more. | ثم يطمع ان ازيد
Surah 74 Al-Muddaththir, Ayah 16: But no! ˹For˺ he has been truly stubborn with Our revelations. | كلا انه كان لاياتنا عنيدا
Surah 74 Al-Muddaththir, Ayah 17: I will make his fate unbearable | سارهقه صعودا
Surah 74 Al-Muddaththir, Ayah 18: for he contemplated and determined ˹a degrading label for the Quran˺. | انه فكر وقدر
Surah 74 Al-Muddaththir, Ayah 19: May he be condemned! How evil was what he determined! | فقتل كيف قدر
Surah 74 Al-Muddaththir, Ayah 20: May he be condemned even more! How evil was what he determined! | ثم قتل كيف قدر
Surah 74 Al-Muddaththir, Ayah 21: Then he re-contemplated ˹in frustration˺ | ثم نظر
Surah 74 Al-Muddaththir, Ayah 22: then frowned and scowled | ثم عبس وبسر
Surah 74 Al-Muddaththir, Ayah 23: then turned his back ˹on the truth˺ and acted arrogantly | ثم ادبر واستكبر
Surah 74 Al-Muddaththir, Ayah 24: saying, “This ˹Quran˺ is nothing but magic from the ancients. | فقال ان هذا الا سحر يؤثر
Surah 74 Al-Muddaththir, Ayah 25: This is no more than the word of a man.” | ان هذا الا قول البشر
Surah 74 Al-Muddaththir, Ayah 26: Soon I will burn him in Hell! | ساصليه سقر
Surah 74 Al-Muddaththir, Ayah 27: And what will make you realize what Hell is? | وما ادراك ما سقر
Surah 74 Al-Muddaththir, Ayah 28: It does not let anyone live or die | لا تبقي ولا تذر
Surah 74 Al-Muddaththir, Ayah 29: scorching the skin. | لواحة للبشر
Surah 74 Al-Muddaththir, Ayah 30: It is overseen by nineteen ˹keepers˺. | عليها تسعة عشر

Surah 74 Al-Muddaththir, Ayah 31: We have appointed only ˹stern˺ angels as wardens of the Fire. And We have made their number only as a test for the disbelievers, so that the People of the Book will be certain, and the believers will increase in faith, and neither the People of the Book nor the believers will have any doubts, and so that those ˹hypocrites˺ with sickness in their hearts and the disbelievers will argue, “What does Allah mean by such a number?” In this way Allah leaves whoever He wills to stray and guides whoever He wills. And none knows the forces of your Lord except He. And this ˹description of Hell˺ is only a reminder to humanity. | وما جعلنا اصحاب النار الا ملائكة وما جعلنا عدتهم الا فتنة للذين كفروا ليستيقن الذين اوتوا الكتاب ويزداد الذين امنوا ايمانا ولا يرتاب الذين اوتوا الكتاب والمؤمنون وليقول الذين في قلوبهم مرض والكافرون ماذا اراد الله بهذا مثلا كذلك يضل الله من يشاء ويهدي من يشاء وما يعلم جنود ربك الا هو وما هي الا ذكرى للبشر
Surah 74 Al-Muddaththir, Ayah 32: But no! By the moon | كلا والقمر
Surah 74 Al-Muddaththir, Ayah 33: and the night as it retreats | والليل اذ ادبر
Surah 74 Al-Muddaththir, Ayah 34: and the day as it breaks! | والصبح اذا اسفر
Surah 74 Al-Muddaththir, Ayah 35: Surely Hell is one of the mightiest catastrophes— | انها لاحدى الكبر
Surah 74 Al-Muddaththir, Ayah 36: a warning to humankind | نذيرا للبشر
Surah 74 Al-Muddaththir, Ayah 37: to whichever of you chooses to take the lead or lag behind. | لمن شاء منكم ان يتقدم او يتاخر
Surah 74 Al-Muddaththir, Ayah 38: Every soul will be detained for what it has done | كل نفس بما كسبت رهينة
Surah 74 Al-Muddaththir, Ayah 39: except the people of the right | الا اصحاب اليمين
Surah 74 Al-Muddaththir, Ayah 40: who will be in Gardens, asking one another | في جنات يتساءلون
Surah 74 Al-Muddaththir, Ayah 41: about the wicked ˹who will then be asked˺: | عن المجرمين
Surah 74 Al-Muddaththir, Ayah 42: “What has landed you in Hell?” | ما سلككم في سقر
Surah 74 Al-Muddaththir, Ayah 43: They will reply, “We were not of those who prayed | قالوا لم نك من المصلين
Surah 74 Al-Muddaththir, Ayah 44: nor did we feed the poor. | ولم نك نطعم المسكين
Surah 74 Al-Muddaththir, Ayah 45: We used to indulge ˹in falsehood˺ along with others | وكنا نخوض مع الخائضين
Surah 74 Al-Muddaththir, Ayah 46: and deny the Day of Judgment | وكنا نكذب بيوم الدين
Surah 74 Al-Muddaththir, Ayah 47: until the inevitable came to us.” | حتى اتانا اليقين
Surah 74 Al-Muddaththir, Ayah 48: So the pleas of intercessors will be of no benefit to them. | فما تنفعهم شفاعة الشافعين
Surah 74 Al-Muddaththir, Ayah 49: Now, what is the matter with them that they are turning away from the reminder | فما لهم عن التذكرة معرضين
Surah 74 Al-Muddaththir, Ayah 50: as if they were spooked zebras | كانهم حمر مستنفرة
Surah 74 Al-Muddaththir, Ayah 51: fleeing from a lion? | فرت من قسورة
Surah 74 Al-Muddaththir, Ayah 52: In fact, each one of them wishes to be given a ˹personal˺ letter ˹from Allah˺ for all ˹to read˺. | بل يريد كل امرئ منهم ان يؤتى صحفا منشرة
Surah 74 Al-Muddaththir, Ayah 53: But no! In fact, they do not fear the Hereafter. | كلا بل لا يخافون الاخرة
Surah 74 Al-Muddaththir, Ayah 54: Enough! Surely this ˹Quran˺ is a reminder. | كلا انه تذكرة
Surah 74 Al-Muddaththir, Ayah 55: So let whoever wills be mindful of it. | فمن شاء ذكره
Surah 74 Al-Muddaththir, Ayah 56: But they cannot do so unless Allah wills. He ˹alone˺ is worthy to be feared and entitled to forgive. | وما يذكرون الا ان يشاء الله هو اهل التقوى واهل المغفرة
Surah 75 Al-Qiyaama, Ayah 1: I do swear by the Day of Judgment! | لا اقسم بيوم القيامة
Surah 75 Al-Qiyaama, Ayah 2: And I do swear by the self-reproaching soul! | ولا اقسم بالنفس اللوامة
Surah 75 Al-Qiyaama, Ayah 3: Do people think We cannot reassemble their bones? | ايحسب الانسان الن نجمع عظامه
Surah 75 Al-Qiyaama, Ayah 4: Yes ˹indeed˺! We are ˹most˺ capable of restoring ˹even˺ their very fingertips. | بلى قادرين على ان نسوي بنانه
Surah 75 Al-Qiyaama, Ayah 5: Still people want to deny what is yet to come | بل يريد الانسان ليفجر امامه
Surah 75 Al-Qiyaama, Ayah 6: asking ˹mockingly˺, “When is this Day of Judgment?” | يسال ايان يوم القيامة
Surah 75 Al-Qiyaama, Ayah 7: But when the sight is stunned | فاذا برق البصر
Surah 75 Al-Qiyaama, Ayah 8: and the moon is dimmed | وخسف القمر
Surah 75 Al-Qiyaama, Ayah 9: and the sun and the moon are brought together | وجمع الشمس والقمر
Surah 75 Al-Qiyaama, Ayah 10: on that Day one will cry, “Where is the escape?” | يقول الانسان يومئذ اين المفر
Surah 75 Al-Qiyaama, Ayah 11: But no! There will be no refuge. | كلا لا وزر
Surah 75 Al-Qiyaama, Ayah 12: On that Day all will end up before your Lord. | الى ربك يومئذ المستقر
Surah 75 Al-Qiyaama, Ayah 13: All will then be informed of what they have sent forth and left behind. | ينبا الانسان يومئذ بما قدم واخر
Surah 75 Al-Qiyaama, Ayah 14: In fact, people will testify against their own souls | بل الانسان على نفسه بصيرة
Surah 75 Al-Qiyaama, Ayah 15: despite the excuses they come up with. | ولو القى معاذيره
Surah 75 Al-Qiyaama, Ayah 16: Do not rush your tongue trying to memorize ˹a revelation of˺ the Quran. | لا تحرك به لسانك لتعجل به
Surah 75 Al-Qiyaama, Ayah 17: It is certainly upon Us to ˹make you˺ memorize and recite it. | ان علينا جمعه وقرانه
Surah 75 Al-Qiyaama, Ayah 18: So once We have recited a revelation ˹through Gabriel˺, follow its recitation ˹closely˺. | فاذا قراناه فاتبع قرانه
Surah 75 Al-Qiyaama, Ayah 19: Then it is surely upon Us to make it clear ˹to you˺. | ثم ان علينا بيانه
Surah 75 Al-Qiyaama, Ayah 20: But no! In fact, you love this fleeting world | كلا بل تحبون العاجلة
Surah 75 Al-Qiyaama, Ayah 21: and neglect the Hereafter. | وتذرون الاخرة
Surah 75 Al-Qiyaama, Ayah 22: On that Day ˹some˺ faces will be bright | وجوه يومئذ ناضرة
Surah 75 Al-Qiyaama, Ayah 23: looking at their Lord. | الى ربها ناظرة
Surah 75 Al-Qiyaama, Ayah 24: And ˹other˺ faces will be gloomy | ووجوه يومئذ باسرة
Surah 75 Al-Qiyaama, Ayah 25: anticipating something devastating to befall them. | تظن ان يفعل بها فاقرة
Surah 75 Al-Qiyaama, Ayah 26: But no! ˹Beware of the day˺ when the soul reaches the collar bone ˹as it leaves˺ | كلا اذا بلغت التراقي
Surah 75 Al-Qiyaama, Ayah 27: and it will be said, “Is there any healer ˹who can save this life˺?” | وقيل من راق
Surah 75 Al-Qiyaama, Ayah 28: And the dying person realizes it is ˹their˺ time to depart | وظن انه الفراق
Surah 75 Al-Qiyaama, Ayah 29: and ˹then˺ their feet are tied together ˹in a shroud˺. | والتفت الساق بالساق
Surah 75 Al-Qiyaama, Ayah 30: On that day they will be driven to your Lord ˹alone˺. | الى ربك يومئذ المساق
Surah 75 Al-Qiyaama, Ayah 31: This denier neither believed nor prayed | فلا صدق ولا صلى
Surah 75 Al-Qiyaama, Ayah 32: but persisted in denial and turned away | ولكن كذب وتولى
Surah 75 Al-Qiyaama, Ayah 33: then went to their own people, walking boastfully. | ثم ذهب الى اهله يتمطى
Surah 75 Al-Qiyaama, Ayah 34: Woe to you, and more woe! | اولى لك فاولى
Surah 75 Al-Qiyaama, Ayah 35: Again, woe to you, and even more woe! | ثم اولى لك فاولى
Surah 75 Al-Qiyaama, Ayah 36: Do people think they will be left without purpose? | ايحسب الانسان ان يترك سدى
Surah 75 Al-Qiyaama, Ayah 37: Were they not ˹once˺ a sperm-drop emitted? | الم يك نطفة من مني يمنى
Surah 75 Al-Qiyaama, Ayah 38: Then they became a clinging clot ˹of blood˺, then He developed and perfected their form | ثم كان علقة فخلق فسوى
Surah 75 Al-Qiyaama, Ayah 39: producing from it both sexes, male and female. | فجعل منه الزوجين الذكر والانثى
Surah 75 Al-Qiyaama, Ayah 40: Is such ˹a Creator˺ unable to bring the dead back to life? | اليس ذلك بقادر على ان يحيي الموتى
Surah 76 Al-Insaan, Ayah 1: Is there not a period of time when each human is nothing yet worth mentioning? | هل اتى على الانسان حين من الدهر لم يكن شيئا مذكورا

Surah 76 Al-Insaan, Ayah 2: ˹For˺ indeed, We ˹alone˺ created humans from a drop of mixed fluids, ˹in order˺ to test them, so We made them hear and see. | انا خلقنا الانسان من نطفة امشاج نبتليه فجعلناه سميعا بصيرا
Surah 76 Al-Insaan, Ayah 3: We already showed them the Way, whether they ˹choose to˺ be grateful or ungrateful. | انا هديناه السبيل اما شاكرا واما كفورا
Surah 76 Al-Insaan, Ayah 4: Indeed, We have prepared for the disbelievers chains, shackles, and a blazing Fire. | انا اعتدنا للكافرين سلاسل واغلالا وسعيرا
Surah 76 Al-Insaan, Ayah 5: Indeed, the virtuous will have a drink ˹of pure wine˺—flavoured with camphor— | ان الابرار يشربون من كاس كان مزاجها كافورا
Surah 76 Al-Insaan, Ayah 6: ˹from˺ a spring where Allah’s servants will drink, flowing at their will. | عينا يشرب بها عباد الله يفجرونها تفجيرا
Surah 76 Al-Insaan, Ayah 7: They ˹are those who˺ fulfil ˹their˺ vows and fear a Day of sweeping horror | يوفون بالنذر ويخافون يوما كان شره مستطيرا
Surah 76 Al-Insaan, Ayah 8: and give food—despite their desire for it—to the poor, the orphan, and the captive | ويطعمون الطعام على حبه مسكينا ويتيما واسيرا
Surah 76 Al-Insaan, Ayah 9: ˹saying to themselves,˺ “We feed you only for the sake of Allah, seeking neither reward nor thanks from you. | انما نطعمكم لوجه الله لا نريد منكم جزاء ولا شكورا
Surah 76 Al-Insaan, Ayah 10: We fear from our Lord a horribly distressful Day.” | انا نخاف من ربنا يوما عبوسا قمطريرا
Surah 76 Al-Insaan, Ayah 11: So Allah will deliver them from the horror of that Day, and grant them radiance and joy | فوقاهم الله شر ذلك اليوم ولقاهم نضرة وسرورا
Surah 76 Al-Insaan, Ayah 12: and reward them for their perseverance with a Garden ˹in Paradise˺ and ˹garments of˺ silk. | وجزاهم بما صبروا جنة وحريرا
Surah 76 Al-Insaan, Ayah 13: There they will be reclining on ˹canopied˺ couches, never seeing scorching heat or bitter cold. | متكئين فيها على الارائك لا يرون فيها شمسا ولا زمهريرا
Surah 76 Al-Insaan, Ayah 14: The Garden’s shade will be right above them, and its fruit will be made very easy to reach. | ودانية عليهم ظلالها وذللت قطوفها تذليلا
Surah 76 Al-Insaan, Ayah 15: They will be waited on with silver vessels and cups of crystal— | ويطاف عليهم بانية من فضة واكواب كانت قواريرا
Surah 76 Al-Insaan, Ayah 16: crystalline silver, filled precisely as desired. | قوارير من فضة قدروها تقديرا
Surah 76 Al-Insaan, Ayah 17: And they will be given a drink ˹of pure wine˺ flavoured with ginger | ويسقون فيها كاسا كان مزاجها زنجبيلا
Surah 76 Al-Insaan, Ayah 18: from a spring there, called Salsabîl. | عينا فيها تسمى سلسبيلا
Surah 76 Al-Insaan, Ayah 19: They will be waited on by eternal youths. If you saw them, you would think they were scattered pearls. | ويطوف عليهم ولدان مخلدون اذا رايتهم حسبتهم لؤلؤا منثورا
Surah 76 Al-Insaan, Ayah 20: And if you looked around, you would see ˹indescribable˺ bliss and a vast kingdom. | واذا رايت ثم رايت نعيما وملكا كبيرا

Surah 76 Al-Insaan, Ayah 22: ˹And they will be told,˺ “All this is surely a reward for you. Your striving has been appreciated.” | ان هذا كان لكم جزاء وكان سعيكم مشكورا
Surah 76 Al-Insaan, Ayah 23: Indeed, it is We Who have revealed the Quran to you ˹O Prophet˺ in stages. | انا نحن نزلنا عليك القران تنزيلا
Surah 76 Al-Insaan, Ayah 24: So be patient with your Lord’s decree, and do not yield to any evildoer or ˹staunch˺ disbeliever from among them. | فاصبر لحكم ربك ولا تطع منهم اثما او كفورا
Surah 76 Al-Insaan, Ayah 25: ˹Always˺ remember the Name of your Lord morning and evening | واذكر اسم ربك بكرة واصيلا
Surah 76 Al-Insaan, Ayah 26: and prostrate before Him during part of the night, and glorify Him long at night. | ومن الليل فاسجد له وسبحه ليلا طويلا
Surah 76 Al-Insaan, Ayah 27: Surely those ˹pagans˺ love this fleeting world, ˹totally˺ neglecting a weighty Day ahead of them. | ان هؤلاء يحبون العاجلة ويذرون وراءهم يوما ثقيلا

Surah 76 Al-Insaan, Ayah 28: It is We Who created them and perfected their ˹physical˺ form. But if We will, We can easily replace them with others. | نحن خلقناهم وشددنا اسرهم واذا شئنا بدلنا امثالهم تبديلا
Surah 76 Al-Insaan, Ayah 29: Surely this is a reminder. So let whoever wills take the ˹Right˺ Way to their Lord. | ان هذه تذكرة فمن شاء اتخذ الى ربه سبيلا
Surah 76 Al-Insaan, Ayah 30: But you cannot will ˹to do so˺ unless Allah wills. Indeed, Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise. | وما تشاءون الا ان يشاء الله ان الله كان عليما حكيما
Surah 76 Al-Insaan, Ayah 31: He admits whoever He wills into His mercy. As for the wrongdoers, He has prepared for them a painful punishment | يدخل من يشاء في رحمته والظالمين اعد لهم عذابا اليما
Surah 77 Al-Mursalaat, Ayah 1: By those ˹winds˺ sent forth successively | والمرسلات عرفا
Surah 77 Al-Mursalaat, Ayah 2: and those blowing violently | فالعاصفات عصفا
Surah 77 Al-Mursalaat, Ayah 3: and those scattering ˹rainclouds˺ widely! | والناشرات نشرا
Surah 77 Al-Mursalaat, Ayah 4: And ˹by˺ those ˹angels˺ fully distinguishing ˹truth from falsehood˺ | فالفارقات فرقا
Surah 77 Al-Mursalaat, Ayah 5: and those delivering revelation | فالملقيات ذكرا
Surah 77 Al-Mursalaat, Ayah 6: ending excuses and giving warnings. | عذرا او نذرا
Surah 77 Al-Mursalaat, Ayah 7: Surely, what you are promised will come to pass. | انما توعدون لواقع
Surah 77 Al-Mursalaat, Ayah 8: So when the stars are put out | فاذا النجوم طمست
Surah 77 Al-Mursalaat, Ayah 9: and the sky is torn apart | واذا السماء فرجت

Surah 77 Al-Mursalaat, Ayah 11: and the messengers’ time ˹to testify˺ comes up— | واذا الرسل اقتت
Surah 77 Al-Mursalaat, Ayah 12: for which Day has all this been set? | لاي يوم اجلت
Surah 77 Al-Mursalaat, Ayah 13: For the Day of ˹Final˺ Decision! | ليوم الفصل
Surah 77 Al-Mursalaat, Ayah 14: And what will make you realize what the Day of Decision is? | وما ادراك ما يوم الفصل
Surah 77 Al-Mursalaat, Ayah 15: Woe on that Day to the deniers! | ويل يومئذ للمكذبين
Surah 77 Al-Mursalaat, Ayah 16: Did We not destroy earlier disbelievers? | الم نهلك الاولين
Surah 77 Al-Mursalaat, Ayah 17: And We will make the later disbelievers follow them. | ثم نتبعهم الاخرين
Surah 77 Al-Mursalaat, Ayah 18: This is how We deal with the wicked. | كذلك نفعل بالمجرمين
Surah 77 Al-Mursalaat, Ayah 19: Woe on that Day to the deniers! | ويل يومئذ للمكذبين
Surah 77 Al-Mursalaat, Ayah 20: Did We not create you from a humble fluid | الم نخلقكم من ماء مهين
Surah 77 Al-Mursalaat, Ayah 21: placing it in a secure place | فجعلناه في قرار مكين
Surah 77 Al-Mursalaat, Ayah 22: until an appointed time? | الى قدر معلوم
Surah 77 Al-Mursalaat, Ayah 23: We ˹perfectly˺ ordained ˹its development˺. How excellent are We in doing so! | فقدرنا فنعم القادرون
Surah 77 Al-Mursalaat, Ayah 24: Woe on that Day to the deniers! | ويل يومئذ للمكذبين
Surah 77 Al-Mursalaat, Ayah 25: Have We not made the earth a lodging | الم نجعل الارض كفاتا
Surah 77 Al-Mursalaat, Ayah 26: for the living and the dead | احياء وامواتا
Surah 77 Al-Mursalaat, Ayah 27: and placed upon it towering, firm mountains, and given you fresh water to drink? | وجعلنا فيها رواسي شامخات واسقيناكم ماء فراتا
Surah 77 Al-Mursalaat, Ayah 28: Woe on that Day to the deniers! | ويل يومئذ للمكذبين
Surah 77 Al-Mursalaat, Ayah 29: ˹The disbelievers will be told,˺ “Proceed into that ˹Fire˺ which you used to deny! | انطلقوا الى ما كنتم به تكذبون

Surah 77 Al-Mursalaat, Ayah 34: Woe on that Day to the deniers! | ويل يومئذ للمكذبين

Surah 77 Al-Mursalaat, Ayah 37: Woe on that Day to the deniers! | ويل يومئذ للمكذبين

Surah 77 Al-Mursalaat, Ayah 39: So if you have a scheme ˹to save yourselves˺, then use it against Me.” | فان كان لكم كيد فكيدون
Surah 77 Al-Mursalaat, Ayah 40: Woe on that Day to the deniers! | ويل يومئذ للمكذبين
Surah 77 Al-Mursalaat, Ayah 41: Indeed, the righteous will be amid ˹cool˺ shade and springs | ان المتقين في ظلال وعيون
Surah 77 Al-Mursalaat, Ayah 42: and any fruit they desire. | وفواكه مما يشتهون
Surah 77 Al-Mursalaat, Ayah 43: ˹They will be told,˺ “Eat and drink happily for what you used to do.” | كلوا واشربوا هنيئا بما كنتم تعملون
Surah 77 Al-Mursalaat, Ayah 44: Surely this is how We reward the good-doers. | انا كذلك نجزي المحسنين
Surah 77 Al-Mursalaat, Ayah 45: ˹But˺ woe on that Day to the deniers! | ويل يومئذ للمكذبين
Surah 77 Al-Mursalaat, Ayah 46: “Eat and enjoy yourselves for a little while, ˹for˺ you are truly wicked.” | كلوا وتمتعوا قليلا انكم مجرمون
Surah 77 Al-Mursalaat, Ayah 47: Woe on that Day to the deniers! | ويل يومئذ للمكذبين
Surah 77 Al-Mursalaat, Ayah 48: When it is said to them, “Bow down ˹before Allah,” they do not bow. | واذا قيل لهم اركعوا لا يركعون
Surah 77 Al-Mursalaat, Ayah 49: Woe on that Day to the deniers! | ويل يومئذ للمكذبين
Surah 77 Al-Mursalaat, Ayah 50: So what message after this ˹Quran˺ would they believe in? | فباي حديث بعده يؤمنون
Surah 78 An-Naba, Ayah 1: What are they asking one another about? | عم يتساءلون
Surah 78 An-Naba, Ayah 2: About the momentous news | عن النبا العظيم
Surah 78 An-Naba, Ayah 3: over which they disagree. | الذي هم فيه مختلفون
Surah 78 An-Naba, Ayah 4: But no! They will come to know. | كلا سيعلمون

Surah 78 An-Naba, Ayah 7: and ˹made˺ the mountains as ˹its˺ pegs | والجبال اوتادا
Surah 78 An-Naba, Ayah 8: and created you in pairs | وخلقناكم ازواجا
Surah 78 An-Naba, Ayah 9: and made your sleep for rest | وجعلنا نومكم سباتا
Surah 78 An-Naba, Ayah 10: and made the night as a cover | وجعلنا الليل لباسا
Surah 78 An-Naba, Ayah 11: and made the day for livelihood | وجعلنا النهار معاشا
Surah 78 An-Naba, Ayah 12: and built above you seven mighty ˹heavens˺ | وبنينا فوقكم سبعا شدادا
Surah 78 An-Naba, Ayah 13: and placed ˹in them˺ a shining lamp | وجعلنا سراجا وهاجا
Surah 78 An-Naba, Ayah 14: and sent down from rainclouds pouring water | وانزلنا من المعصرات ماء ثجاجا
Surah 78 An-Naba, Ayah 15: producing by it grain and ˹various˺ plants | لنخرج به حبا ونباتا
Surah 78 An-Naba, Ayah 16: and dense orchards? | وجنات الفافا
Surah 78 An-Naba, Ayah 17: Indeed, the Day of ˹Final˺ Decision is an appointed time— | ان يوم الفصل كان ميقاتا

Surah 78 An-Naba, Ayah 19: The sky will be ˹split˺ open, becoming ˹many˺ gates | وفتحت السماء فكانت ابوابا
Surah 78 An-Naba, Ayah 20: and the mountains will be blown away, becoming ˹like˺ a mirage. | وسيرت الجبال فكانت سرابا
Surah 78 An-Naba, Ayah 21: Indeed, Hell is lying in ambush | ان جهنم كانت مرصادا
Surah 78 An-Naba, Ayah 22: as a home for the transgressors | للطاغين مابا
Surah 78 An-Naba, Ayah 23: where they will remain for ˹endless˺ ages. | لابثين فيها احقابا

Surah 78 An-Naba, Ayah 26: a fitting reward. | جزاء وفاقا
Surah 78 An-Naba, Ayah 27: For they never expected any reckoning | انهم كانوا لا يرجون حسابا
Surah 78 An-Naba, Ayah 28: and totally rejected Our signs. | وكذبوا باياتنا كذابا
Surah 78 An-Naba, Ayah 29: And We have everything recorded precisely. | وكل شيء احصيناه كتابا
Surah 78 An-Naba, Ayah 30: ˹So the deniers will be told,˺ “Taste ˹the punishment˺, for all you will get from Us is more torment.” | فذوقوا فلن نزيدكم الا عذابا
Surah 78 An-Naba, Ayah 31: Indeed, the righteous will have salvation— | ان للمتقين مفازا
Surah 78 An-Naba, Ayah 32: Gardens, vineyards | حدائق واعنابا
Surah 78 An-Naba, Ayah 33: and full-bosomed maidens of equal age | وكواعب اترابا
Surah 78 An-Naba, Ayah 34: and full cups ˹of pure wine˺ | وكاسا دهاقا
Surah 78 An-Naba, Ayah 35: never to hear any idle talk or lying therein— | لا يسمعون فيها لغوا ولا كذابا
Surah 78 An-Naba, Ayah 36: a ˹fitting˺ reward as a generous gift from your Lord | جزاء من ربك عطاء حسابا

Surah 78 An-Naba, Ayah 38: on the Day the ˹holy˺ spirit and the angels will stand in ranks. None will talk, except those granted permission by the Most Compassionate and whose words are true. | يوم يقوم الروح والملائكة صفا لا يتكلمون الا من اذن له الرحمن وقال صوابا
Surah 78 An-Naba, Ayah 39: That Day is the ˹ultimate˺ truth. So let whoever wills take the path leading back to their Lord. | ذلك اليوم الحق فمن شاء اتخذ الى ربه مابا

Surah 79 An-Naazi'aat, Ayah 3: and those gliding ˹through heavens˺ swiftly | والسابحات سبحا

Surah 79 An-Naazi'aat, Ayah 13: But indeed, it will take only one ˹mighty˺ Blast | فانما هي زجرة واحدة
Surah 79 An-Naazi'aat, Ayah 14: and at once they will be above ground. | فاذا هم بالساهرة

Surah 79 An-Naazi'aat, Ayah 17: ˹commanding,˺ “Go to Pharaoh, for he has truly transgressed ˹all bounds˺. | اذهب الى فرعون انه طغى
Surah 79 An-Naazi'aat, Ayah 18: And say, ‘Would you ˹be willing to˺ purify yourself | فقل هل لك الى ان تزكى
Surah 79 An-Naazi'aat, Ayah 19: and let me guide you to your Lord so that you will be in awe ˹of Him˺?’” | واهديك الى ربك فتخشى

Surah 79 An-Naazi'aat, Ayah 26: Surely in this is a lesson for whoever stands in awe of ˹Allah˺. | ان في ذلك لعبرة لمن يخشى
Surah 79 An-Naazi'aat, Ayah 27: Which is harder to create: you or the sky? He built it | اانتم اشد خلقا ام السماء بناها
Surah 79 An-Naazi'aat, Ayah 28: raising it high and forming it flawlessly. | رفع سمكها فسواها
Surah 79 An-Naazi'aat, Ayah 29: He dimmed its night, and brought forth its daylight. | واغطش ليلها واخرج ضحاها
Surah 79 An-Naazi'aat, Ayah 30: As for the earth, He spread it out as well | والارض بعد ذلك دحاها
Surah 79 An-Naazi'aat, Ayah 31: bringing forth its water and pastures | اخرج منها ماءها ومرعاها

Surah 79 An-Naazi'aat, Ayah 38: and preferred the ˹fleeting˺ life of this world | واثر الحياة الدنيا
Surah 79 An-Naazi'aat, Ayah 39: the Hellfire will certainly be ˹their˺ home. | فان الجحيم هي الماوى
Surah 79 An-Naazi'aat, Ayah 40: And as for those who were in awe of standing before their Lord and restrained themselves from ˹evil˺ desires | واما من خاف مقام ربه ونهى النفس عن الهوى
Surah 79 An-Naazi'aat, Ayah 41: Paradise will certainly be ˹their˺ home. | فان الجنة هي الماوى

Surah 80 Abasa, Ayah 13: It is ˹written˺ on pages held in honour— | في صحف مكرمة
